loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
To help her husband make a living, Marina began selling Avon products and frozen foods in their village three years ago, and she has been able to earn a monthly income of PHP 4,500. She is glad that she is able to help her husband in providing for the needs of their children and hopes to further expand her business by borrowing a loan amount of PHP 5,000 to be used as additional capital for her retailing business.

Marina is a diligent businesswoman married to Elmer, who has worked as a family driver in Manila for seven years. They have two children, both of whom are studying. The couple joins hands to provide a better future for their children. The family lives in the village of Palattao, Naguilian, Isabela.

loans.use: Additional capital for her retail business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more soap, salt and vitenge in bulk.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a young man who is married with one child. Fadi owns a vehicle repair workshop in the Jenin Industrial area. Jenin is located in the northern West Bank and very close to the green line-borders with Israel. Since car repair costs much less in the West Bank than in Israel, Fadi has many customers, either Arabs inside Israel or locals from Jenin.

Fadi gained his car repair experience from his father who used to own this workshop. Four years ago, Fadi decided to buy this workshop from his father so as to have his own business, since he has other brothers.

In the workshop Fadi sells car tires and also fixes them, and repairs cars' motors; Fadi has two workers in this workshop in addition to himself, but in the mornings he is an employee at the maintenance department of Jenin muncipality. After finishing his work, he spends his time at the workshop. His father stays in the workshop in the morning just to see that everything is ok since he is elderly and can't do any actual work.

Fadi needs the loan to buy an auto crane, a car jack, tires and other equipment. Fadi appears in the picture at his business.

loans.use: Buy equipment for his workshop

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella, who lives in Lagos State, Nigeria, is 29 years old, married with 5 children, all in primary school.  She has been selling VCDs at retail prices from her market stall for the past two years and hopes to be a major VCDs distributor in the future.  Stella is very happy with her family and the growth of her business and hopes for a loan amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more VCDs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more VCDs to sell

loans.name: Erika

texts.en:
Erika is single. She runs a small enterprise selling women’s outer wear in the market called “Image” in her home town of Beregovo. Erika owns a nice, spacious vending kiosk where she offers a wide assortment of merchandise at reasonable prices. She is a young and promising entrepreneur with only a year and a half of market business experience. Presently, Erika already has 60,000 Grivnyas worth of inventory. Her net profit amounts to 5,500 Grivnyas a month.  
 
Erika is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional inventory for further retail sale in her kiosk. She says this type of merchandise is always in demand among her customers. Erika wants to continue expanding her venture and reach a stable standing in the competitive market.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Eufracio

texts.en:
Eufracio is a member of Virgen del Carmen de Patria, a communal bank comprising 23 members in Patria, a town on the edge of the Amazon rainforest - 8 hours by rough road from Cusco.  Eufracio, 60 years old, lives with his common-law wife in a home in Patria near his children and many of his grandchildren.

Eufracio is a meat distributor.  He learned his trade providing meat to the Peruvian army for many years in Quillabamba in his youth.  He has been living in Patria for 30 years and distributes meat mainly to local restaurants.  Eufracio is requesting a loan to buy livestock and a meat cutter so that he can improve and expand his business.  He hopes to increase his income to be better able to provide for his large family.

Eufracio appreciates your support, thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

Eufracion is pictured with some of his grandchildren.

loans.use: Buy livestock and a meat cutter

loans.name: Rodolfo Jose

texts.es:
El  señor Rodolfo José Jarquín López, labora en un hospital de Managua, es muy trabajador y siempre se ha preocupado por llevar el sustento a su hogar compuesto por sus padres.

Ha tomado la decisión de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda para briandarle un techo digno a sus padres y es por este motivo que solicita un crédito para la compra de zinc y perlines para así contribuir al mejoramiento de la vivinda.
texts.en:
Rodolfo José J. López works in a hospital in Managua, he is a very hard worker and is always very concerned about sustaining proper living conditions for his parents. He has decided to improve the conditions of their house and build a proper roof for them. With this loan he plans to buy zinc and timber to build the roof and in this manner contribute to the improvement of his parents home.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: housing improvement and addition

loans.name: Djamshedkhon

texts.en:
Djamshedkhon dedicates his time to driving a taxi and a microbus. He is a 30-year-old man, married with two children. He has about five years of experience in the public transportation field. The competition is rather high in this business, since there are so many people who need it. Djamshedkhon currently relies on a microbus for his public transport business, which he drives personally. His current request is so that he can maintain his vehicle, since this is the tool of his trade. So now Djamshedkhon is counting on your help and requesting a loan of 4500 somoni. With the loan, he’ll purchase spare parts for his microbus. With your support, Djamshedkhon will continue to progress. More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, and Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts in order to repair his microbus

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Twenty-six-year-old Cheryl T. farms for a living.  She is a single parent of two children; her oldest child is six years old.  She says that raising her children alone brings a lot of challenges.  They are her motivation to go on and face every challenge.  Cheryl does her best to sustain them and has started saving for their education. 

Cheryl needs additional capital for her business. She is asking for a loan of Php4,000 from CEVI.  She said she would use the loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Rosenette

texts.en:
Rosenette is 47-years-old, married with two children, and lives in the province of Antique with her husband. To supply additional income for her family, Rosenette manages her own business selling sweet delicacies to a loyal customer base in the community. Her specialty is “bukayo”, a dessert made from young coconut and sugar topped with sesame seeds. She is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP to expand her entrepreneurial venture as she truly enjoys making little indulgent treats for her patrons to enjoy. These treats are especially popular gifts and souvenirs for visiting Filipinos who now live abroad.

Rosenette has been a dedicated member of ASHI since 2006, demonstrating regular attendance at weekly meetings and steady repayments on previous loans. Her long-term goals are to expand her business, grow brand recognition of her venture “Rosenette’s Sweet Bukayo” throughout the province, and build savings to fund her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her sweet delicacy production and to increase the volume of her production.

loans.name: Lluvia Group

texts.es:
El grupo Lluvia está integrado por tres féminas trabajadoras las cuales han sido beneficiadas por kiva anteriormente. La coordinadora de este grupo es la señora Lorena del Socorro Calderón quien desde hace 8 años con unos ahorros compro maíz y leña con lo que empezó su negocio de tortillas.

Ella  por medio de los préstamos ha ido diversificando y aumentando su negocio ya que actualmente además de vender tortillas, comercializa frijoles cocidos y cuajadas.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Flor de María Umaña  la cual tiene una fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste en alimentos  fritos y Martha Lorena M. quien es propietaria de un cafetín.
texts.en:
The group, "Lluvia" (rain) is made up of three hard working ladies who have benefited from Kiva in the past. Lorena is the group's coordinator who eight years ago used her savings to buy corn and firewood and began her tortilla business. She, with the help of previous loans, began diversifying and growing her business. Now, in addition to tortillas, she also sells cooked beans and milk curd. The other members of the group include: Flor, who has a small fry restaurant, a popular type of restaurant that specializes in fried food; and Martha who has a small café.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Dominador

texts.en:
Dominador M. is from the village of Olango. He is 51 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Dominador plants and harvests rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over twenty-five years and earns approximately $800 per harvest.

In 2008, Dominador joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. He is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase fertilizers. This will be his fifth loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Omolala

texts.en: Omolala has a hair dressing salon where she makes lovely Nigerian and western hair styles for her customers. She also sells hair extensions. She loves this business because she makes her customers look good. She hopes to grow to become a world class salon in the future. She is 37 years old, married with two children. Her children are doing well at school. Her husband is a welder and he also supports their home. Omolala is requesting a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more hair extensions to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Madame Aminata C. est une femme de 35 ans et mère de 4 enfants qui vit avec ses enfant chez son époux dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Ayant abandonnée l’école dès à son jeune âge, elle s’intéressa très vite aux activités génératrices de revenus, à l’achat vente de savons et présentement à la préparation vente de glaces et de jus de boissons non alcoolisées.
Après un premier prêt correctement remboursé, elle est au deuxième qui sera utilisé pour acheter, un congélateur. 
Elle s'approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de république du Mali) et vend essentiellement chez elle même à domicile à une clientèle diverse et variée.
Elle compte réaliser  avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 65 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aminata C. is 35 years old and the mother of four children. She lives with her children and her husband in the North Hérémakono borough of Bougouni (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Having quit school at an early age, she became quickly interested in revenue-generating activities, such as buying and selling soap, and currently the preparation and sale of ice pops and non-alcoholic beverages. Having fully reimbursed her first loan, she is now requesting a second loan to buy a freezer. She resupplies in Bamoko (capital of the Republic of Mali) and sells mainly from her home, but also through home delivery, to a varied and diverse customer base. She hopes this loan will help her attain monthly earnings of 65,000 FCFA she will use to expand her business.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a freezer

loans.name: Lezel

texts.en:
Lezel D. is from the village of Tubod. She is 35 years old. Lezel is married. To make a living, Lezel owns & operates a "sari-sari" (general store). While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Lezel has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for this activity.

In 2008, Lezel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lezel has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Lezel is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Lezel from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: 
To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Minieta

texts.en:
Minieta P. is from P2-A Bañadero, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years of age. Minieta is married to Tomas P., a carpenter, and has no children. Mineita is engaged in operating a sari-sari (variety) store. Aside from that, she is also receiving support from her husband's work as a carpenter. Her main source of income comes from her sari-sari store business. Minieta has been engaged this business for one year already and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from this activity.

 In 2009, Minieta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Minieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Minieta is now requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to add to her capital for her sari-sari store business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Minieta from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store business

location.town: Ozamis-P2-A Bañadero, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Erdenebileg

texts.en:
Erdenebileg N. is 45 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Uvs province, western Mongolia. The two children attend a local middle school, while his wife washes cars out of their province. Erdenebileg makes furniture in the family home. He started this business in 1998 and has since made quality furnishings for the people of his town. He wants to one day own a small carpentry shop where he can expand his customer base, sell more furniture and further improve his family’s financial situation. 

In the 12 years of owning his business,  he has not only gained experience and knowledge in making quality furniture products, but he has also gained business knowledge. Erdenebileg is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to buy a car.

loans.use: To purchase a car

loans.name: Joven

texts.en:
Joven P. is from the town of Surallah. He is 34 years old, married, and has four small children. To make a living, he plants and harvests rice to sell. He has been engaged in his business for over seven years.

Joven joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. He says he likes its services and he gets ideas from other members on how to improve his business.

Joven is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. This will be his 3rd loan from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Livia

texts.es:
Livia nació en Urubamba a una hora y diez minutos de la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad junto con su esposo y sus tres hijos de las cuales uno es independiente. Antes, Livia se dedica a la venta de jora en el mercado modelo de Urubamba y también hacia chicha, pero sus hijos le motivaron que cambiara de negocio porque era muy sacrificado el trabajo. Livia abrió una tienda de venta de colchones y frazadas en su domicilio. Ya es un año que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

Con su próximo préstamo, Livia que espera recibir S/. 2000 nuevos soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para comprar colchones.    

En el año 1994 se abrió el banco comunal “Señor de Torrechayoc”, pero Livia es una de las fundadoras del banco comunal y le va muy bien. El nombre del banco comunal es en homenaje al patrón jurado de la ciudad de Urubamba pues todos los socios le tienen fe.
texts.en:
Livia was born in Urubamba, a city located about 70 minutes away from the city of Cusco. She lives together with her husband and three of their children, one is independent. Livia used to sell Jora and chicha drink, a common Peruvian corn drink, in the market of Urubamba. But her children motivated her to change her business because that type of business was too labor intensive. Livia opened up a mattress store in a section of her home. She has been running the business for about a year now and it has been profitable, thanks to the hard work she has invested. The loan requested is in the amount of S/.2000 neuvos soles. She would like to expand her business by purchasing more mattresses. In 1994 the community bank named The Man from Torrechayoc was established and Livia was one of its founding members. All of the members are religious so the name of the community bank was chosen in honor of the patron saint of the city.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase mattresses

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia has been practising mixed farming for the past 13 years in Nkubu town, eastern Kenya. She has employed one farmhand. Her farm produces bananas and milk which she sells locally. She is also employed as a caretaker at a local school for the mentally handicapped.

She has requested this loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to start a poultry project. She says that the income from this loan will enable her to pay school fees for her children and to build a decent house. She also plans to use the income to purchase a piece of land. She, however, faces the challenge of lack of a proper market for her products.

Anastasia is 36 years old. She is married with three children aged 5, 10 and 15. All the children attend school.

In the future, she intends to improve her farming by buying two dairy cows, upgrading her poultry farming and improving her banana farming. She is so happy because Juhudi has helped her to improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: To start a poultry project

loans.name: Rosa Aurora

texts.es:
Joven emprendedora de 39 años, soltera con un hijo, microempresaria, se dedica a la distribución de compra y venta de cervezas al por mayor y menor, actualmente tiene 150 cajas de cervezas, lleva ocho años desempeñándose en este negocio,  nos cuenta que le va muy bien, Rosa muestra siempre una valentía y le pone mucho entusiasmo a su trabajo, a pesar de los desafíos que pueda existir, a ella le sirve mucho para mejorar y darle lo mejor de si misma. 
Rosa también es propietaria de unas cabinas de internet, quien es su único hijo quien le apoya en la atención y administración de dicho negocio en horarios de la mañana, debido a sus estudios, ella se empeña mucho por trabajar e incrementar sus ganancias, en el futuro piensa expandir, mejorar y crecer como una empresa exportadora de cervecería. Darle la mejor educación a su hijo, y ofrecerle las comodidades que el requiere y espera alcanzar mas adelante..

El préstamo que se le otorgó le será útil para aumentar su capital, comprar mas cajas de cerveza, y así incrementar  más su negocio.
texts.en:
A young, 29 year old entrepreneur, single, mother of one son, micro business ower, she is a beer retailer and wholesaler. She currently has 150 cases of beer and has been in this business for 8 years. She tells us that she does quite well. Rosa is daring and always puts much enthusiasm into her work despite any challenge that might arise. Her work is of great value to her because it encourages her to improve and give the best of herself. Rosa also owns some Internet access booths and it’s her only son who helps her run this business during the morning hours because of his studies. She strives to increase her profits and plans to expand in the future, to improve and grow as a beer exporter, to provide her son with the best education possible and offer him the comforts he needs and expects to reach later on. The loan that was granted will be useful to increase working capital; she wil buy more cases of beer to increase her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more cases of beer.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 42 years old and is widowed with three children. She has been running a greengrocer shop for fifteen years and also farms to supplement her family’s income. She says that as a mother and the sole breadwinner in her family, she strives to raise her children.

Since she became a member of Faulu Kenya, Susan’s living standard has improved. She has requested 30,000 KES to buy a heifer (a young female cow that has not borne a calf). She hopes to increase her business stock in the future. She also dreams of expanding her farming to a larger scale.

loans.use: To buy a heifer

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: This is 40-year-old Vincent B.. He is married and has four children, aged 13, 10, 7 and 1. He has 15 additional dependents, who live with him to help assist his family. In 2000, Vincent established his building materials and spare parts business and now serves the entire Bo community. He began his business to generate income and to take care of his family. Working six days a week and nine hours a day, he earns about 3146000 SLL every month from this business. Vincent would like a loan in the amount of 3000000 SLL in order to buy cement, iron rods and paint. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 314600 SLL. In the future, Vincent plans to become an international businessman. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy additional building materials

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth V. is from the town of Banga. She is 35 years old. Ruth is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Ruth owns & operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Ruth says she wants her family to be happy and healthy.

Ruth joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Ruth has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Ruth is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Nayanjin

texts.en: Nayanjin O. is 58 years old and lives with her husband in their own apartment in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of  Mongolia. All of her children are grown up and live on their own. Her husband helps with her business by transporting dairy products from the countryside using his own truck while Nayanjin operates a retail dairy business at Harhorin, second biggest market in Ulaanbaatar. She began the business in 2000 renting a stall at where she sells the products. Since then, her business has become very successful and her working capital exceeds 8,000,000 MNT today. Her monthly sales income has reached 120,000 MNT. For the future, Nayanjin says, " I plan to continue operating my business successfully and hope to purchase my own store in the near future."  She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase and preserve a large amount of dairy products in the winter when availability of such products decrease.

loans.use: To purchase and preserve a large amount of dairy products.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel R. is from Linao East, Tuguegarao City. He is 38 years old. Samuel is married and has three school-aged children. 

To make a living, Samuel provides motorcycle transport services to local community members. Samuel has been engaged in his business for more than four years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Samuel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Samuel has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. He is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be the third loan taken by Samuel from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Kea

texts.en:
Mrs. Kea H. (pictured with her husband) is 28 year old and her husband, Mr. Mada Moeun, is 27 years old. They have been married since 2007 and just had a young son. The family lives about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Mrs. Kea H. and her husband are farmers. They grow cauliflower on their farmland in the village where they live. Kea is requesting her first loan of $600 to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticides to maintain her cauliflower farm.

loans.use: To use for farming

loans.name: Cristino

texts.es:
Don Cristino es un agricultor se dedica a la siembra de Hortalizas, tiene 54 años de edad, vive con su esposa Maritza, tienen una hija de 4 años de edad llamada Estefani, la historia de don Cristino en la agricultura es que él la inicio después de recibir asistencia técnica por agrónomos quienes le enseñaban  el proceso de la siembra, él trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano y hasta en las noches ya que las hortalizas requieren de mucho cuidado.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo que lo invertirá en la siembra de más Hortalizas y la producción de dulce de panela que es un proceso de molienda de caña de azúcar, este préstamo le será útil ya que los préstamo son una herramienta de trabajo para la producción y comercialización de los productos agropecuarios que les permite crecer y desarrollarse aunque los riesgos en las hortalizas son varios pues son delicadas y puede llegarles la plaga y dañar todos los frutos.
Su Objetivo es seguir trabajando en la siembra de hortalizas ya que una buena siembra obtiene buena producción la cual es muy rentable y genera de ella los ingresos para ayudar a sus hijos y mejora su condición de vida velando siempre por su salud, alimentación y educación.
texts.en:
Don Cristino is a vegetable farmer. He is 54 years old and lives with his wife Maritza. They have a four year old daughter named Estafani. Don Cristino’s history as a farmer started when he received technical assistance from agronomists who taught him the process of planting. He works every day from the early morning hours until nighttime because the vegetables require much attention.

He is currently requesting a loan to invest in planting more vegetables and producing brown sugar, which involves processing and milling sugar cane. This loan will help him acquire the equipment he needs to produce and sell his agricultural products so that he can grow and develop. Growing vegetables has risks since they are delicate and can be infested with disease that could damage all the fruit.

His goal is to continue working and planting vegetables so that he can obtain good production that is profitable and will generate income to help his children. With this he hopes to improve their living conditions so that they will always be healthy, well-fed, and educated.

loans.use: Invest in growing vegetables and producing brown sugar

loans.name: Kibari

texts.en:
Kibari has been practicing mixed farming for forty years in Kisii town in western Kenya. His main products are maize, beans, potatoes, sugarcane and tea, which are sold locally. Farming is his only source of income. 

He has requested this loan of 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that this loan will help him acquire a quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. His major challenges have been the lack of enough capital for expansion and a poor road network. He would like to open an agrovet shop in the future (providing animal health services and farm supplies).

Kibari is 62 years old and married with fifteen children who are between the ages of 13 and 30. Two of the children are currently in school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva D. C. is from the village of Langcataon, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 42 years old. Eva is married. To make a living, Eva operates a tailoring business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Eva has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Eva joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eva has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles and threads. Eva is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Eva from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Kakoma Twebeiseho Group-Bushenyi

texts.en: K. Mary, 59 years old, has been operating a general merchandise retail business in Kakoma-Bushenyi for the past 4 years. She says her set objective in starting this business was to establish a dependable source of income for herself and her family of five, her husband included. In her shop, she sells a variety of commodities popular with many village folk. Mary also has an up-and-coming banana sales business which she anticipates will grow provided she buys more manure for her banana gardens. This business generates Mary 100,000 UGX weekly. With this loan, she is going to purchase more retail commodities such as rice, beans, maize flour, bread, sugar, etc. to resell at her shop.

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities

loans.name: Carlota Soledad

texts.es:
La Señora. Carlota B. es socia del banco comunal Reina de la Nube, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, tiene una belleza natural, cultural y arquitectónica la misma que es admirada por propios y extraños, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones siendo muy amables y cordiales.

Doña Carlota tiene 33 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 13 y 11 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en colegio  y su segundo hijo en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en una carpintería, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su mamá.
 
La Señora Carlota realiza la limpieza en casas dos veces a la semana, actividad que  tiene ya algún tiempo. Hace cuatro meses se dedica a la cría de cuyes en su casa.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más cuyes y así crecer en el negocio. Se encuentra en su octavo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y en todo este tiempo ha logrado tener muy buenas amigas. Su meta es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Sra. Carlota B. is a member of the Communal Bank “Reina de la Nube” (Queen of the Cloud). She lives in the the city of Cuenca. This city experiences cold weather, but it has natural beauty, culture, and architecture that is admired by locals and outsiders. The people are friendly, courteous, and maintain their culture and traditions.

Doña Carlota is 33 years old, married, and has two children (ages 13 and 11). Her oldest child is in high school while her second child attends school in the city. Her husband works at a carpentry shop. She does not have her own house, so her family lives in the home of her mother.

Sra. Carlota cleans houses twice a week. She has held this job for some time. Four months ago, she began raising guinea pigs at home.

The money from this loan will be invested in the purchase of more guinea pigs so that she can grow her business. Carlota is receiving her eighth loan from the Communal Bank. She has made very good friends throughout this time. Her goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: Purchase guinea pigs

loans.name: Floribel De La Paz

texts.es:
Floribel, reside en San Miguel, tiene  35 años de edad, vive con su madre y tiene 3 hijos Deris de 12 años, Kelvin 10 y keylin 4 años de edad, Floribel se dedica a la venta de frutas de temporada como, sandia, melón, piña, la vende en trozos y en bolsas plásticas, por las calles de la ciudad de San Miguel, de 10:00am hasta las 6:00pm.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de frutas (mango, manzanas, melones, sandias), esta compra es importante para el negocio, pues quiere tener la suficiente para poder abastecer a muchos clientes, ya que las frutas tienen demanda y de la cual quiere estar preparada.
Floribel tiene como objetivo, velar por las necesidades de sus hijos y su madre, trabajar diariamente para proveer para estos la alimentación que necesitan, la salud y educación.
texts.en:
Floribel lives in San Miguel.  She’s 35 years old and lives with her mother. She has three children: Deris, 12, Kelvin, 10 and Keylin, 4. Floribel sells seasonal fruit like: watermelon, melon and pineapple.  She sells them in chunks in plastic bags along San Miguel’s streets.  She works from 10am until 6pm.

She is asking for a loan to buy fruit (mangoes, apples, melons, watermelons).  This is an important purchase for her business because she wants to have enough to satisfy the needs of many customers because fruit is in high demand and she wants to be prepared.

Floribel’s goal is to watch after her mother’s and her children’s needs, to work every day to provide them with food, health and education.

loans.use: To buy fruit (mangoes, apples, melons, watermelons)

loans.name: Noemi Floresca's Group

texts.en:
Noemi F. is from the village of Almaguer South Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 38 years old. Noemi is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Noemi F.'s Group.

Noemi is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Noemi operates a direct-selling business, providing AVON cosmetics and apparel products in the local community. Noemi has been engaged in her business for more than 3 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Noemi joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Noemi has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Noemi is requesting a new loan of 23,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Noemi from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita G. is from the village of Anito, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 51 years old. Carmelita is married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Carmelita owns & operates a specialized retail store selling used clothing, or ukay-ukay, in the local community. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Carmelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional used clothing. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Carmelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products, like used clothing

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is 66 years old, married to Anjeline and they have four children aged between 30, 25, 20 and 18 years old. He owns a farm in Mutwot trading centre and keeps dairy cows. He has been in the business for a period of 20 years getting a monthly income of KES 4,000.

Jimmy has gone further and borrowed a loan of KES. 40,000 from KADET LTD. This is his fourth term loan after he paid the previous loans successfully. He wishes to use the money to improve the farm and add more dairy cows. The profits will be used to educate his children to higher levels.

He hopes to have a happy family.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mhammad

texts.ar: محمد متزوج وهو اب لولد يعمل منذ 9 سنوات في سنترال للاتصالات يحب عمله وهو متجدد فيه ويطوره بشكل مستمر يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء معدات جديدة للسنترال وتحسين الوضع المادي والاجتماعي له زبائن من اصدقاء وجيران اقارب له بعض الصعوبات المادية التي تعيق تقدمه في العمل حيث انه بحاجة الى رأس المال كان للقرض السابق من المجموعة الاثر الجيد في تحسين العمل وتطوير الذات وكان يلقى الدعم الكامل من الاسرة محمد اب حنون يحب اولاده ويريد ان يؤمن لهم كل ما يلزم من تعليم ومستلزمات الحياة اليومية
texts.en: Mohammad is married, and his is the father of one child. He has worked for the past nine years in a communications store. He likes his work, and in addition, he likes to continuously improve his business. With a loan from al-Majmoua, he would like to buy new equipment for his store in order to improve his financial situation and social status. He has customers from among his friends, neighbors and relatives, but he is having some material difficulties which are hindering him from progressing in his business. Specifically, he is in need of capital. He last loan from al-Majmoua had a positive impact on his business and helped him to develop himself, and he received the full support of his family during it. Mohammad is a caring father who loves his children, and he wants to secure for them everything that they need including an education and all of their every-day needs.

loans.use: buy new equipment for his communications store.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Aminata. She is married to a businessman and has two children, aged 13 and 11 years. She has one additional dependent,  her husband’s niece, who is living with them to make it possible for her to attend a good school.  

In 2006, Aminata established her provision, drinks and toiletries business. Aminata started her business as a means of getting enough income to help her husband provide a livelihood for their family. Working seven days a week and 16 hours a day, she earns about 1,700,000 SLL every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Aminata requires a loan in order to buy more food and drinks for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 200,000 SLL. 

In the future, Aminata plans to send her children to the University of Sierra Leone. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for her store.

loans.name: Orlanda Monserrate

texts.es:
En San Ignacio de la  parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal San Ignacio De Colon. Lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Orlanda, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos mayores de edad,  uno de ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.
 
Ella es una mujer muy dedicada al hogar y a su familia, pero para generar sus propios ingresos y de esta forma ayudar a su esposo con la dura tarea del hogar, hace doce años decidió poner un negocio en su casa en el cual vende los deliciosos encebollados de pescado, negocio que solo abre los viernes, sábado y domingos, nos cuenta que en estos días ella vende muchos platos ya que cerca de su casa se reúnen muchas personas en estos días y allí ella aprovecha para vender todo, su esposo y su hijo le ayudan en su labor.

Ella necesita este crédito para comprar víveres para preparar sus deliciosos platos y  sillas que le hacen falta. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que da la institución.
 
Sus sueños son tener un gran negocio en otro lugar más concurrido.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the San Ignacio de Colon community bank meet in San Ignacio, in Colon parish, in the city of Portoviejo.  This area is known for its hard-working people who farm and raise livestock.

Here we meet 52 year-old Orlanda who is married and has two grown-up children.  One of her children still lives with her.  Her husband farms.

Orlanda is a woman who is very committed to her home and her family but, in order to make her own income and thereby help her husband with the hard task of supporting their household, twelve years ago she decided to set up a business in her home where she sells delicious 'encebollados de pescado' (fish and onion soup).  She only opens her business on Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays and tells us that on those days she sells a lot of dishes since many people meet up near her home on those days and so she makes the most of this and sells everything.  Her husband and her son help her in her work.

Orlanda needs this loan to buy food products which she will use to prepare her delicious dishes.  She will also buy some chairs that she needs.  Orlanda is a founding member of her community bank and she likes it because of the benefits that the institution provides.

Orlanda's dream is to own a large business in a busier place.

loans.use: to buy food products and chairs

loans.name: Serzhik

texts.en:
Serzhik was born in 1983 in Hand village, Syunik marz.  He works as a machine operator and, at the same time, he has done farming for over 7 years. On his farm he has 2 cows, 2 pigs and 10 bee hives.  Also, Serzhik grows oats as fodder for his farm animals. His wife takes care of their two little daughters and helps Serzhik in farming. They work very hard and thus they are able to support their young family. 

Serzhik needs a 400,000 AMD loan to buy diesel fuel for his reaper, and wax papers and frames for his beehives.

loans.use: to buy diesel fuel for the reaper, and also wax papers and frames for his beehives

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson has been practicing farming in Narok for the last five years. He is 28 years old, single and supports his parents.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan. He has repaid all his previous loans well and in good time.

He plans to use this loan to buy maize seeds and fertilizer, and also to hire temporary field workers to assist him in planting. In the future, he hopes to become a leading farmer in Narok town.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is 40 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children. Two of her children are currently in school. Justine has a business of selling clothes, which she has had for 3 years.  She has rental houses.  

To help expand her business, Justine has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Justine hopes to generate greater profits and buy basic needs for her family.  In the future, Justine hopes to open up another branch that sells clothes.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is married and has six children. Her oldest child is 30 years old and her youngest is only 8. Jocelyn's husband works as a farmer and driver, and she makes a living by growing rice on a field she and her husband own in the town of Banga, South Cotabato. Jocelyn does her best to keep their farm productive, and continually hopes and prays for the good health of her family. She is applying for this loan to buy five sacks of seeds, four sacks of fertilizer and one quart of herbicides. Jocelyn is hoping that his loan will help her achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Leonor Cristina

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres 13 De Septiembre.

En este lugar vive la señora Leonor, tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen siete hijos, todos son mayores de edad y cuatro de ellos aun viven en su casa, también vive con ella un nieto de 7 años que está en la escuela y que lo ha criado desde pequeño y es como su hijo. Su esposo es guardia de seguridad.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que para ganarse algo para propio y con esto contribuir a los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de sabanas y edredones, tiene un pequeño local en su  casa aunque dos días  a la semana también realiza sus ventas  puerta a puerta, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Picoaza ya que allá le entregan más barato. Lleva en este negocio tres años y le está yendo bastante bien.

Este crédito es para comprar sabanas, edredones y almohadas. Lleva más de dos años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado a salir adelante.

Su sueño es ver a su nieto grande y estudiado.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabi, a city known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the communal bank "Mujeres 13 de Septiembre" meets every 15 days.

This is where Leonor, aged 55, lives.  She is married and has 7 children, all of whom are now adults.  Four of them still live in her house, and she also lives with a 7 year-old grandson who is in school and who she has raised as her own since he was small.  Her husband is a security guard.

Leonor is a great housewife who, in order to earn something on her own and contribute to the household expenses, has a business selling bed sheets and comforters.  She has a small store in her house, and 2 days a week she also sells door-to-door.  She sells her goods on credit, and collects every 15 days.  She goes to purchase her merchandise in Picoaza, since there she can find the goods at the lowest cost.  She has had this business for 3 years, and she is doing quite well.

This loan will be used to buy sheets, comforters and pillows.  She has been in her communal bank for more than 2 years, and she likes it because of the loans that have helped her to get ahead.

Her dream is to see her grandchild grow up and become educated.

loans.use: to buy sheets, comforters and pillows

loans.name: Percy

texts.en:
Percy  is member of PMPC living in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married and has two kids. Her children are already working. 

Aside from work she is also engaged in a small-scale retail business. She's been doing this business for more than 20 years and has earnings of 6,000 PHP a month for this business alone.

 Percy has requested a loan of 35,000 PHP to purchase more beauty products for her cosmetics business. She has been a member of the co-op for almost four years.

loans.use: to purchase more beauty products for her cosmetic sales.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es: Rolando, de 40 años, convive con Guadalupe, su esposa. Ambos tienen un hijo: Cristian, de 14 años de edad. En unión familiar los tres viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la ciudad de Tarma.Hace 16 años, esté trabajador hombre se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, ovino, vacuno y porcino; el cual enseba y mata, para luego comercializarlo en su carnicería que con esfuerzo y mucha dedicación adquirió en el mercado modelo de su ciudad; los días de mayor venta son los jueves y domingos. Pero no solo a ello se dedica Rolando, él también incursionó hace 3 años, al trasporte público, cubriendo las rutas de Tarma - Palcamayo, obteniendo un ingreso extra; cuenta que mientras trabaja todos los días con el auto, su esposa se dedica al negocio de carnes. Ahora él, está pensando adquirir un auto mejor implementado, con el que podrá trasportar a los pobladores de la ciudad al campo, asimismo está pensando adquirir máquinas para cortar carne, y así tener una carnicería de producción; con embutidos de toda variedad, con ello espera tener mejores ingresos para darle a su hijo una educación de nivel.Él pertenece al banco comunal “Mirando a un futuro mejor” y este es el duodécimo crédito con MFP, donde demuestra responsabilidad y seriedad, ya que es presidente de su banco comunal, donde trabaja con ahínco y mucha responsabilidad en el desarrollo constante de sus integrantes.Rolando de recibir su apoyo; comprará con el dinero solicitado varios kilos de carne de animal, ovino, vacuno y porcino. Con esto piensa abastecerá su carnicería como acostumbra.
texts.en:
40-year-old Rolando lives with his wife Guadalupe.  The couple have one son: 14-year-old Cristian.  The three of them live together in their own home which is located in the city of Tarma.  For 16 years, this hard-working man has been buying and selling sheep, cows and pigs.  He fattens them, kills them and then sells them in the butcher's shop which he acquired in the 'Mercado Modelo' market in his city through a lot of effort and commitment.  His busiest days are Thursdays and Sundays.  However, Rolando doesn't just carry out this one business, he also started providing a public transport service three years ago.  He covers the Tarma - Palcamayo route which makes him additional income.  He tells us that while he is out working with his car every day his wife looks after the butcher's shop.

Rolando plans to buy a better car and also to have a better butcher's shop with all kinds of cold meats and sausages.  He hopes that this will make him better income which he can use to provide his daughter with a good education.  Rolando belongs to the "Mirando a un futuro mejor" community bank and this is his 12th loan from MFP.  He is a responsible and serious member of his bank as he is the bank's president.  He works diligently and very responsibly to constantly help the members of the bank move forward and develop.  With your support, Rolando will use the money he has requested to buy several kilos of lamb, beef and pork.  He will use this to stock his butcher's shop.

loans.use: to stock his butcher's shop

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a widow with four children ages 11, 17, 28, and 32. They are all in school, except for the youngest. For the past 18 years, Mariam has owned a restaurant where she sells African dishes. Her restaurant income helps her care for her family. 

Mariam is requesting a loan to buy sugar, beans, and rice to cook in the restaurant. With the profits from her loan, she would like to start building a new house and increase her capital.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila tiene 54 años es una mujer fuerte. Ella está casada con Juan, su esposo desde hace 15  años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, pero solo viven con 3 de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas. Su situación económica es muy compleja. A pesar de su avanzada edad, ella continúa laborando para el cuidado de sus hijos, quienes aún se encuentran estudiando. Además cuenta que su esposo está delicado de salud, por lo que tiene que cuidarlo. Su principal actividad es una pequeña tienda de comestibles donde vende productos de primera necesidad. A la vez teje chompas de lana de diferentes colores y tamaños. Los mismos que vende a los comerciantes que la visitan constantemente. “Me duele mucho los huesos”, afirma mientras comenta que tiene la enfermedad de osteoporosis; por lo que no puede trasladarse con facilidad. Pero a pesar de los problemas que tiene, continúa trabajando para el futuro de sus hijos a quienes desea brindarles la educación y calidad de vida que se merecen.  Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Telarmachay” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar con sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. 
Lucila de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varias madejas de lana para sus tejidos. Además de insumos necesarios de primera necesidad para su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Lucila is 54 years old and she is a strong woman. She is married to Juan, her husband of 15 years. They have 4 children together but only 3 of them live with them. They own their home and it is located in the locality of San Pedro de Cajas. Her financial situation is very complicated. Despite her advanced age, she continues to work for the support of her children. They are still in school. Additionally, her husband is has health issues and she needs to take care of him. Her primary activity is a small grocery store, selling basic consumer goods. Concurrently she knits wool sweaters in various colors and sizes. She sells them to the merchants who visit her constantly. "It's hard on my bones", she affirms when she was commenting on her osteoporosis condition. It is hard for her to move around. But despite her problems she continues to work for the sake of her children's future. She wants to provide them with an education and the quality of life that they deserve. She is a member of the communal bank "Telarmachay" and this is her second loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She hopes to receive the support from each of you to continue on with her objectives. She promises to be on time with her loan payments. 

Upon receiving her support, Lucila will invest the funds requested in the purchase of several skeins of wool for her knitting projects. She will also purchase basic consumer goods for her grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase skeins of wool and basic consumer goods to supply her store.

loans.name: Uguloi

texts.ru: Угулой  трудолюбивая и ответственная женщина. Она  уже 7 лет занимается куплей и продажей мелкого и крупного рогатого скота. Угулой начала свою предпринимательскую деятельность с купли продажи кур. Она вдова у нее 5 детей. Старший сын помогает ей в бизнесе. Угулой приобретает  скот на базаре и в течении 20 дней занимается откормом, после продает их по более высокой цене. Этот  вид деятельности приносит прибыль семейному бюджету. Угулой так как вдова она думает о будущем своих детей. Для развития  и расширения бизнеса она хочет приобрести крупный и мелкий бизнес, но у Угулой нет нужной суммы. Она просит займ на сумму 2000$ США.  Угулой рассчитывает на вашу помощь и поддержку.
texts.en: Uguloi is a hard-working and responsible woman.  She has been involved in buying and selling small livestock and cattle for seven years.  Uguloi started her entrepreneurship with buying and selling chickens.  She is a widow and has five children.  Her oldest son helps her with the business.  Uguloi buys livestock at a market, fattens it up over the course of 20 days and then sells it at higher prices.  This business bring in a profit for the family budget.  Because Uguloi is a widow, she thinks of her children's future.  In order to develop and expand her business, Uguloi wants to buy cattle and small livestock, but does not have the necessary funds for it.  She is requesting a loan in the sum of $2000.  Uguloi counts on your help and support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, vive con su esposa y cuatro hijos, él administra una tienda, en la cual ofrece artículos de primera necesidad, este negocio tiene más de 20 años y junto a su familia atienden a los clientes.
Actualmente Juan solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos como aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, galletas, gaseosas, estos son los que a diario vende y que siempre sus clientes le buscan, por eso está el interés de comprar un pedido para abastecer el inventario del negocio para un buen tiempo.
La proyección de Juan es apoyar a sus hijos en el desarrollo de una carrera, además de que el negocio crezca y puedan mejorar la situación económica.
texts.en:
Juan lives with his wife and four children.  He runs a shop in which he sells basic necessities.  The business is over 20 years old and he serves his customers with the help of his family.

Now Juan requests a loan to buy products like oil, sugar, toilet paper, cookies, and soft drinks.  He sells these products daily and his customers are always looking for them.  The reason he is interested in a loan is to stock his business’ inventory for a while.

Juan envisions supporting his children in developing their careers, as well as growing his business and improving their financial situation.

loans.use: buy oil, sugar, toilet paper, cookies and soft drinks.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is 26 years old and lives in west point. She is single and has three children aged 2 to 8 years old. For the past three years, she has been selling eggs, bread, and soft drinks near the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase eggs by the cartoon, bread, and soft drinks for her business. She likes her business because of the way her customers buy. She plans to become a big businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase eggs by the carton, bread, and soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Anaam

texts.en:
Anaam is a 53-year-old woman, who has three sons and one daughter; one of the sons has got married and started his own family. 

Anaam has been working beside her husband making sweets and pastries for the last 5 years using her husband's experience in making sweets to be able to support their family and children.

Now Anaam and her husband want to increase their productivity by making larger amounts of sweets since at this time of the year, the holiday season, the number of orders gets high. So to be able to serve all the customers, Anaam has applied for a loan to buy more ingredients that are needed to make those sweets and pastries.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients that are needed to make sweets and pastries.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 29 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Liza works very hard to provide for her family.

Liza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan for 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more goods to sell in her store.

Liza has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

Liza would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.es:
Valeriana es socia del Banco Comunal “Ahorro es Progreso”  ubicado en la provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 67 años de edad, es viuda y tiene seis hijos independientes.  Cuenta con estudios de educación primaria.

Trabaja desde hace cuatro años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que incrementó a su negocio de venta de prendas de vestir.

Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1500.00 nuevo soles, comprará un fardo de prendas de vestir (chompas, blusas, etc.) para su negocio, la  mercadería la vende en la localidad de Puno y Cusco, trabaja sola en el negocio.

Su sueño es acabar de construir su casa y seguir con el negocio.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la unión de las socias y el ahorro.
texts.en:
Valeriana is a member of the Ahorro Es Progreso [Saving Is Progress] village bank, located in the province and department of Puno. She is 67 years old and a widow with six adult children. She went to school through the eighth grade.

She's been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for four years. Her first loan was in the amount of 300 soles, which she invested in her clothes-selling business.

With this new loan for 1500 soles, she will buy a bundle of clothing (sweaters, blouses, etc.) for her business. She will sell the merchandise in Puno and Cusco. She runs the business all on her own.

Her dream is to finish building her house and to keep her business going.

Her favorite things about her village bank are the sense of solidarity among the members and the savings it enables.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of clothing, such as sweaters, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has been selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of the lack of enough goats for sale. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers demands in the future.

With the KES 10,000, she wants to purchase goats for the sale of meat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats for the sale of meat.

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en: Shiela is a single mother of one child. Shiela is 21 years old and lives in Tacloban, Siquijor, Siquijor. She has a piggery business to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year. She has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase feed and medicines for her pigs. Shiela has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for five months. In the future, Shiela hopes to have savings for her child's future education.

loans.use: To purchase feed and medicines for pigs

loans.name: Maryuri Eunice

texts.es: La señora Maryuri S., originaria de Estelí, casada, de oficio agricultora. Esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad brindada atravez del préstamo Kiva, pues le fue de mucha ayuda ya que logro comprar insumos para siembra de café siente que ha fortalecido sus cosechas. En esta ocasión esta solicitando el crédito para compra de insumos para sembrar hortalizas. Su papa la esta apoyando para impulsar los cultivos de hortalizas ya que ella le gusta diversificar y salir adelante aportar en su hogar. Ella espera ampliar el área de siembras de hortalizas y mejorar la calidad de producción.
texts.en: Doña Maryuri is a native of Estelí.  She is married and works as a farmer.  She is very grateful for the opportunity she was given with a Kiva loan as it helped her a great deal.  She bought supplies to plant coffee.  She feels that it has strengthened her crops.  Again she is requesting a loan to buy supplies to plant vegetables.  Her father is encouraging her to plant vegetables as she likes to diversify and provide for her household.  She hopes to expand the area where she plants vegetables and improve her production quality.

loans.use: purchase supplies to plant vegetables.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 32 years old and a mixed crop farmer.  She is married to Martin who is a business man. They are blessed with one child aged two years. She has been in the farming business for the past one year with the monthly income of KES 8,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan term with KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Jane will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her child. Her hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion  is a farmer, raises pigs to earn a living, and  has been doing this for four years. She is 62 years old, widowed with three children and lives in Macabayao, Jimenez, Philippines.

She has requested a loan to purchase additional feed and agrivet supplies.

Salvacion has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Salvacion hopes to save for future consumption.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and agrivet supplies

loans.name: Hulya

texts.en:
Hülya is married and a mother of two.  She is sewing children's clothes and dresses at home by getting orders and selling them.  She gets lumps of deals from schools for their uniform.  With the help of her second credit from Maya she bought bulks of fabric.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Hülya hanım evli iki çocuk annesi evde çocuk giysileri ve çocuk kostümleri siparişi alarak dikiyor ve  satış yapıyor. Okullarla anlaşmalar yaparak toptan sipariş alıyor.  Maya dan 2. kredisini kullanan Hülya Hanım kredileri ile toptan kumaş aldı.

loans.use: to buy fabrics

loans.name: Abiassi Agbo

texts.en:
Born in 1968 in Aného, Mr. Abiassi Agbo B. is married and a father of two (2) children. Because he is blind, he always stays in the family house. In spite of his handicap, he has become an artisan. The quality of his works surprises the locals, and he thus has a large client base who order his products. This business makes it possible for Mr B. to provide for the needs for his small family. The main products he makes are chairs, cloths and scarves. He would now like to open a gallery in order to better showcase his products. His work is highly regarded and appreciated in the area. He is asking for a loan of $650 to carry out this project and to improve the standard of living of his family. To support this project of a blind person, is to encourage handicapped people to support themselves.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1968 à Aného, Monsieur B. Abiassi Agbo est marié et père de deux (2) enfants. A cause de son handicap de non voyant, il demeure toujours dans la maison familiale. Malgré son infirmité, il a pu apprendre le métier de tisserand qu’il exerce aujourd’hui. La qualité de ses œuvres surprend les habitants de sa localité. C’est ainsi qu’il a une clientèle importante qui raffole ses produits. Cette activité permet à Monsieur B. de subvenir aux besoins de sa petite famille. Les principaux produits qu’il fabrique sont les chaises, les nattes, les pagnes et les foulards. Afin de faire mieux apprécier ses produits, il voudrait ouvrir une boutique d’exposition de ses œuvres. Ses fabrications sont très appréciées dans le milieu. Il sollicite un appui financier de $650 pour réaliser son projet et changer le niveau de vie de sa famille. Soutenir ce projet d’un mal voyant, c’est encourager les handicapés à se prendre en charge.

loans.use: Open an artisan shop

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.en:
Gonzalo has a farm where he grows rice and corn. He lives with his wife and a son on their land and they all work on together. He admits he once was not on the right path as he drank excessively. He is now a religious man after suffering an accident where he lost an eye. He hopes to invest his money in fertilizer and seeds for the fields. He is a very hard worker who saves in order to one day send his son to college.

Communal Banking in Baba

This borrower is part of the newest and largest Communal Bank in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Centro Agricola de Baba Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in the county of Baba in rural Ecuador. Their association works cooperatively to cultivate rice and commercialize the product after it has grown. As an association, Centro Agricola helps the farmers by providing access to machinery and training services. The farmers from Centro Agricola have received special instruction on financial responsibility and accounting from Codemicro, an organization that specializes in training programs geared towards the rural sector.

The members of Centro Agricola de Baba will use the micro-loans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others' guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Centro Agricola de Baba Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many micro-finance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about Santa Lucia compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Baba

The people of Baba have been organized since the days of Gran Colombia when Ecuador was yet to be a country. The area has always been popular because of the extremely productive lands that gave way to cultivation of cacao for decades. Now Baba is a county in the province of Los Rios in the coastal region of Ecuador. For most of the latter part of the 20th Century it was a cacao and banana producing sector. Most of the surrounding areas of Baba in Los Rios are owned by large mulitnational companies such as Dole, but Baba is a sector characterized by the small and informal farms.

Rice production has now turned into the main economic activity of the sector as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Cacao is still very popular in the area, but because of the long cultivation cycle people prefer to invest in rice. The lands in Baba are very fertile though, and most farmers in the sector often grow other crops, such as plantains and soy beans as secondary sources of income. Many farmers also keep livestock as emergency sources of food and income, commonly resorting to selling a chicken or pig if they are in need of cash.

Rice Farming

Most of the people in the Baba area are small farmers. They produce about 80 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds, plowing and leveling the lands. This is the most difficult part for the farmers in Baba, who often lack the necessary machinery to properly plow the lands for rice production. After appropriately preparing the lands, the farmers fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them gather their production.

Access to Credit

One of the biggest struggles in the area has been the lack of credit due to the absence of any type of financial institution. Because people do not count on formal financial finance, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also lack skills and knowledge to commercialize their products and pay fair prices for their crops.

Risks

The largest risk in the sector is due to absence of watering systems. Although Baba is in the province “Los Rios” (the rivers) there is severe problem with access to water. The lack of infrastructure in the sector does not allow the small farmers to benefit from the presence of the many rivers in the area. If the winter season is too dry, it is likely that the lands will not be sufficiently fertile for rice production in the summer. On the other hand, if there is too much rain there are not any drainage systems to prevent flooding and the crops are often ruined. Generally speaking though, Baba is a very productive sector where the lands yield all types of crops including rice, cacao, corn, watermelons, plantains, and soy beans.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will mostly be used to to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. Many clients will use the capital towards renting machinery and equipment necessary to effectively work and prepare the fields. Clients also typically use a part of the loan to buy livestock in order to raise and have as reserves. The loan repayment schedule is different from the typical micro-entrepreneur because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures. Mifex asks our rural clients only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Rice Farming

loans.name: Yeng

texts.en: Mrs. Yeng C. is 35 years old, married and a mother of 3 children, who are students.
