Rebecca is married to Elmer, a farmer, and they are blessed with three children: Mayvelyn, 20 years old, a second-year college student; Mark Angelo, 18 years old, a high school graduate; and their youngest is Harold, 14 years old, a second-year high school student. The family lives along the highway at Alinam, Cauayan City, Isabela.

Rebecca operates a tricycle transportation business and is also engaged in a retailing business. Her net income is PHP 250 daily from her transport business and PHP 500 a week from her retailing business.

Rebecca wants to request a loan of PHP 15,000 from Kiva lenders to purchase additional grocery items to sell in her retail store and also for the maintenance of their motorcycle in order to have a productive and fruitful business income.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her retail store and for maintenance of her tricycle

loans.name: Libertino

texts.en:
"Time is Gold,” is the guiding principle of Libertino for he wanted to use his time wisely to become productive. He needs to work hard and be patient to be able to provide for the needs of his family. Libertino is single and living with his mother and sister.

Libertino runs a sari-sari store (community-based store) in their village. He usually purchases his commodities in Tuguegarao City once a month. According to him, he has been in business for nine years and he tries to maintain it for the sake of his family. Libertino is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 for the maintenance and continuous development of his business. He hopes that the lenders will approve his loan request.

loans.use: Additional capital for his village store

loans.name: Baet

texts.en: Mrs. Baet I. lives in Chheu Teal Phluoh village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Since her business is goI. well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets and pig food. Her husband, Mr. Nom Meiy, is a farmer. Mrs. Baet I. is the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while another one is a farmer. The youngest one is attendI. the local school.

loans.use: to buy more piglets for breeding and food for them

loans.name: Zeveleekeze Group

texts.en:
Catherine M. is the leader of a group of four borrowers called "Zeveleekeze." She is 34 years old and and a single mother of a 7-year-old child in the 2nd grade at school. Catherine is illiterate due to lack of financial support. Catherine and her child live in Gbarnga, the capital of Bong County, Liberia. 

Catherine sells used clothing in the Gbarnga Central Market. She buys the used clothes from wholesalers and sells them retail to residents of her community. She sells high quality used clothing to encourage the her customers to patronize her business. Catherine has been running this business for 4 years, and hopes to improve the business to meet international standard in the near future. 

The high cost of transporting her goods to her business site is a difficulty for Catherine’s business. Drivers charge huge amounts to take goods from one destination to another.

Catherine needs this loan to purchase more goods to improve her business. Catherine dreams of building her family up in a very good manner.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Dasola

texts.en:
Dasola is 52 years old. She is married and has two children, the eldest of whom is 29 years old. Her husband is a civil servant who helps to support their family. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. She is a LAPO client.

Dasola sells groceries and rents video disks (VCDs) at retail prices. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction with her customers. She is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo es un joven trabajador de 28 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su madre Teodora, de 40 años; su padrastro Juan, de 37 años; y con una de dos sus hijas, la pequeña hija Ximena de 4 años. 

Este hombre ejemplar trabaja brindando servicio de transporte en motocarro dentro de una ciudad pequeña ubicada en la selva central del Perú. Este oficio lo desarrolla desde hace 9 años y es muy rentable porque le permitió construir su casa, amoblarla y hasta abrir tener ahorros para asegurar su futuro y el de su familia. Pero lamentablemente su dicha no es completa, puesto que hace algunos meses su pareja lo abandonó llevándose a una de sus hijas, a la que no ha visto hasta hoy, pero él no pierde la esperanza de encontrarla muy pronto. Al recordar a la menor de sus hijas se desanima, pero basta una sonrisa o un abrazo de su hija Ximena y reacciona, pues sabe que debe luchar por ella.
Para el futuro tiene proyectado comprar terrenos, continuar ahorrando y aperturar una librería, además de un restaurante de comida rápida. 

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete seguir siendo puntual en sus pagos, le gusta trabajar en su banco comunal porque es muy activo y porque ve a los integrantes como una familia. Con el dinero que solicita tiene pensado comprar las herramientas y materiales necesarios para reparar su motocarro y así brindar un mejor servicio a sus exigentes pasajeros.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is a young worker who is 28 years of age. He lives in his own home, with his mother Teodora (age 40), his stepfather Juan (age 37), and one of his two daughters, little Ximena (age 4).

This gentleman works to provide exemplary motorcycle transport services in a small town in the central jungle of Peru. He developed his business over the past nine years, which has become profitable enough for him to build his house, furnish it, and acquire savings to secure his future and that of his family. Unfortunately, Wilfredo says his life is not complete. Some months ago, his girlfriend left him and took one of their daughters, whom he has not seen to this day. He does not lose hope and is optimistic that he will get to see her soon. Wilfredo remembers his younger daughter being disheartened, but a smile or a hug for his little Ximena makes her feel better. He knows that he must continue to struggle on her behalf. In the future, Wilfredo has plans to buy land, continue saving money, and open a bookstore and fast food restaurant.

This is his third loan with MFP. Wilfredo promises to continue making his payments on time. He enjoys working with his Communal Bank because the members are very active and have become like family. With the money he requested, Wilfredo will purchase tools and materials needed to repair his motorcycle taxi so that he can provide better service to his demanding customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairs to his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Razel

texts.en:
Razel D. P. is from the village of Barangay 4, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 41 years old. Razel is married and has five school-aged children. 

To make a living, Razel owns and manages a mini-grocery store located in the public market of Balingasag. At the same time she is also engaged in buying and selling ready-to-wear items for all ages, like dresses, shirts, pants and more. She sells these items in the local community. 

Razel has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $260 a month from these activities. (Shown in the photo are newly purchased goods intended for selling.)

In 2009, Razel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Razel is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris sells hair and beauty accessories like shampoo, hair extensions and cosmetics at retail prices to her customers. She loves this business because it is highly profitable and she hopes to grow her business. She is 27 years-old and unmarried without children. She has a good relationship with Kiva partner LAPO. Doris is requesting a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more hair and beauty accessories to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase hair and beauty accessories to sell.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen is a mother of two and the head of her family. For three years now she has operated a business in which she sells shoes in Fort Portal Uganda. She started out operating her business while working in her boss’s shop. She now sells the shoes outside the shop.

Doreen is taking her business step by step as it comes with growth in her customer numbers. She took a loan facility to enable her to purchase shoes to sell.

Doreen aims to construct a house for her family to shift from renting.

loans.use: To purchase shoes to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena C., 43, is making sure that her family has enough for their daily needs. Married to Rodrigo C., a carpenter, she is blessed with seven children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn enough so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her variety store while selling sticky rice cakes for quite some time now.

Elena has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow nine times through CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she has borrowed to expand and improve her businesses.     

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 16,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying groceries for her variety store and raw ingredients needed for her sticky rice cakes.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for more customers and patrons.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying groceries for her variety store and raw ingredients needed for her sticky rice cakes

loans.name: Temeke Mikoroshini Group

texts.en:
Hawa Abraham age thirty-four, is married with three children, eighteen, twelve, and six years old. She has two businesses: a salon and a clothing shop, which she has operated for three years now. She works from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily, and she is able to earn a monthly profit of about $111.

This will be Hawa’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the first loan to buy equipment for her salon. She hopes now for a loan to increase her stock in her clothing shop. 

Hawa will share this loan with her loan group, Temeke Mikoroshini, which consists of eighteen members. The members of the group hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

In the picture, Hawa is in front in a black t-shirt.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing for sale in her shop.

loans.name: Eunice Adhiambo

texts.en:
Eunice Adhiambo O. is 28 years old and lives in Nyamasaria in the outskirts of Kisumu city. She is a single mother of two children: Nicholas aged 13 and Everlyn aged 10. 

Eunice sells outfit materials/fabric and has been doing this for the past two years. She is applying for her first loan at KADET and intends to use the money to buy more materials to add to her fabric stock since they are on demand from her clients who consist of tailors around her neighborhood.

She hopes that her business will grow and enable her to earn enough profit so she can pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To increase her stock of outfit materials

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie, 27, lives in Agusan Del Sur and has 3 children.  She earns just enough money as a rice farmer to meet her family's needs.

She has joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. and requests a loan of Php 7,000 to expand her business, with the hope that it will be sustainable in the future.

loans.use: farm supplies

loans.name: A And J Group

texts.en:
These are the members of the “A and J” group. They are small-scale businesswomen in the northern city of Makeni.

This is not the first loan that these entrepreneurs have accessed a loan from SMT/Kiva. With the help of previous loans, they have been able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their living conditions. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are again seeking a new loan in order to further strengthen their businesses.

Jariatu J. (pictured on the left) is the leader of this group. She was born in Sanda village. She is about 35 years of age, married to a businessman, and they have four children who are attending both primary and secondary schools.

Jariatu owns a shop on Makeni’s busiest road where she sells a wide variety of commodities including milk, sugar, butter, margarine, mayonnaise, batteries, soaps, Vaseline, and many other different items. She has been a businesswoman for many years now.

With her share of this loan, Jariatu will buy more of the above mentioned items in wholesale to add to her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more items wholesale to add to her inventory

loans.name: Marther

texts.en: Marther A is currently in the business of selling beer and local brew and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell. Marther is 27 years old and is married to a teacher. She has two children and her children do not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a bar. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Panh

texts.en:
Panh S., 43, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. S. grows rice and watermelons for an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband is a construction foreman, earning an income of about USD 5 per day to help cover the family expenses.

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a shop at the market to sell clothes and shoes. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is S.'s first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a shop at the market to sell clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Aishahon's Group

texts.en: Third world countries share many specific characteristics. For instance, a high rate of unemployment makes people find and create jobs for themselves. Thus, there emerges a certain class of people who are not affected by the economic conditions in their country as they have their own households and can survive with their own cattle and land. The people in our story are such people, who have preferred to create their own happiness without the government’s assistance. They would rather be independent entrepreneurs than always follow the changes in economic conditions and feel unsafe. Aishahon I. is the leader of this group. She is 55 and has two children. Both of her sons are private builders. As for her husband, he and Aishahon are farmers and raise cattle. Sixteen years ago, they obtained land from the government and started farming. They started growing wheat and cotton. With great effort and tireless work, they have been able to achieve a decent income. They have been able to repair their house and marry off their son. At the moment, Aishahon needs a loan to purchase mineral fertilizers for cotton. She hopes to have a good harvest and, after selling the crops, to buy new furniture for her home. Aishahon’s partners: Ilgorbek A., 27, is married and has a son. He and his father own a pasture where they raise cattle. With their income, Ilgorbek has managed to obtain a college education, find a job and get married. Now Ilgorbek needs a loan to buy a washing machine as a present for his wife. Yokutoi I., 27, is married and has two children. She used to manufacture clothes and sell them in the market. Later her husband organized a small shop within the house and now she sells foodstuffs. Yokutoi needs a loan to purchase foodstuffs to increase her turnover. Hursanai A., 33, is the mother of two children. Her husband is a cattle breeder. As for Hursanai, she looks after cattle and sells milk. With the cattle breeding, Hursanai’s family has built a new house. Hursanai needs a loan to purchase a cow. ====================================== Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for growing cotton

loans.name: Ntungamo Bakyara Tuhirirwe, Ntungamo Group

texts.en:
This story is connected to one K. Aminah from Kyamate ward, Ntungamo, who has been in the agricultural sector for more than 30 years.  Thus we say that different types of agricultural activities have made many Ugandan families have an improved lease on life.

This widowed lady has subsisted on a variety of agricultural products for the last 10 years, specializing in growing bananas and looking after cows. Though adverse weather conditions have constantly affected her plantations, she has managed to consolidate the gains she has made. As a result, her family of 7 children has enjoyed the benefits; principally, her children have all gone to good institutions of learning and at the moment only one is still studying. 

Aminah reveals that in a month she makes close to, or even more than, 200,000 Ugandan shillings from selling her agricultural products. She is very upbeat that, with this loan, she will be in a position to improve on the mulching and gardening aspects of her farm and also increase the stock of animals on her farm, which will help her increase the produce and sales revenue.

This will provide a base for her to meet her motive of educating all her children and also to construct a family house.

loans.use: Mulch for the plantation and restocking the farm with more cows

loans.name: Nelyn

texts.en:
Nelyn S. is from the village of Maular Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old. Nelyn is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Nelyn owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling specialty food products like "moron" and "torta" (battered and deep-fried delicacies) in the local community. Nelyn has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Nelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Nelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani Y. is from the town of Banga. She is 34 years old. Lani is married and has 2 children, aged 10 and 5. To make a living, Lani owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Lani has been engaged in her business for over 4 years.

Lani joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She says she also likes the Bible Reflection they have during meetings. Lani has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Lani is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs like fertilizer and seeds. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Agasef

texts.en:
Agasef A. is a man who has dedicated himself to the livestock industry from his childhood. He has been characterized as a very spirited and strong person who supports his young family, composed of his wife and  one son.

The work Agasef does is the raising of livestock for eventual sale and also from selling milk and milk products. It is necessary to point out that this is the only income that supports his family's needs. With the first loan from AqroInvest and KIVA,  Agasef was able to purchase cattle and from the income it generated he bought sheep. Now his monthly income is about 250-300 AZN.

Today, Agasef looks for second loan from AqroInvest to obtain the necessary loan to purchase one cow and six sheep to raise. He has a successful client history and AqroInvest's trust.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and six sheep

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
El señor Jose R. A. ha estudiado solo hasta el nivel primario, ha trabajado desde muy pequeño, actualmente tiene dos hijos, pero ambos hijos no viven con él, debido a que tienen familia y son independientes.   

Él vive solo, su trabajo es lo único que tiene, el señor Jose trabaja de guardia de seguridad, de la cual percibe ingresos de $us.257/mes. Adicianalmente a eso en su tiempo libre se dedica a dar servicios de taxi, de las cuales percibe ingresos de $us.200.-/mes.  

Recientemente el motor de su vehiculo, el cual es su herramienta de trabajo, se encuentra dañado y no puede trabajar, el señor Jose necesita $us 1200.- para poder reparar su vehiculo y asi poder trabajar de forma normal.
texts.en:
Mr. José R. A. only finished primary school.  He has worked since he was little.  He has two children but both have their own families and live independently.

He lives alone.  His work is all he has.  He’s employed as a security guard with a monthly salary of $257 dollars.  In addition to this job, he provides taxi services in his spA. time which produces an additional $200 dollars per month.

Recently, the motor of his vehicle, which is his work tool, broke down and he can’t work.  José needs $1200 dollars to repair his vehicle to be able to work normally.

loans.use: To repair his taxi.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a charcoal selling business for over two years, neighbours and passersby being her potential customers. Fridah faces a challenge of high transport cost incurred when transporting charcoal from rural areas to her place of operation. She hopes to own a dry cleaning machine and a photocopier machine in the future.

Fridah decided to join Yehu because of its simple procedures. With the KES 35,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To organize a wedding party.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa T. is from the village of Unidos. She is 66 years old, widowed, and has four adult children. To make a living, Narcisa owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Narcisa has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 1999, Narcisa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Narcisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. That loan was used to to purchase new items to expand product offerings. Narcisa is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and acquire working capital. This loan will be Narcisa's 14th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and acquire working capital

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel M. is from the village of Plaridel, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 43 years old. Maribel is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Maribel owns and operates a furniture making business. The main source of income for the business comes from making and selling general household furniture made from bamboo to local businesses and community members. Maribel has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Maribel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maribel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Maribel is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Maribel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings

loans.name: María Livia

texts.es:
La Señora. María C. es socia del banco comunal Prosperidad, vive por el sector de la Feria Libre en la Ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por su belleza arquitectónica, su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones la misma que es muy amable y cordial.

La Señora. María tiene 29 años, vive en unión libre y tiene 5 hijos de 12, 8, 7, 1 años y su ultimo hijo de 2 meses, sus tres primeros hijos estudian en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo se dedica a la confección de ropa deportiva, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña María trabaja junto a su esposo confeccionando la ropa deportiva, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 8 años, su esposo le ha enseñado este oficio y tienen un pequeño taller que es de su propiedad, laboran desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche y no descansan un solo día ya que trabajan de domingo a domingo.
 
Este es su primer crédito y  fue invitada por una compañera que es socia del banco comunal, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materia prima como  telas, hilos, etc. Su meta es tener un taller más grande.
texts.en:
María C. is a member of the 'Prosperidad' community bank.  She lives in the Feria Libre sector of the city of Cuenca.  This city is known for its architectural beauty and its people who maintain its culture and traditions.  The people are also very kind and friendly.

María is 29 years old.  She lives with her partner and has 5 children aged 12, 8, 7, 1 and 2 months.  Her eldest three children study in a school in the city.  Her husband makes sports clothes.  They don't have their own home but rent instead.

María works together with her husband making sports clothes.  She has been in this business for eight years.  Her husband taught her the trade and they have their own small workshop.  They work there from 6.00am to 7.00pm.  They don't rest a single day but work from Sunday to Sunday.
 
This is María's first loan and she was invited to join her community bank by a friend who was already a member.  She will invest her loan in buying raw material such as fabric, thread, etc.  Her goal is to have a bigger workshop.

loans.use: To buy fabric, buttons, thread, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Ghokale Group-Jinja

texts.en: Forty-two-year-old Monic W. belongs to Ghokale group-Jinja. She has been overseeing her cattle and goat sales businesses in Ivunamba for 20 years. The happily married mother of 10 says she has been able to live within the ways and means of this business throughout this time. Yet, as with any other business, she has had to bear a lot of challenges, mostly the scarcity of clients during particular seasons. Monic also runs a modest grocery business that she says brings her supplementary profits. With this loan, Monic says she is going to buy more animals, principally cattle, that she says she will resell later.

loans.use: The purchase of more cattle for resale

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina P. is from the village of Miaray, Dangcagan, Bukidnon. She is 38 years old. Josefina is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Josefina owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop.  The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods, and toothpaste in the local community. Josefina has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Josefina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & fund working capital. 

Josefina is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell such as snack foods and canned goods. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Josefina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 25-year-old single man from Bint Jbeil.  He has been working in construction since 2007.  He specializes in cement.  Ali's work is of good quality, and he is recommended by most contractors and neighbors.  Ali is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua in order to buy extra iron and wood pillars to use in his business.  

Ali has been an A. Majmoua borrower since 2009.  He is a man with a good repayment history. Ali is working hard to improve his business and to expand it. He hopes to open a construction company in the future.

loans.use: To buy iron and wood pillars

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en:
Estrelita A. is from the village of Bannagao. She is 59 years old. Estrelita is married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Estrelita owns & operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Estrelita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Estrelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. That loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Estrelita is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be her 10th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Yekaterina

texts.en:
Yekaterina is married, with 3 sons and 2 daughters. She lives in the small town of Privetnoye. Yekaterina grows early spring vegetables: Radishes, tomatoes, squash, cabbage, beets, onions and potatoes. She launched this enterprise 5 years ago.  She has already invested about 100,000 grivnyas in her business. Her net profit is about 4,000 grivnyas. 

Yekaterina is seeking a loan of 13,500 grivnyas to purchase seeds, wood, polyethylene film and fertilizer for her greenhouses. Yekaterina is planning to cover her greenhouses with new plastic film to keep them warm, which she relies on to nurture plants and help them thrive. She is hoping that the current loan will help her make a wise investment in her venture, and flourish in her endeavors.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, wood, polyethylene film and fertilizer

loans.name: Jose Estanislao

texts.es:
José de 39 años de edad, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, vive con su esposa y dos hijas de 2 y 4 años de edad, él se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, el aprendió este oficio por su padre, quien desde pequeño lo acompaño enseñándole todo el trabajo agrícola.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos como abono, fertilizantes y preparar la tierra donde realizara la siembra.
Dicha inversión le servirá para tener todo lo necesario y dar el cuido debido al cultivo, con el que espera tener una buena producción.

Su objetivo es ir creciendo, aumentando su producción, comercializando las cosechas y ofreciendo una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
José, 39, lives in El Transito, San Miguel Department, with his wife and two daughters who are 2 and 4 years of age; he’s a farmer and cattleman.  He learned this occupation from his father who took him along since he was a little boy teaching him everything about farming.

He is asking for a loan to buy some supplies like manure and fertilizer to prepare the soil for his next planting.  Said investment will make it possible for him to have everything he needs to provide proper care for his crops which he hopes will yield a good production.

His goal is to continue growing, increasing production and selling his crops to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like manure and fertilizer

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en:
Basilisa works hard to support her child. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Basilisa requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy an ENVIROFIT COOKSTOVE.

She is getting the envirofit cookstove because she wants to save money by using the dried wood from her surroundings.

Basilisa is aware that by using the envirofit cookstove, she is not only saving money; she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To pay for the purchase of an envirofit cookstove

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James has been farming for 15 years, producing a variety of goods but with a concentration on bananas, coffee, and milk which he sells to the local markets in the Nkubu area, Central Kenya. He is married with four children, three of whom are attending school. He also works with a security firm.

Because animal diseases are the biggest challenge in the dairy business, James has requested a loan of 47,250 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says his dairy income will go toward educating his children and improving their living standards by providing for their basic needs. He is also focusing on expanding his coffee plantation.

James is happy about the speed with which Juhudi's loans are processed.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter G. K. is married to Lucy Njeri and they have three children. The wife is a farmer.

For eight years, Peter has been running a green grocery store in which he sells a variety of vegetables and gets an income of KES 9,220 per month. 

This is his third loan from KADET Ltd. and he paid back the previous loans successfully. He intends to use the loan amount to buy more green groceries such as cabbages, spinach, potatoes and various greens for sale. The anticipated profit he will use to start a retail shop.

In the future, he plans to grow his business and open a supermarket in Mutego shopping center.

loans.use: to buy more stock of potatoes, cabbages, spinach and various greens for sale.

loans.name: Arturo De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Arturo, tiene la edad de 41 años , habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su compañera de vida , la cual labora como domestica para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tres hijos , todos independientes y casados los planes futuros hacia su familia es poder mejorar las condiciones de la vivienda , don Arturo desde hace nueve años se dedica a trabajar el cultivo de piña , la mayor afectación que se le presenta es las malezas y enfermedades que atacan al cultivo   por falta de insecticidas, fertilizantes e insumos . El crédito lo quiere para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos para obtener una buena cosecha.
texts.en: Arturo is 41 years old and lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe with his life partner who works in domestic services in order to help him with the household expenses.  They have three children who are independent and married.  His future plan for his family is to be able to improve their living conditions.  Arturo has worked growing pineapple for the past nine years and the greatest difficulties he faces are weeds and diseases that attack his crops due to the lack of insecticides, fertilizers and supplies.  He wants the loan to purchase fertilizers and supplies in order to have a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy two bulls.

loans.name: Nhhoep

texts.en:
Nhhoep has been a silk weaver for more than 30 years. Her husband has been a primary teacher for more than 30 years. Nhhoep is asking for her second loan of 1,000 USD to put a new roof on her house because she and her husband are old and broke. She will use a part of her loan to continue her weaving business by buying silk materials.

Photo: Nhhoep and her husband.

loans.use: to put a new roof on her house and buy silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a 43-year-old housewife. Her husband Ihsan has a tailoring workshop that he has been running for six years now. Mona has been supporting her husband in his business by helping him getting work done so they have a basic income to raise their four children. During these six years, they were able to add more services besides tailoring: dry cleaning and ironing clothes and fabric.

Now that the business is growing, Mona has applied for a loan to buy more fabric and to redecorate the workshop so it can fit all the required machines and tools needed to provide their services in the best and most appropriate way. Since Mona is a conservative person, she requested that her husband Ihsan appear in the photo instead of her.

loans.use: To buy more fabric and redecorate her workshop

loans.name: Serenidad Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Serenidad, se conformó gracias a la Presidenta del grupo, quien logró juntar a 16 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 9º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Todas ellas participan activamente en las reuniones semanales, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo.
La Sra. Julia se dedica a la venta de bebidas, por medio de este trabajo ella ha podido salir adelante con su familia. Se siente muy orgullosa de lo que hace, ya que es un trabajo honesto y sacrificado.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de bebidas ya sea cerveza, gaseosas, energizantes y demás para la posterior venta.
texts.en:
This Women's Committee, called Serenidad ["Serenity"], was formed thanks to the group president, who managed to unite 16 women who have been working very well together and are now in their ninth loan cycle. They work together in the program.
All of them participate actively in the weekly meetings and help each other to achieve the common objectives that they all have for the group.
Mrs. Julia sells drinks. Through this work she has been able to get her family ahead. She is very proud of what she does, since it is an honest and selfless job.
She is requesting a loan for the purchase of drinks such as beer, pop, energy drinks and more for the next sale.

loans.use: to purchase drinks; energy drinks, pop and more.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
At the age of 23, Analyn is married and has three children. Her husband is a rice farmer while she is planning to start raising pigs to generate more income. She is asking for a loan amount of 10,000 PHP to buy piglets and feed.

Analyn hopes that with this loan she will grow her business so as to support the studies of her children in the coming years. If she manages it well, then it will eventually help her to elevate her family from poverty.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Edgar Eduardo

texts.es:
El señor Edgar Eduardo es casado, tiene 39 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar de estudiar, tiene 3 hijos los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la confección de tejidos, pantalones, playeras, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica al mismo oficio inició este negocio siendo trabajador para otro negocio, y lleva 10 años de experiencia con este trabajo.

Decide solicitar un préstamo para ampliar su capital de trabajo va a comprar más tela e hilos, espera que en el futuro mejore en ganancias  y mejore su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Sr. Edgar Eduardo is 39 years old, married, and has three children who are in school. He did not have the opportunity to pursue an education. Edgar makes woven articles, trousers, and shirts with the help of his wife, who works in the same trade. He has 10 years of experience in this line of work, both in his own business and working for other people.

Edgar decided to request a loan in order to increase his operating capital. He plans to buy more fabrics and thread. In the future, he hopes to improve his earnings and his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and thread.

loans.name: Aichatou

texts.fr:
Aichatou est une femme  âgée de 32 ans. Elle est mariée å un enseignant. Elle a 02 enfants 
Aichatou travaille comme revendeuse de charbon de bois depuis 2004. Elle vend à ses clients  à domicile et  achète à KANTE. 
Aichatou a requis son second cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de charbons.
texts.en:
Aichatou is a 32-year-old woman who is married to a teacher. She has two children. 

Aichatou has been working as a retailer of charcoal since 2004. She sells out of her home. She purchases her supplies in KANTE. 

Aichatou has requested her second loan from the micro-finance institution WAGES in order to buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia is 68 years old and married. She has 3 children.

Cornelia is in the business of raising hogs. She fattens the pigs and sells them at the market. Cornelia also makes barbecue that she sells to the people in her community. She has a stall where she sells her barbecue and softdrinks.

Cornelia has requested a loan to purchase pig feed, softdrinks and pork and chicken meat. She hopes to have a successful business in the future.

loans.use: purchase pig feed, softdrinks and pork and chicken meat

loans.name: Dedan

texts.en:
Dedan is a single man who lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, he has operated a business selling second hand clothes at the market to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of theft in his business. Dedan dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the KSHS 10,000, he wants to purchase bales of clothes and shoes for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bales of clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es: Domitila es socia del Banco Comunal Solución, tiene 36 años y 3 hijos, es socia de FINCA Peru desde hace 2 años. Domitila, se dedica a la compra y venta de tara y ladrillos en Pacaycasa, recuerda que su negocio empezó cuando su esposo todavía estaba vivo, y con él iniciaron su negocio ella agradece mucho a Finca por todo el apoyo que le brindaron con las capacitaciones y como hacer negocio, ahora este préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de ladrillos para vender por menor, y su meta es poder hacer su casa y ahí mismo tener una bodega.
texts.en:
Domitila is a member of the “Solucion” (Solution) Communal Bank. She is 36 years old, has 3 children, and has been a member of FINCA Peru since 2 years ago.

Domitila buys and sells tara tree products and bricks in Pacaycasa. She reports that the business was started when her husband was still alive; they began it together. She is grateful to FINCA for all the help it has provided with training on how to build a business.

Now, with this loan, she will buy bricks to sell at retail. Her goal is to be able to build her own house where she can have a store.

loans.use: to buy bricks to sell.

loans.name: Mekhrob

texts.ru: Мехроб является отцом троих детей и для обеспечения своей семьи  занимается перевозкой песка и камней на собственной машине. Ранее он работал водителем в колхозе имени Р.Назирова. Решил заниматься предпринимательством и открыл свое дело по предоставлению услуг по перевозке стройматериалов- песка и камней. Мехроб хочет получить займ для установки газового оборудования на автомашине так, как расходы по ГСМ- бензину слишком дороги.
texts.en: Mekhrob is a father of three children and is involved in transporting sand and stones in his own vehicle in order to provide for his family.  Previously, he worked as a driver at a collective farm, named in honor of R. Nazirov.  Mekhrob decided to become an entrepreneur and opened his own business of providing transportation services of construction materials, such as sand and stones.  He wants to obtain a loan to install gas equipment for his vehicle because the expenses for petrol fuel are too high.

loans.use: to install gas equipment

loans.name: Mujeres De Union Y Paz Group

texts.en:
This group is located in in the rural areas surrounding San Pedro de Macoris. They all live in a big rural community, surrounded by sugarcane fields.

Rosa is the coordinator of the group, Mujeres de Union y Paz 1, 2 & 3 (Women of Union and Peace). She is mother of two children and they live together in a modest home. She is a single mother. 

She has had her used clothing business for around eight years, starting with some capital she saved. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business, and she will buy two packages of these clothes. Before she started selling used clothes, she sold underwear.

She says that her most important challenge is when her clients don't pay her, because she used to sell on credit to be paid every 15 days. For now, she plans to continue to enjoy working.

Rosa is excited to be taking her ninth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She is planning to uses her business profits to build her house and business. She dreams of finishing her house.

loans.use: to buy bags of used clothes to resell.

loans.name: Afiyo

texts.fr:
Afiyo est une femme âgé(e) de 32 ans. Afiyo est mariée å un revendeur. Elle 4 enfants.
Afiyo  travaille comme revendeuse  depuis 2007. Elle  vend des tissus et pagnes à son domicile.  Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pas avoir suffisamment de stock pour satisfaire sa clientèle.
Afiyo  a requis son 3ième  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des tissus.
Dans les prochaines années, Afiyo voudrait se faire connaître hors de son domicile. Elle dit qu’avec l es profits, elle  prévoit ouvrir une boutique de tissus.
texts.en: Afiyo is a 32-year-old woman. She is married to a retailer and has four children. Afiyo has been working as a retailer since 2007. She sells fabric and pagnes from home. At the moment, her main difficulty is not having enough stock to satisfy her customers. Afiyo has requested her third loan from WAGES in order to buy fabric. Over the coming years, Afiyo would like to become known outside her home. She says that she plans to use her profits to open a fabric store.

loans.use: to buy fabric and pagnes

loans.name: Violeto

texts.en: Violeto is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. Violeto has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Violeto has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Violeto hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Ungana Shg Group

texts.en:
Mark is the facilitator of the Ungana SHG group. Mark and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Mark takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Mark had a very good maize yield, harvesting 17 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Mark was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Mark and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Mark will educate his children, build a house, and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Ungana SHG group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

Mark is pictured with his group members in the photograph above

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items to sell in her retail shop.

loans.name: Merluville

texts.en:
Merluville is married with two children. She is 25-years-old, and lives in the Philippines.

Merluville is operating a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. She has been doing this for seven months, and every month she earns 5,000.00 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 40,000.00 PHP to repair her existing vehicle for better service.

Merluville has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Merluville hopes to own a house and the lot.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Suk

texts.en:
Mrs. Suk, age 49, operates a business selling eggplants, which she grows and buys from her suppliers as well. She is able to yield an average of $7 per day. She is not worried about her business because she has her frequent customers who order this type of vegetable for their grocery shop regularly. 

Mrs. Suk is blessed with four children. She has become a very hardworking mother since her husband passed away. 

Mrs. Suk is requesting a loan from HKL to buy a used motorcycle for her household’s and business’ use. This loan will better the way she lives and works. In the future, she intends to expand her farmland and grow additional types of vegetables to satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 28 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, noodles, canned goods, etc.

Teodora has been in this business for 8 years..

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, noodles, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is 46 years old, she has two sons. Angela sells clothes and she is a professional masseuse. 

She needs a loan to buy more clothes for her business because she sells the clothes in many different locations including offices and houses. She will take advantage of the christmas season 

Angela sells new clothes. She hopes you can help her because she is the only person who earns money in her household. Angela is a single mother.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for her business at christmas season

loans.name: Mary Jan

texts.en:
Mary Jan is 45 years old and living with her 9 children in District 5, Kabul, Afghanistan.

Mary Jan and Said Mohammad are doing a family business, they both are trying to do a successful business, Mary Jan is purchasing the supply from the main market and whole sellers and her husband sells them in the shop, due to the Afghan cultuer Mary Jan herself is not able to be in the shop.

She already passed a 1st and 2nd loan cycle, now continuing with a 3rd loan cycle from AFSG.

loans.use: To buy goods and supplies for their shop

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia, like many vendors on the streets in Trou-du-Nord, Haiti, sells small ingredients and morsels that are affordable to the impoverished population who mostly cook out of their homes or buy food on the street as opposed to restaurants. Celia meets a high demand with supplying these ingredients, but her kind and warm personality have helped her to be a preferred stop for many customers. She has now requested this loan from Esperanza to increase her capital so that she can reinvest in her business inventory while still having enough for savings, insurance and taking care of her four young children.

NOTE: Celia is one of 10 micro-entrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, which have all gone through Esperanza's business training courses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their shares of this $1,200 loan together. Celia's group will receive and pay back this loan together - if a member is unable to pay in full on time, the group is responsible for making up the deficit before a payment can be made. Investors in this loan will receive an update on Celia's situation as well as that of the entire group. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in a community and ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their business and family.

loans.use: Expand inventory of ten businesses

loans.name: Fidelia

texts.en:
My name is Fidelia G.. I sell groceries and I have had my business for 3 years. I have many customers as I sell my products at a low price. At this moment I would like to have a broader assortment of products are these days sales is good. With the profits I hope to be able to employ someone to help me tend the store because I can't even get a rest with this many customers. In addition, I hope to use my profits to feed my family.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Fidelia G. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo mi negocio hace unos 3 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que vendo a un precio bajo mis productos, en estos momentos necesito tener mas variedad de productos ya que estos dias son buenos para las ventas, y con las ganancias que obtenga poder contratar una muchacha que me ayude para la atencio de mi negocio porque no me doy abasto con tantos clientes tambien con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia.

loans.use: To buy corn flour, barley, margarine, bread, milk, salt, sugar, rice, beans, eggs, oil, cheese, peppers, sardines, tortillas, soap, refreshments, bathroom tissue, and marmelade.

loans.name: Nghul

texts.en: Mrs. Nghul P. is 61 years old and a housewife living in Phnom Penh with her son, who is employed as a security guard and earns $7 per day. She would like to purchase this motorcycle for her son, so that he can make additional income from operating a motor-taxi business when he has time off from work.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her son so that he can operate a motor-taxi business

loans.name: Samangul

texts.en: You can see the happy Gurbanov family in the picture. They live in the town of Khachmaz of Azerbaijan. Samangul is 46 years old and has 4 children. Her family has been raising cows and calves for eight years. They now need a loan of $725 to buy a cow from which they can collect milk and improve their income.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es:
Maria sells all types of goods in her general store. There are a variety of eye-catching products in her store for her customers. She has been in the business 15 years and started with the help of her sister. Together they saved $100 and started selling goods on the streets near the central market.

Little by little, with the earnings she built a shop out of tin sheets and displayed her products on wooden stands and others on the floor when there wasn't space. But when it rained, streams of waters entered and soaked her goods.

Maria has received more than 20 loans over time and we have been part of her growth. She knows how to run her business and has done this with pride, and has been able with a lot of hard work to acquire her own shop located at a strategic spot in the market. Her development has encouraged a selling atmosphere, and her products are well organized and visible to customers.

Her family is pleased because they have seen Maria's personal, moral and economic growth. Her son is equally happy because thanks to the business his mother is helping him attend college. In her own words, Maria says, "I'm very grateful for the loans you have given me, your support in the good times and the bad, and above all, … for behind there when I need it."

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Maria Lourdes López T. vende todo tipo de bisuteria (retrateras, peluches, adornos, cosméticos, collares, etc). Existe una variedad de productos en su tienda que son llamativos para los clientes. Cumple 15 años de tener el negocio, nos comenta que ella inició con la ayuda de su hermana, juntas lograron ahorrar U$100 (cien dólares netos). Inicialmente no tenian un módulo, asi que comenzaron a la interperie, vendiendo a la orilla de la calle del Mercado Central en León.

Poco a poco, con sus ganancias fué construyendo su módulo con láminas de zinc, pero los productos estaban puestos en unos estantes de madera y algunos otros en el suelo cuando no alcanzaban. Aguantaban sol y agua, porque cuando llovía, las corrientes de agua entraban en el lugar y mojaban todos los productos, deteriorando de esta manera su mercadería.

Ella ha accesado a mas de 20 créditos y somos partícipes de su crecimiento. Ha sabido administrar bien su negocio y lo demuestra con orgullo, pues logró con mucho esfuerzo adquirir su propio módulo ubicado en un punto estratégico del mercado. La actividad se desarrolla en un ambiente de movimiento, sus productos están ordenados y visibles al cliente.

Su familia se siente contenta porque han visto como ha crecido personal, moral y economicamente, su hijo igual está feliz porque con este negocio su mamá le esta ayudando con sus estudios universitarios, las palabras de doña Maria son las siguientes: "Les estoy muy agradecida con los créditos que me han brindado, su apoyo en los buenos y en los malos momentos y sobre todo...estar ahi cuando lo necesito"

loans.use: Purchase merchandise (women's purses, clocks, all types of gifts, etc.)

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina is 48 years old, she is married and has 3 children. She has been making and selling "chipas" for over 15 years. "Chipas" are a typical Paraguayan food which resembles cheese bread. It is made with cornstarch, eggs and cheese.

She inherited this job from her parents, they are very well known people in the area. They offer very high quality "chipas" and this has given them a very good reputation.

She requests this loan in order to be able to purchase ingredients such as cheese, cornstarch, vegetable oil, and other ingredients necessary to make these "chipas". This time of the year they are very popular and the sales of these tend to go up

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Martina tiene 48 años, está casada y tiene 3 hijos. Se dedica a la fabricación y venta de chipas hace ya más de 15 años, la chipa es una comida típica del Paraguay parecido a un pan de queso, hecho con almidón, huevos y queso.

El oficio de la elaboración de chipas lo heredó de sus padres, quiénes son muy conocidos en la zona ya que la calidad de sus productos ya es tradicional en la zona.

Ella hoy solicita un crédito con los que desea adquirir en gran cantidad los ingredientes como queso, almidón, aceite vegetal y otros ingredientes para la elaboración de las chipas ya que en esta época del año las ventas de las mismas aumenta considerablemente.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients such as: cornstarch, cheese, vegetable oil, etc.

loans.name: Lawal

texts.en: Lawal Riskat is 42 years old, married with 6 children and hails from Shibiri in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells drinks, provisions, foodstuffs and has a grinding machine for tomatoes and peppers. She has been a LAPO client for the past 3 years. She is requesting for a loan of $275 to buy more drinks, provision and foodstuffs for sale.

loans.use: To buy more drinks, provisions, foodstuffs and a grinding machine.

loans.name: Sib

texts.en: Mrs. Sib P., 40, runs a stand at a busy market selling a variety of fresh vegetables.  She typically makes around $5 each day in revenue. Her husband has worked as a motor-taxi driver since 2000. He transport passengers from place to place and generally makes on average around $5 each day in income. Mrs. Sib P. will use this loan to buy a new motor-bike to replace her husband's old one, which needs to be regularly repaired at a high cost.

loans.use: to purchase a new motor-bike for her husband to operate a business

loans.name: Karomat

texts.en: A. Karomat was born in 1974 in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan and is married and has one child. She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007.  A schoolteacher by her professional background, she is also engaged in the business of selling food, growing many of the fruit products herself.  She is applying to Kiva for a loan of $1,200 for 4 months to implement the seasonal works.

loans.use: Implementing seasonal works.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro is 32 years old and dedicated to painting and repairing automobiles. He is married to Silvia and has one son. Currently they live in a home that he rents and is located at Avenida 2 de Agosto.

Pedro has been fixing autos for several years and so he has lots of experience in this field. This is the main reason why he has a steady and loyal group of clients, causing the competition to be less of an issue for him.

The current loan is for acquiring materials and general items needed in a body shop. He has good previous credit and this equipment for his garage will allow him to attend to a greater quantity of clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Pedro de 32 años de edad se dedica al pintado y chaperío de automoviles, está casado con Silvia y tienen un hijo. Actualmente viven en un domicilio que alquila y que se encuentra ubicado por la avenida 2 de agosto.

Pedro se dedica al arreglo de vehículos desde hace varios años atrás, por lo que tiene mucha experiencia en su rubro. Esta es la razón principal por lo que cuenta con clientela fija y leal, haciendo que el impacto de la competencia sea menor.

El presente crédito es para la adquisición de materiales y accesorios de chaperio en general. Tiene buenos antecedentes crediticios además que el equipamiento de su taller le permitirá atender a una mayor cantidad de clientes.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sunia

texts.id:
Sunia’s business is trading meatballs and sausages. She should go to nearest market every morning to purchase the materials, like meat, noodles, and sausages. Then, she will cook and prepare everything. After they have been ready, her husband and children will go door-to-door to sell them. They usually sell in the morning until noon, and again in the afternoon. Every family member work together and help each other. Sunia plans to improve the business, that someday she would be able to have a booth. That is why she expects to earn the loan.

Today Sunia lives with her husband and her two children in a rented house that should be paid Rp150,000 a month.

Translated form Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva volunteer.

Usaha sehari-hari Sunia adalah sebagai penjual bakso dan sosis. Setiap hari, dia harus pergi ke Pasar terdekat untuk belanja bahan untuk membuat bakso seperti mie dan sosis. Setelah itu dia menyiapkan semuanya. Setelah semuanya siap, suami dan anaknya akan berkeliling untuk menjual bakso dan sosis bikinannya. Biasanya mereka berjualan pada pagi hari sampai siang, lalu kemudian kembali berjualan pada sore hari. Semua anggota keluarga saling membantu untuk kepentingan bersama. Sunia berencana mengembangkan usahanya, sehingga nanti bisa membuka tempat berjualan sendiri. Dia sangat mengharapkan bantuan modal untuk usahanya ini. Saat ini, bersama suami dan kedua anaknya, mereka tinggal dirumah sewa dengan biaya Rp.150.000 per bulan.

loans.use: Increase Capital

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret K. is forty two years old. She is a widow who lost her husband ten years ago. She has three children who are currently in school. For the past nine years, she has been working as a local manufacturer of palm kernel oil, which she produces and supplies to food vendors so that they can use her palm kernel oil to prepare their meals.

She is seeking a loan in order to buy more bags of palm nuts and an electric milling machine, which would increase her efficiency and enable her to produce palm kernel oil in larger quantities. In this way, she believes that a loan will help expand her business and thereby generate more income to support her family and finance her children’s education.

She belongs to the community group known as “So mu yie” (or "handle with care") Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral to access loans and apply peer pressure so that each group member properly repays their respective loans.

loans.use: To expand her business and to make the business more efficient by purchasing additional bags of palm nuts and an electric milling machine.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris is 41 years old. Together with her husband she makes a living selling fish. While he travels selling, she sets up in front of the door to her house, where she sells fresh and salted fish on a table that she places there. This couple works hard to be able to cover the expenses of their home and the education of their children. Because of the intense heat, she is in need of a loan to be able to construct what in her area is called a “ramada”, which is a covering made of branches woven together, and will be placed over her selling area as a form of roof. She needs to purchase the materials and is counting on you to enable her to do so.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Doris tiene 41 años, ella y su esposo se dedican a la venta de pescado, mientras que él se va por diferentes lugares para vender, ella se acomoda en la puerta de su casa, y en una mesa acomoda su pescado fresco y salado. Esta pareja se esfuerza en su trabajo para cumplir con los gastos de su casa y el estudio de sus hijos.Por el intenso calor ella se ve en la necesidad de pedir este préstamo para la elaboración de lo que llaman en su localidad, una ramada, que es una especie de trenzado de ramas en plancha, para colocarlo como techo del espacio donde vende, necesita comprar esos materiales y confía en ustedes para ello.

loans.use: Purchase of materials to construct a shelter of branches to cover the area where she sells fish.

loans.name: Stenala S.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 45-year-old Stenala E.. She is married and has one child, aged 3. She has one dependent who lives with her because he is an orphan. In 1993, Stenala established her banana-selling business. Working seven days a week, and one to four hours a day, she earns about US $10 every month from this business. Stenala requires a loan in order to buy more bananas in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment Ð a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy more bananas in bulk

loans.name: Neema's Tuimarike Group

texts.en:
Neema is a 20 year old single woman. She has been selling clothes since 2006. She works daily from 8am to 6pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

Neema is now requesting a loan to buy more clothes for the expansion of her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Ridhwana.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for the expansion of her business.

loans.name: Orlando Arturo

texts.es: El Sr. Orlando es un hombre trabajador, desde muy joven ha trabajado para salir adelante y ayudar económicamente a sus padres, tiene 38 años de edad, y habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Monseñor Lezcano, soltero, trabaja en una institución privada desempeñándose como contador general de la empresa, desde hace catorce años, inicio como auxiliar contable, por sus experiencias y conocimiento del trabajo lo promovieron a contador, lo cual ha sido un logro en su vida personal, el ayuda a su mama con los gastos del hogar. Con la solicitud del préstamo es para infraestructura en la compra de materiales de construcción de zinc, perlines, golosos, pega, y otros que necesite para la reparación del  techo de su casa ya que esta en malas condiciones, pues desea hacer las reparaciones debida para estar gozando de una casa digna. A futuro es seguir estudiando para optar a un trabajo que le pueda generar mejores ingresos, poder ayudar a sus padres siempre. Hacer anexo en la casa ya que es pequeña.
texts.en:
Señor Orlando is a hard-working man. Since he was very young he has worked to get ahead and to help his parents financially. He is 38 years of age and lives in the Monseñor Lezcano neighborhood in the capital of Managua. He is single and works for a private establishment as a general accountant. Fourteen years ago, he started working as an assistant accountant. Because of his experience and his understanding of the work, he was promoted to accountant which has been a success in his personal life. He helps his mother with the household expenses. The loan he requests is the foundation for his purchase of construction materials like zinc, beams, supplies, glue and other items that he needs to repair the roof of his house that is now in bad condition. Therefore, he wants to make the needed repairs so that he can enjoy a decent home. In the future, he will continue studying to aim for a job that will allow him to make a better income to be able to always help his parents and to build an addition to their small home.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for the repair of his roof.

loans.name: Benito Porfirio

texts.es:
Benito es socio de Banco Comunal Mar del Plata. 
Benito es conviviente, tiene 36 años y 2 hijos de 13 y 11 años. Los dos estan en la escuela. 
Benito tiene su negocio de venta de ropa, empezó con este negocio desde hace 3 años, él vende en varios mercados, camina ofreciendo su mercadería .Benito trabaja solo.  
Benito necesita un préstamo de 400 soles, dinero que será invertido en su mercadería, va a  comprar ropa.
Benito sueña con aumentar su negocio y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Benito is a member of the Mar del Plata community bank. He's 36 years old, partnered and has 2 children, 13 and 11 years old. Both children are in school. Benito operates a business selling clothing. He began the business 3 years ago. He sells his merchanise in different markets, working as a street vendor. Benito needs a 400-soles loan, money that he will invest in buying clothes for resale. He would like to expand his business and build a house.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Sao

texts.en:
Mrs. Sao E. was born in 1972 and now lives in the Smorn Pream Village in Takeo Province. Mrs. Sao E. has a child who is six years old, who is now attending the local school. 

Mrs. E. has a small piece of land where she cultivates rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. HE. Ho, is a motorbike taxi driver. Since both these business activities generate a small income and their family members live in an old house, Mrs. Sao E. has decided to ask for a loan. She hopes to add to her savings so that she can build a new house for her household. Hopefully this will improve their living conditions. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To build a new house for her family so that their living conditions and quality of life is improved.

loans.name: Sophan

texts.en: Mr. Sophan L. is a villager in Samraong Village in Takeo Province. He is a pig breeder. Mr. Sophan L. is 55 years old and the father of three children. One of his children is employed in a garment factory while another one helps him in the business and the youngest one is attending the local school. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand, so he decided to ask for a loan of $375 to buy six more piglets. He would use the rest of the loan to buy more pig food to feed his pigs. His wife, Mrs. Keo Im, is a farmer who cultivates rice for a living.  She appears on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy six piglets and to buy more pig food to feed his pigs.

loans.name: Savdagul

texts.en:
Savdagul is a hard-working entrepreneur from Dushanbe, the capital of Tajikistan. She and her husband have four children. She runs a business where she sells kids' clothing and women's underwear. Savdagul started her business 28 years ago and has run it with both extreme care and seriousness. Her daughters help Savdagul with her business. It is an important source of income for her family of six, considering that her husband does not earn enough money.
