Savdagul has requested a loan of 2500 Somoni so that she can purchase additional inventory of winter clothing for kids and to continue developing her business. Thanks to this loan, she will be able to grow her business further and help feed her family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase winter clothing for kids.

loans.name: Ven

texts.en: Ven T. is 40 years old and lives with her husband in the Bati district, Takeo province. To earn a living, she grows rice and sells noodles from her home. On average, she makes about $1 of profit per day. Her husband, shown in the photo, fixes TVs and radios. He makes about $6 a day. This couple has six children, four of whom are in school and two of whom are too young to attend school. Mrs. Ven T. is asking for a loan to purchase tools for her husband's work.

loans.use: To purchase tools

loans.name: Rosca

texts.en: Rosca O. has 16 years of experience in agriculture and launched his own small business six years ago. He owns 0.9 hectares of Sauvignon grapevines that produced 2,000 liters of wine last year. He also cultivates seeds on 1.3 hectares of land to support his family and their animal production. This agricultural activity enables Rosca to cover his family’s consumption needs. He plans to plant a 0.8-hectare vineyard of table wine grapes. In the long term, O. hopes to open his own grocery store.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger B. owns a small farm in his village. He is 38 years old and has four children. When he is not busy on his farm, he drives a tricycle, a passenger transport, that can carry a maximum of three people. He has a wife, Melanie B.. They work together and grow crops to support the needs of their family.

He is requesting a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI. Roger will use the loan to buy fertilizers and quality seeds. He will also try venturing to another line of business. In that way, he could be able to contribute well to the family income.

CEVI is non-profit organization that helps people start and have their own business. CEVI provides their clients with credit, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Dominica

texts.es: Dominica cuenta con 46 años, está casada hace 8 años, es madre de 8 hijos, de los cuales 3 de ellos migraron a Lima en busca de un porvenir diferente. Desde hace 10 años, junto a su esposo, se dedica a la agricultura de forma artesanal, cultivan papa, alverjas, olluco y demás hortalizas. Durante la temporada de cosecha, Dominica cocina para su familia y todos los peones; los hombres van sacando las papas de la tierra, mientras que las mujeres las seleccionan según el tamaño. Buscando la practicidad, Dominica encarga que de inmediato se hagan las cargas para enviar a los mercados para no perder tiempo. Por lo cual se siente muy contenta por la buena organización y trabajo compartido que realiza con su esposo, nos dice que trabajando en comunicación constante se siente menos cansancio y se aprovechan todos los beneficios del campo. Dominica no solo cocina para sus peones, sino que muchas veces es contratada para preparar la comida en las fiestas patronales de su pueblo (Como la vemos en la foto). Con estas actividades, ha podido brindarles la educación y alimentación a sus hijos, sus anhelos a futuro son de incrementar sus siembras para comprar terrenos agrícolas que se le sean muy rentables. Este es su 7mo crédito con MFP, y en todo este tiempo pagó puntualmente en las fechas señaladas. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos como la urea y el nitrato, los cuales servirá para abonar sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
Dominica, 46, has been married for 8 years. She has 8 children, 3 of them have migrated to Lima looking for a different future. For 10 years she and her husband have worked in agriculture. They grow potatoes, peas, “olluco” (a different type of potato used in stews), and other produce. During the harvest season Dominica cooks for her family and all the other workers. The men take the potatoes from the earth while the women sort them according to size. Being practical and not wanting to waste any time, Dominica makes sure that they immediately load the produce to send to market. She feels content about the good organization and the work she shares with her husband. She feels less tired because they are in constant communication while working and they can take advantage of the benefits of the country. Dominica not only cooks for the workers, but many times she is contracted to prepare the food for the community festivals in her town (as seen in the photo). Through these activities she has been able to feed and educate her children. Her goals for the future are to increase her plantings in order to buy agricultural land that will be profitable. This is her 7th loan with MFP, and in all that time she has always repaid her loans on time. The loan she is now asking for is to buy chemical fertilizers like urea and nitrate to fertilize her potato crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret A. is a 55-year old fish seller. She lives in the Nylanda slum in Kisumu where she sells fish that she purchases from nearby Dunga Beach. She is asking for 10,000 KSH to increase her ability to buy more fish. 

Margret recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: Purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Mrs. Rosario T. has been an active member of Paglaum MPC for three years. She is married and all of her children are already married. Her husband is a carpenter. Only the two of them are living in their home.

Her economic activity is backyard gardening just to help her husband in generating income. Her garden is planted with different kinds of root crops. Her latest loan is intended to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor for soil cultivation.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and labor costs for cultivation

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia tiene 34 años, es madre de 3 hijos, vive con su pareja quien la apoya mucho en su trabajo. Desde hace 2 años tiene un negocio de venta de bebidas (cervezas y gaseosa) en un lugar que acondiciona en su propia casa para ello. Su vivienda está ubicada en una calle por donde transitan muchas personas, y debido al intenso calor de la región, las ventas son muy buenas. Silvia quiere surgir y salir adelante, por ello que se esfuerza para que su negocio se convierta en lugar conocido y de mucha concurrencia, además de tener una tienda grande donde venda productos comestibles y diversos artículos. Este es su 2do préstamo con MFP, y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que todos sus compañeros son muy comprensibles ante los problemas de los demás, pero al mismo tiempo fomentan la responsabilidad y puntualidad en el pago de las cuotas. El dinero que solicita será invertido en la construcción de un kiosco en la parte delantera de su casa para vender con mayor comodidad, asimismo comprará mayor cantidad de gaseosas y cervezas.
texts.en:
Silvia is 34 years old, is the mother of 3 children and lives with her partner who greatly supports her work. For the past two years, she has had a business of selling drinks (beer and soda) from her own home. Her home is located in a heavily trafficked street; and due to the intense heat in the region, the sales are very good.

Silvia wants to expand and move forward, and is therefore putting forth a lot of effort to turn her business into a well-known place with a lot of customers, as well as having a bigger store where she sells groceries and other goods.

This is her second loan with MFP, and what she likes about her communal bank is that all of the partners are very understanding of others’ problems, but at the same time encourage responsibility and punctuality with the repayment quota.

The money that she is requesting will be invested in the construction of a kiosk in front of her house in order to sell with greater convenience, as well as to buy greater quantities of sodas and beer.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Sattin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a kiosk and purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Sarann

texts.en:
Mr. Sarann M. is 47 years old and lives in Kandal Leu village in Kandal province. He owns a small business that sells glue to repair leaking boats. Since his business is doing well, he wants to expand it by purchasing more glue to resell so as to earn more profits.

His wife, Mrs. Mouk Samey, is a housewife who takes care of her babies. This couple has seven children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, another is an electrician, three are enrolled in the local school, while the youngest one is too young to work or study. His wife is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more glue to resell to earn more profits

loans.name: Rina Isabel

texts.es: La señora Rina tiene su movilidad que trabaja como radio taxi, es también enfermera y trabaja en una farmacia por la tarde y por la mañana trabaja atendiendo a una persona de la tercera edad; su esposo es quien trabaja con la movilidad, ambos se apoyan mutuamente para los gastos de la casa, tienen tres hijos y el crédito será invertido en la compra de un equipo de computación para sus hijos, es una cliente puntual y responsable.
texts.en:
Rina works as a radio taxi driver. She is also a nurse, and works in a pharmacy in the afternoons and in the mornings she is a caretaker for an elderly person. Her husband also drives a radio taxi. Both of them work to cover the household costs and support the family. They have 3 children, and the requested loan will be used to pay for computer equipment for their children. She is a punctual and responsible member of the communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in computer equipment for her children

loans.name: Dabawara 3  De (Dabawara Tingolé) Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes que compose le  groupe DABAWARA 3 de l’association DABAWARA  sont  toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des familles polygames à TINGOLE  un chef lieu de commune de la sous préfecture de  FANA, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités hivernales. Les spéculations sont l’arachide et le sorgho. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution et tous les prêts passés se sont bien dénoués.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, de l’engrais, de l’herbicide, des petits matériels  agricoles et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 16 hectares.
Après les récoltes, une partie de leur production est auto consommée et l’autre partie est vendue dans les marchés de Marka-Coungo et Fana  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, généralement des revendeurs et de quelques consommateurs. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25 000FCFA après la campagne.
texts.en:
The six women who make up the DABAWARA 3 group of the DABAWARA association are all married, and on average are 40 years old with 4 children. They live in polygamous families in TINGOLE, the commune administrative center of the sub prefecture of FANA, in the second administrative region of Mali. They work with the Soro Yiriwaso micro finance institution to carry out their winter occupation. They speculate peanuts and sorghum. This is their fifth collaboration with this institution and all of their previous loans have been well resolved. With this new loan, they intend to buy fertilizer, herbicide and small farm equipment, and to pay the hoeing and labor expenses to maintain 16 hectares. After the harvest, they will consume a part of their goods and the other part will be sold in the Marka-Coungo and Fana markets to a clientele composed of men and women, who are generally retailers with a few consumers. They count on making an average profit of 25 000 CFA francs after the campaign.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, fertilizer, herbicide, hoeing et small farm equipment.

loans.name: Nourn

texts.en:
Nourn L. is 54 years old, married and has four children. She lives with her husband in Takeo Province. To make a living, she and her husband raise pigs, and usually earn about $1.80 a day. L. also sells traditional Cambodian cakes when she is free from other work. The family also gets help from two of their children, who work in construction and sales.

The financial crisis has made things difficult for businesses in Cambodia over the last year, especially for poor people like L.. In light of the country's economic difficulties, L. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of $800 to buy a motorbike, which will open up a great opportunity for her husband, who could use it to work as motor-taxi driver and generate more income for the family.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Mrs. Mich Suon Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en:
A village bank loan which consists of eighteen people is located in Sdau Aem village in Takeo province and all the members will use the loan in different purposes. Mrs. Mich S. is the village bank president. She is a weaver. Aside from this work, she is a farmer who owns a pL. of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to buy fertilizer and hire laborers to work on the field. In order to solve this problem, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Mrs. Mich S. is a 37-year-old single with two sisters who are employed in a garment factory.        

Five members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire laborers to work on the field.

loans.name: Esther Wanjiku

texts.en:
Esther K. is a 30-year-old single lady whose business is selling different electrical items. She operates her business in Dagoretti Market, which has a lot of electronics dealers. She has been in the retail business for about one year. Esther was introduced to KADET by a friend despite having no previous borrowing history with any other MFI. She intends to use the loan to grow the inventory in her electronics retail shop. In future she hopes to sell to bigger institutions and other shops. 

About KADET

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Increasing inventory

loans.name: Firida

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 34  years old Firida  S.  from Mbozi . She is married  with 6  children, between the ages of 10 and 18 . Firida has been running a clothes  business since 2002 . Client’s business is purchasing  and selling clothes. She works at the business for 9-12  hours per day, 6  days per week a. Firida currently earns about 250 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more clothes in bulk  for  her business. In the future, she plans to open the same business at new location . Firida thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes in bulk

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel R. is from the village of Bugwac, Catohugan Mahinog Camiguin Province. She is 28 years old. Ethel is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Ethel owns & operates a variety store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Ethel has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ethel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ethel is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ethel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Saroem

texts.en:
Mrs. Saroem S. was born in 1962. She lives in Preak Ta Sao Village in the Kandal Province. She and her husband, Mr. Yort Vannak, are farmers who own a piece of land on which they grow vegetables. They have two children who are enrolled in the local school.

Now, they would like to grow an additional crop, beans, but they don't have enough money. Thus, Mrs. Saroem S. has decided to ask for loan. She will use the loan to buy bean seeds, beanpoles, fertilizers, pesticides, and to hire a laborer for plowing. She hopes to increase her family's income and improve their livelihood with this loan.

loans.use: To buy bean seeds, beanpoles, fertilizers, pesticides, and to hire a laborer for plowing.

loans.name: Bros

texts.en:
Mr. Bros N. is a villager in Rung Village in Takeo Province.  He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice.  His wife, Mrs. N. Nub, helps him on the farm. He is the father of two children, a garment factory worker and a student at a local school.

Mr. Bros N. faces an obstacle because he does not have enough money to buy rice seed, pesticides, and fertilizers to support a productive farm. Thus, he decided to request a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, pesticides, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Afees

texts.en:
Afees is 33 years old. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She has 4 children and she is happily married. 

Afees sells frozen foods to her customers at retail prices . This is the busy season for her business and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She has been in this business for 8 years. 

Afess is a client of the Lift above Poverty Organization (LAPO). LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and throughout Africa. She is hoping for a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more frozen foods to sell. She says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La socia es natural de la ciudad de Urcos de la provincia de Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “Qori Orcco” de la Asociación Arariwa. El nombre del banco es de origen de la lengua Quechua que traducido al español significa “Cerro de Oro”. 

Nuestra socia GRACIELA tiene 43 años, es casada y tiene cinco hijos que todavía dependen de ella: Kelly tiene 24 años y estudia en un Instituto Superior la carrera profesional de Administración de Hotelera, Anali tiene 23 años y estudia en el Instituto “San Rosa” para ser docente en educación, Jonatan tiene 17 años y estudia en el programa de pre ingreso a la Universidad Nacional San Antonio Abad del Cusco, Libeth y Roxana estudian en el colegio.        

La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el negocio de venta de pan. La socia tiene su propio puesto de trabajo en los alrededores de la plaza de armas de Urcos. Ella nos cuenta que desde muy niña a lado de su mamá vendía pan desde las 4 a.m. hasta las 9 p.m. todos los días pero ahora ella es independiente. Ella alquila un horno con varias compañeras de negocio y ahí preparan sus propios panes. Ella y sus compañeras desde hace 2 años atrás se les ocurrió crear un panteón especial que lo llamaron “chuta navideña” que tiene las mismas características del pan chuta (Pan redondo blando con un olor peculiar y es un pan gigante) pero le agregaron pasas y frutas. Ya son varios años que tiene el negocio de venta de panes chuta y le ha ido muy bien, gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que a pesar de las adversidades de la vida esta sacando profesionales a sus hijos. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar mas insumos como harina, azúcar, manteca, frutas y pasas para preparar las “chutas navideñas” para estas fiestas navideñas ya que por estas épocas es donde se vende más. 
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Graciela is a native of the city of Urcos in the Quispicanchis province of the department of Cusco. She belongs to the communal bank "Qori Orcco," which is part of the Arariwa Association. The name of the bank has its origin in the Quechua language and translated into Spanish, means "Cerro de Oro" (Golden Hill). Graciela is 43 years old, married and has 5 children that are dependent upon her: Kelly is 24 and studies hotel administration in the Instituto Superior, Anali is 23 and studies in the Instituto "San Rosa" to become a teacher, Jonatan is 17 and studies in the pre-entrance program of the National San Antonio Abad del Cusco University, Libeth and Roxana study in school. Graciela alternates her activities in the home with her business selling bread. She has her own stand in the vicinity of the Plaza de Armos in Urcos. She tells us that from the time that she was very young she sold bread along with her mother from 4am until 9pm every day, but now she is independent. She rents an oven with a number of business partners and there she makes her own bread. Two years ago, she and her partners had the idea to make a special bread that they call "chuta navideña" that has the same characteristics of the chuta bread (a bread typically sold in Cusco that is soft and round and very large and has a characteristic aroma) but they add fruit and raisins. She has had her business selling chuta bread for a number of years now, and it has gone very well, thanks to all of the effort that she puts into her work. She is an enterprising and hardworking woman who, in spite of the difficulties in life, is managing to help her children become professionals. She needs a loan to buy more supplies such as flour, sugar, butter, fruit and raisins to prepare the chutas navideñas for the Christmas festivities, since this is the season when she can increase her sales. She is very grateful for the opportunity provided through these means, and pledges to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies such as flour, sugar, butter, fruit and raisins to prepare the “chutas navideñas” for the Christmas festivities

loans.name: Susana Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En el municipio El Viejo de Chinandega, la señora Susana D. se dedica a su actividad de venta de hielo, helados y refrescos elaborados por ella misma con mucha dedicación y con un toque de mucho sabor que hace que los clientes le compren dichos productos.
Ella está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de linaza, cebada, azúcar, bolsas, canela, entre otros. Esta materia prima la utilizará para la elaboración de los refrescos y helados. Ella espera muy confiadamente en que su crédito será otorgado y así continuará manteniendo a sus cuatros hijos en edad escolar a los que tanto ama.
texts.en:
Ms. Susana D. dedicates herself to selling ice, popsicles and refreshments in the El Viejo municipality of Chinandega. She makes these products herself with much dedication, and with such flavor that her customers like to buy her goods. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of linseed, barley, sugar, bags, and cinnamon, among other items. These are the primary ingredients she uses to make her refreshments and popsicles. She hopes confidently that her loan will be granted, which will help her to continue supporting her four school-aged children who she loves very much.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase linseed, barley, sugar, bags, cinnamon.

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
Mrs. Ry N. is a 24-year-old farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. She lives with her husband in Thkov village in Takeo province. Her husband, Mr. Vuthy Kang, is a construction worker who earns a small salary to support the family. They have a child who is too young for school. In order to support the field, she decided to ask for a loan to buy two oxen to use as work animals on the farm. 
Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy two oxen to use as work animals

loans.name: Sabine

texts.fr: Sabine D. est une femme de 49 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de MBORO depuis 10 et a eu 20 expériences avec le crédit. Avec son nouveau prêt elle compte développer un petit commerce de tissus; du tissus qu'elle achète en gros pour revendre au détail dans son quartier. Son objectif est de subvenir aux besoins familiaux et d'assurer en partie le ravitaillement alimentaire mensuellement.
texts.en:
Sabine D. is a 49-year-old woman who is married and the mother of six children. She has been a member of Banc Villageois de MBORO for ten years and has had twenty loan experiences. With her new loan, she intends to develop her small fabrics business. She buys fabrics wholesale to sell retail in her area. Her goal is to provide for the family and to make sure in part that food is resupplied each month.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her investment capacity

loans.name: Edencita

texts.en:
Edencita R. is from the village of Prk. A, Bonifacio, Lugait Misamis Oriental. She is 48 years old and married with 7 adult children. She operates a business making and selling food — primarily snacks and other delicacies — from which she makes  approximately 4,000 PHP a month. 

In 2009, Edencita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Edencita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to to purchase raw ingredients. Edencita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Edencita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Prk. A, Bonifacio, Lugait, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Aminat

texts.en:
Aminat is 48 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in Lagos, Nigeria, and owns a retail shop where she sells drinks, groceries and plastics to her customers. She runs her business with her husband's help and support. She likes her work because it gives her the opportunity to interact with her wonderful customers.
Aminat hopes to expand her business in the future. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more drinks to sell. This will enable her to meet customer demand and increase her profit. She plans to join her income with that of her husband to give their children a better education. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Solange

texts.en:
Solange is 29 and is still single. She is known as a nurse and she provides medical services to the people from her area. She employs four nurses in her small dispensary who work in shifts to cover the full 24 hours.

Solange has an idea of expanding her small dispensary by adding two rooms so that she may cater to a larger number of clients. Apart from adding those two rooms, she will also try to renovate the existing rooms by painting them.

To end this, Solange needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. If successful, she hopes to provide a better service to her clients and, hopefully, her profits will be increased.

loans.use: To add two more rooms and renovate the existing ones

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has run his food stall in Naivasha for the last three years. He is married to Monicah Akai and they have six school-going children.

Peter was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan which he plans to use to buy supplies for his food kiosk which includes, flour, sugar and cooking fat.

Peter hopes to grow his food kiosk in future, have a loyal customer base, and turn it into a more profitable operation.

loans.use: To buy cooking fat, flour and sugar in bulk

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita, 32 years old, is a rice farmer from Agusan Del Sur.  She manages a rice field.  She also has a sari-sari store business.  She supports her family of four children and works hard in order to have a good harvest.

She is limited in her capital, so that’s why she joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to avail herself of a loan.  She’s requesting 7,000 PHP to support her business.

loans.use: For farm supplies

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is married with eight children and five of her children go to school.  She lives in a rented two-room house.  Rose doesn’t take care of additional family members.  She owns a retail shop in Kamwokya Kifumbira. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of sugar, boxes of soap, cartons of salt, bags of rice, beans, trays of eggs and cakes.  She has been in this business for many years.  Besides this business, she also owns eight rental rooms in the village.  Her major customers are community members. She works seven days a week.   Her business challenges are increase in prices of merchandise and transportation of merchandise from Kikuubo in Kampala city to her shop in Kamwokya.  She aspires to buy iron sheets to complete her unfinished house. Rose joined MCDT because of their methodology and because of school fees loans.  Her monthly expenses include food, school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: To  buy more sugar, soap, salt, eggs and beans

loans.name: Benijean

texts.fr:
Jeune homme âgé de 27ans, marié et père de 2 ennfants.Il est dans ce commerce depuis 2008 et veux devenir grossiste.son esprit d'ouverture lui permet d'avoir autres visions que ce qu'il fait maintenant, pour cela, il pense maîtriser les prix d'achats afin de revendre avec des prix concurrentiels pour attirer plus de la clientèles et gagner plus de bénéfice.
son épouse est couturière, pour l'éducation de leurs 2enfants, il voudrai la soutenir en lui ouvrant un atelier de couture et faire de sa boutique une boucherie avec des produits plus variés, il a aussi entre autre une cabine téléphonique qui fonctionne avec un générateur et de plus en plus les besoins en électricité est Pressant, il aspire a d'autres opportunités pour atteindre son but.
l'actuel prêt lui permettra de se stabilisé dans son activité et soutenir son épouse dans sa couture afin de permettre a leurs enfants de faire des bonnes études.
Dans son quartier, il est considéré comme débrouillard et les gens le félicite beaucoup.
texts.en:
This young man, age 27, is married and the father of two children. He has been in this business since 2008 and would like to become a wholesaler. His open attitude allows him to imagine other possibilities than what he is presently doing, so he would like to get his purchasing prices straightened out and his prices competitive. Then he can attract more customers and make more profit. His wife is a seamstress and so that they can educate their children, he intends to support her work by opening up a sewing workshop for her. He plans to turn her old place of business into a butcher shop with a varied inventory. Among other things, he also has a phone booth which runs on a generator, and as the need for electricity becomes more and more of a problem, he is looking toward other opportunities to reach his goal. This loan will allow him to stabilize his business and help his wife out with her sewing activities, so that their children will be able to do well in school. In his neighborhood he is considered a "can-do" kind of person and people praise him a lot.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: expand his business and his shop

loans.name: Eam

texts.en: Eam R., 31, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. R. grows rice to sell for an income of US $0.80 per day. Her husband sells meatballs, earning an income of about US $10 per day to help cover the family expenses. R. is requesting a loan of US $700 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to transport meatballs to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to transport meatballs to sell

loans.name: Yoshmatkhodja

texts.en:
P. Yoshmatkhodja is 52 years old. He is married with 6 children. Yoshmatkhodja sells foodstuff like macaroni, wheat, buckwheat, cottonseed oil, tea and many other products. The business is private. When Yoshmatkhodja started the business 15 years ago it was only retail sales. Gradually expanding the business he purchased larger supplies of goods and as a wholesaler, distributed it among the stores. The business became successful and stable. Currently Yoshmatkhodja requests a loan of 13000 Somoni. The loan will be spent purchasing foodstuff to increase the variety of goods sold. Yoshmatkhodja thanks all those supporting him and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase supplies of foodstuff in order to increase the variety of goods sold.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi A. is a married woman who, together with her husband, takes care of two children. She has received junior high education. Her husband is a driver.

Esi sells maize and gari (a couscous-like grain made from grated cassava) at Abura and uses the earnings from her sales to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Esi will use the loan to purchase more bags of cereals for sale.

With the new profits she is going to earn as a result of the loan, Esi will put up a structure to keep her goods in since she currently keeps them in her room.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of cereals to sell

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en:
Juanito C. is from the village of Eastern Poblacion, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. He is 45 years old, married and has 6 adult-aged children. Juanito owns and operates a business providing motocycle "pedicab" transportation in the local community. Juanito has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Juanito joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juanito has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. Juanito is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Juanito from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to provide for his family's financial needs.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou Y. is from the town of Banga. She is 38 years old and is married with three children.

Marilou owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Like other entrepreneurs, she wants her business to prosper.

Marilou joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.

Marilou is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business and save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Carmen Beatriz

texts.es:
CARMEN BEATRIZ C. B.
NUEVAMENTE  LA SEÑORA CARMEN BEATRIZ  C. B. SOLICITA UN REFINANCIAMIENTO DE CREDITO PARA SEGUIR INVIRTIENDO EN SU NEGOCIO.  CADA DIA ELLA TIENE NUEVOS PEDIDOS DE PARTE DE SUS CLIENTES EN UNA O DOS COSAS LAS CUALES MUCHAS ELLA NO TIENE EN SU NEGOCIO.  SIEMPRE CADA DIA ELLA DECEA SATISFACER LA NECESIDAD DE LOS COMPRADORES, CON LA AYUDA DE SU ESPOSO ELLA SIGUE LUCHANDO PARA QUE EL NEGOCIO SIGA CRECIENDO YA QUE LA META COMO FAMILIA Y PROPIETARIA DEL NEGOCIO ES TENER UN GRAN DEPOSITO DE ARTICULOS DE PRIMERA NECESIDAD EN LA ALDEA Y SER LOS DISTRIBUIDORES DE LAS PEQUEÑAS TIENDAS DEL AREA.
texts.en:
In order to continue investing in her business, Ms. Carmen Beatriz C. B. is once again requesting a loan. Each day, she has new orders from her customers for one or two things that she does not have many of in her store. She always wants to satisfy the needs of her customers. With the help of her husband, she continues to fight for her business to keep growing. Her goal for her family and as a business owner is to have a large stock of staple items in the village, and to be a distributor to the small stores in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to stock up on staple items

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles L. is an older married man with for four children. His wife is a farmer in Bukura whereas he does welding services for the local people and schools around Bukura in Kakamega. Kakamega is in the western side of Kenya. It is well known as the sugar belt region for its large production of sugarcane. He has been in this business for the last four years. Charles says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is lack of staff and enough money to facilitate transportation of his products. However, he works very hard everyday to ensure that his business is doing well. 

He is using his loan of Kes 30,000 to buy a drilling machine. This will increase efficiency, therefore serving more customers. He hopes to open another metal shop in Kakamega. In the future, he hopes to open a college to educate young people about the kind of business that he does. He describes himself as very hardworking and determined.

loans.use: Drilling machine

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: la Sra. Maria del Carmen  tiene 31  años D. edad, tiene 2 hijos ya mayores D. edad. Ella es separada vive en la casa D. su madre, casa D. material noble D. un piso. La Sra. Maria del Carmen se dedica  a la venta D. pasteles y queques, ella se dedica a este negocio hace 5 años, se inicio como ayudante, la clienta cuenta con pedidos D. colegios para la elaboracion D. sus productos. La Sra. Maria del Carmen como toda persona cuenta con sueños y objetivos aun que cumplir, su deseo es poder crecer en su negocio. Con el dinero que solicita invertira en la compra D. mas insumos y activo fijo para su negocio.
texts.en:
María del Carmen, 31, has two adult children.  She is separated and lives in her mother’s house, a one story house maD. from substantial materials.

She sells cakes.  She has been in this business for five years.  She started out as an assistant.  She has standing orders from schools for her products.

María del Carmen, just like everyone, has dreams and objectives to reach.  Her wish is to make her business grow.

She will use the requested funds to buy more ingredients and supplies for her business.

loans.use: To buy cake making ingredients.

loans.name: Chanda

texts.en:
A dedicated member of ASHI since 2007, Chanda has been a model member demonstrating regular attendance at weekly meetings and timely repayments on loans. Since joining ASHI, she has gained more self-confidence as a entrepreneur managing her own endeavor.

Chanda wants to request a much larger loan to support the needs of her fishing business and at the same time to continue its operation. With Chanda’s passion for giving her family a brighter tomorrow, she will be eager to work hard and help her husband meet the needs of her family. 

Now, Chanda’s business has been very helpful in achieving her family dreams. Her greatest hope is that her family will be able to have a decent way of life. Her long term goals are to help support her children’s education until college is completed, invest and build a better house for the family, to move above the poverty line.

loans.use: To support the needs of her fishing business and it's continued operation.

loans.name: Nancy Wangari

texts.en:
Nancy has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years.  She is 35 years old, married to Geoffrey Mathenge and they have two children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her third loan.  She repaid all her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer and pay for labor.

In the future, Nancy hopes to buy more land and practice farming on a large scale.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay for labor

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa Z. is a farmer from the village of Nahapetavan in the Shirak region of Armenia. She is happily married and has two sons (28 and 30 years old). She has a high school education and has been raising cattle for the past 30 years.  

With microfinance services, she is looking to grow her business. Larisa would like a loan to purchase additional calves. This investment can increase the family income by 15 percent. Larisa enjoys being an entrepreneur and providing for the family. Larisa also helps her relatives living in the town of Artik.  She is also saving money to help her son pay off his mortgage. She enjoys living in Nahapetayan, surrounded by relatives and friends.

loans.use: To purchase calves.

loans.name: Res

texts.en:
Res S. is a long-time businesswoman and a low-income person. She has been operating a beauty business since 2005. Res S. owns a kiosk in front of garment factory in Phnom Penh City where she sells a variety of products from her shop. She sells items such as perfumes, beauty products, and some fake jewelry to people who are working in the factory and others. She earns an average income of  $3 per day. 

Res S. is married to 47-year-old, Meas Sambath, who is a motor taxi driver (Tuk Tuk). The coupleare blessed with four children, two of whom are single and the other two are married. In order to earn extra profit and to make the business more successful, Res S. will be using the loan she requested to buy a large supply of  inventory items.

loans.use: To buy a large supply of inventory items.

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es: La señora Juana Maria C., tiene la edad de 58 años vive en el Barrio de San Caralampio, ella y su esposo son agricultores, tienen 6 hijos todos mayores de edad, casados e independientes y le apoyan a sus padres, la señora Juana se ha dedicado a estas actividades desde hace 25 años atrás, ella solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos vegetativos, fertilizantes y fungicidas que aporten un mantenimiento Fito Sanitario correcto que beneficie su producción y sus ventas, a favor de reforestar la finca y establecer una nueva variedad e cosechas que tengan un buen consumo, esta inversión les favorecerá la sus recursos económicos para un retiro de trabajo mas optimo.
texts.en: Juana Maria C. is 58 years old and lives in San Caralampio neighborhood.  Both she and her husband are farmers.  They have six grown-up children who are all married, live independently and support their parents.  Juana has been working as a farmer for the past 25 years.  She is requesting a loan to buy farming supplies, fertilizers and fungicides to maintain good plant health that will favor her production and her sales.  This will help to reforest her farm and establish a new variety of harvests that are in demand.  This investment will improve her financial situation so that she can enjoy a better retirement.

loans.use: To maintain plant health

loans.name: Rayda

texts.es: Rayda, de 43 años, está casada con Mauro, de 46 años de edad. Ambos tiene 4 hijos, pero solo viven con 2 de ellos: Walter, de 22 y Carlos de 15 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Cumutay. Hace 30 años que se dedica a la siembra de papa y arveja, lo que después de cada cosecha los comercializa en el mercado mayorista de Tarma; pero ahora su dedicación y esfuerzo se multiplicaron ya que su esposo, y fiel compañero, está trabajando en una empresa de construcción de una hidroeléctrica, dejándola sola en el cuidado de sus cultivos, pero Rayda, tiene pensando contratar peones, para que le ayuden a sembrar papa para está temporada, y de esa manera poder dedicarle más tiempo al cuidado de sus animales; entre cerdos, toros, burros y corderos. Es el primer crédito con MFP, y se compromete en ser puntual con los pagos y las reuniones que se realiza en su banco comunal, donde está segura, saldrá adelante. De obtener el crédito solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de varios sacos de semilla de arveja, los cuales esparcirá en su próxima cosecha.
texts.en: Rayda, age 43, is married to Mauro, who is 46 years old. Together they have had 4 children, but only 2 are still living: Walter, age 22, and Carlos, age 15. As a family they live in their own house, located in the settlement of Cumutay. For the past 30 years, Rayda has worked growing potatoes and peas, which she sells after each harvest at the wholesale market in Tarma. However, her dedication and effort are now multiplied, because her husband and loyal companion is working for a company that is building a hydroelectric facility, leaving her alone to cultivate their crops. Rayda is thinking about hiring some laborers to help her plant the potatoes for this season, allowing her to dedicate more time to the care of her animals, which include pigs, bulls, burros and sheep. This is her first loan with MFP, and she is committed to being punctual with her payments and at the meetings held by her communal bank. She is certain that the group will help her get ahead. When she obtains the loan she is requesting, she will invest it in buying several sacks of pea seeds, which she will plant for the next harvest.

loans.use: Buying several sacks of pea seeds

loans.name: Djamiyla

texts.en:
Djamiyla A. is a 54-year-old farmer with three children. Her two daughters live on their own, and her youngest son lives with her and helps in breeding cattle. They started this business with the initial capital of 12,000 KGS and managed to earn about 8,000 KGS in a month. She works hard to develop her farm, and, for this reason, Djamiyla is applying for a loan of 40,000 KGS to purchase more livestock. Revenues from this loan will allow her to develop her business further and to improve her living conditions.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas, which leads to increased employment and meets the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim N. is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala Central region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom are currently in school. Shamim has a small retail shop business, which she has run for three years. She also has a second business – a boutique.
To help expand her business, Shamim has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase soap and sugar for the shop and clothes for the boutique for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Shamim hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes pay school fees for her children. In the future, she hopes to own a supermarket.

loans.use: To purchase soap and sugar for her shop and clothes for her boutique

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim is an optimistic lady who operates a business selling paper envelopes. She does this work to support her family financially. She receives orders from different shops in the market and fulfills their orders to make an income. She lives in Okara, which is located in Punjab, Pakistan, and is known for its dairy industry. She has lived there with her family in a two-room brick house the area of Sheikh basti for the past twelve years.

She is 43 years old and has five children. Her elder son has a job in a college and the second son has a construction supply business. Her remaining children are enrolled in school and getting their education. Her husband’s name is T., and he works in a medical clinic for a low income. His income was not enough for the whole family; that’s why Shamim started her business of selling paper envelopes.
 
Sharim has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, because she has a large order to fill. With the loan she will purchase paper envelopes in bulk that will help her to complete the orders on time and make extra income. She is hopeful that the loan money will prove to be beneficial for the improvement of her business, and that she will be able to manage the expenses of her home better. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy paper envelopes for reselling

loans.name: Eliada

texts.en:
Eliada L. is from the village of San Juan, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Eliada is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Eliada owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Eliada has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Eliada joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eliada has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds for her farm. Eliada is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Eliada from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Juana Olivia

texts.es: La Sra Juanita es una persona muy  trabajadora y respetuosa, ella esta casada con el Sr. Arturo Martínez  y juntos atienden  el negocio de  comida  que  tienen y  de esta   manera  ellos  salen adelante , su objetivo  principal es brindar  el mejor  servicio  a  sus  clientes,   en esta  ocasión requieren  el  crédito  para  comprar  mercancía para  su  negocio ya  que  este local  representa  la manera  en la  que  ellos  obtienen  sus  ingresos.
texts.en: Juanita is a very hardworking and respectful person.  She is married to Mr. Arturo Martinez and together they take care of the food business that they run, and through this they are moving ahead.  Her principle objective is to give her customers the best service.  Right now they need a loan to buy merchandise for the business, since this store is the way that they earn their living.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en:
Noun K. is 45 years old and is a rice farmer living in central Cambodia, in the capital, Phnom Penh. She is married and blessed with seven children.

Two of the children work at the factory as workers and earn approximately $140 per month. Her husband is a cow trader. The couple can make an average  income of $5.75 per day. Noun K. will use her loan of $1,100 from HKL to buy additional cows to help her on the farm and to supplement her husband's business.

She dreams of changing her present business and supporting her children to get a higher education.

loans.use: to buy additional cows to help her on the farm and to help her husband's business

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is a married lady with two children.  

For two years, she has been operating a hardware business with one employee. She gained experience for running the hardware business because she was previously employed in a hardware shop. 

She hopes to import hardware materials in the future. She has requested 50,000 KES to buy paints, nails, nuts and bolts.  Deborah's photo was taken when she had brought in new stock.

loans.use: To buy paints, nails, nuts and bolts

loans.name: Sabougnouman Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Sabougnouman, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 33 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Nalla, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de tubercules, de condiments, de céréales et du pain.                                                                                                                                 
Les femmes du groupe Sabougnouman sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des tubercules, des condiments, des céréales et du pain.                                                                         
La cliente ADIARRATOU D. compte acheter des tubercules (igname) avec les revendeurs de Fana. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place au village au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  10 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses familiales, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The members of the Sabougnouman group, all married women, are on the average 33 years old with   four children. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of  Nalla, Sub-prefecture of Fana, Koulikoro Region (the second administrative region of Mali). They know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends. They sell yams, condiments, cereals and bread. The members of the   Sabougnouman group are on their first solidarity loan, which will be used to purchase yams, condiments, cereals and bread.

Adiarratou D. plans to buy yam tubers from resellers in Fana. She sells daily in her village, for cash and on credit, to a customer base composed of men and women. She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 10,000 West African francs, which will be used to pay off the loan, pay for some family expenses, and cover her costs of participating in major social events, with the rest reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy yams

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana is 52 years old and married with three adult children. She is from the village of Maputi, Naawan, Misamis Oriental. To make a living, Feliciana owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. Her main source of income comes from buying and selling canned goods, junk food, eggs, detergent, shampoo, soap, and biscuits in the local community. Feliciana has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. 

Feliciana joined HSPFI in 2010 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. Feliciana is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional canned goods, junk food and beverages. This will be the second loan taken out by Feliciana from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve and expand her business.


About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, junk food and beverages

loans.name: Rosa Celestina

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Floreciendo, vive por la parroquia de Chiquintad, lugar en donde su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y al comercio, mucha de su población labora en la ciudad en diferentes áreas.
 
La Señora. Rosa tiene 51 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos de 31, 29, 27, 24 y 19 años de edad, su primer hijo es soltero y vive independiente, sus tres hijos siguientes son casados e independiente, su último hijo es soltero, trabaja y le ayuda economícamente. Su esposo labora en la construcción como albañil, con el trabajo conyugal han construido su casa.
 
Doña Rosa se dedica a la venta de productos naturales de Hebalife, actividad que la desempeña hace 2 años, trabaja de domingo a domingo y sin un horario fijo.

Este es su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos naturales de Hrvalife para incrementar su negocio.

Su meta es crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the “Mujeres Floreciendo” (Women in Bloom) communal bank.  She lives near Chiquintad Parish, a place where residents raise animals, farm and are merchants.  Many of its residents work in the city in different jobs.

Rosa is 51 years old, married and has five children who are 31, 29, 27, 24 and 19 years of age.  Her oldest son is single and lives independently.  The next three children are married and independent and the youngest is single, employed and helps her economically.  Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer.  Their joint efforts have made the construction of their house possible.

Rosa sells Herbalife natural products, an activity she’s been in for two years.  She works Sunday through Sunday with no fixed schedule.

This is the third loan she’s taken in the communal bank which she was invited to join by a friend.  She will use the money to buy Herbalife natural products to increase her business.  Her goal is to expand her business.

loans.use: Comprar productos naturales de Hervalife.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for horticultural seeds

loans.name: Kasuku Group

texts.en:
Maua, who is in her late 20s, is married with one child who goes to school.  She has been running two businesses.  She has a shop selling cosmetics and has sold charcoal as well for seven years now.  She works from 6am to 10pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 7th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her cosmetics stock and started charcoal business. She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She wants a loan to buy more cosmetics and increase her charcoal stock. Her dream is to one day finish building her house, which she has started.

She will share this loan with her loan  group "Kasuku" which has 20 members, who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and increase her charcoal stock.

loans.name: Duo Divino Maestro Group

texts.es:
DUO  DIVINO MAESTRO
Es integrada por doña Hilda  madre de 4 hijos, quien se dedica a la   venta de comida, refacciones  y golosinas  desde hace 3 años, Y es la lider del duo es una mujer  trabajadora  quien le brinda sola el sustento de su familia, ya que su  esposo abandono  su hogar ya hace varios años, todos los días vende y reparte comida en el mercado local de su comunidad con la ayuda de su segundo hijo quien regresa de sus estudios y despues le ayuda a vender, ella necesita el credito para la copra de productos comestibles para la elavoracion de refacciones para seguir con y no quedarle mal a sus clientes, como toda madre quiere lo mejor para sus hijos, su sueño es darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos 
Doña Josefina,  quien  vende actualmente toda clase de zapatos juntamente con su esposo iniciaron este negocio hace 6 años, la mayoría de sus productos  son elaborados por su esposo y varios empleados que tienen en su hogar, ha visto crecer su negocio poco a poco, ella atiende su local todos los días y así mismo puede dedicarle el tiempo a sus 2 pequeños hijos, necesita de capital por que la demanda que sus clientes piden en nuevos diseños. Es una joven mujer con muchas ganas de seguir ayudando a su  esposo  y mantenerse en el mercado.
texts.en:
'Divino Maestro' Group.

This group has two members.  Hilda is the mother of four children.  She has been selling food, snacks and candies for three years.  She is the leader of this group.  Hilda is a hard-working woman who is solely responsible for supporting her family as her husband left home several years ago.  Every day she sells food in the local market in her community with the help of her second son who comes home from school and then helps her to make her sales.  She needs this loan to buy food products for making snacks so that she can continue working and not let down her customers.  In common with all mothers, she wants the best for her children.  Her dream is to provide them with a better future.

Josefina and her husband currently sell all kinds of shoes.  They started their business six years ago.  Most of the products are made by Josefina's husband and several employees who work in their home.  She has seen her business grow gradually.  Josefina serves in her business every day and, at the same time, she is able to spend time with her two young children.  She needs capital because her customers keep requesting new designs.  Josefina is a young woman who has a great desire to continue helping her husband and stay in the market.

loans.use: to buy food products for making snacks

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is a married man with two children, both of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, he has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) business. His potential customers are his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of competition from other motorcycle operators in his business. His major dream is to expand his business and own a permanent house in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, he wants to start a clothes-selling business and purchase second hand clothes for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase second hand clothes

loans.name: Namroeun

texts.en:
Namroeun (pictured above) is a garment worker. Her husband, Sochea, is a construction worker. They have been married since 2005 and have a young son. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh, about 15 kilometers away from the city. 

Namroeun is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to drive to work.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a father of 4 children aged between 8 and 3 years, with first two already schooling. He has been in mixed farming for four years, producing and selling milk and maize to the local market.

Godfrey has made a first loan request with Juhudi Kilimo for 41,200 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the milk produced will help supplement the family meals as well as provide income for other needs. He remains optimistic with dairy due to past experience and hopes to own five dairy cows in five years.Godfrey says dairy diseases are a great threat to farming business. 

He is looking forward to repaying the loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 26 years old and single. She has a fish selling business in Panglao, Bohol. Josephine buys directly from fishermen in her town. She said she can get a lower price if she comes early and be the first one to buy fish from the fishermen. Josephine rents a stall in her town’s market to sell fish.

Josephine has requested this loan to buy more fish and containers. She hopes for her business to grow in the future.

loans.use: buy fish and containers

loans.name: Atakola Women's Group

texts.en:
The "parable of the talents" teaches that most people lack the confidence to do something because they are afraid of failure. 32-year-old Rose, a stickler of sorts for diligence, does not by any means look like she is like such people.

Her seven year-old pharmacy business is slowly establishing a "blue chip" reputation. Year in, Year out, the prospects of her business are looking brighter. On the strength of her good delivery of service, the ambitious mother of three has rode high on success. Rose set the ball rolling in her business on the heels of the completion of her studies. She majored in nursing.

Week in, week out, her business generates sales returns to the tune of 203,000 Ugandan shillings. Rose says she will bank on this Kiva loan money to purchase more drugs to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more drugs to resell.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 54 años, es una mujer encantadora, muy alegre y dinámica. Convive con su pareja y es madre de dos hijos, quienes ya son mayores e independientes. Juntos habitan en su casa propia. Su trabajo consiste en la venta de ropa y artículos para el hogar, siendo estos ofrecidos por medio de catálogos. Sus sistema de venta, es dejar a crédito los productos, y al cabo de un tiempo realiza la cobranzas, por otro lado, hay ocasiones que sale ella misma a ofrecer su mercadería de manera ambulante, ya sea amigos, familiares o compañeros de trabajo, que es en una institución para el estado. Tiene 10 años ejerciendo esta actividad, además que le gusta estar en contacto con la gente. Para el futuro quisiera montar una bodega en su casa y con ello tener un ingreso adicional, ya que tiene en mente su trabajo para dedicarse al comercio, que es la venta de ropa y artículos para el hogar. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, por lo que espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para continuar con su trabajo. Con el monto solicitado, comprará artículos para el hogar y ropa,
texts.en:
Carmen, 54, is a charming woman; she’s very cheerful and dynamic.  She lives with her spouse and is the mother of two children who are already independent adults.  They live together in their own home.  Her work consists in sale of clothes and articles for the home that are sold via catalogue.  Her method of operating is selling on credit and then collecting payment after a certain time.  On the other hand, she sometimes goes out herself to sell her wares among her friends, family members or coworkers in a state institution.

She’s been in this line of work for 10 years and she enjoys being in contact with the people.  In the future, she’d like to set up a store at her house to have an additional source of income because she has in mind to go into commerce, that is, the sale of clothes and items for the home.


This is the 8th MFP loan so she hopes for support from each of you to stay in business.  She will use the requested amount to buy items for the home and clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes and items for the home.

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
This is Lily, 42, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Victor, a sea man, and the mother to their three children. She, together with her children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lily operates a buy-and-sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and then sells the items for a little profit. Her products are children’s clothes, RTW and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 900 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy RTW products and merchandise items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Lily hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rosa, desea continuar trabajando con préstamos, porque estos le permiten invertir en el negocio y dar resultados, pagando las cuotas y quedando siempre un margen de ganancia.
Actualmente comprara shampoo, cremas, lociones, pinta uñas, para el negocio, esperando que este nuevo préstamo le de buenos resultados como el anterior. Su condición familiar ha mejorado aunque los integrantes siguen siendo los mismos, siente que cuentan con una mejor solvencia.
texts.en:
Rosa wants to continue working with loans because it allows her to invest in her business and pay back the loans while always maintaining a profit margin.

For now she will buy shampoo, creams, lotions, and nail polish for the business.  She hopes this new loan will be as successful as the previous one.  Her family situation has improved even though the number of members has not changed.  But she feels her ability to cover expenses has improved.

loans.use: To buy shampoo, creams, lotions, and nail polish for her business.

loans.name: Jose Armando

texts.es:
José Armando tiene 31 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con la familia en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.
LA VRC SAN JOSE, está conformada por 21 socios y socias se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia San José del Tambo a 60 minutos de la oficina. Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, plátano, cacao.
José se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, plátano, cacao las compras y las ventas las realiza en la Parroquia San José del Tambo. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas, insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá mejorar la calidad del producto. Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son: los intermediarios y plagas. El sueño es tener una finca y una casa.
En los tiempos libres le gusta  practicar el deporte  en especial el boley.
texts.en:
José Armando is 31, single, and has no children. He lives with his family in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province. The "San Jose" communal bank is made up of 21 members, and is located in San José del Tambo parish, 60 minutes from the branch office. 

The members of this communal bank work in short cycle agriculture, and grow corn, plantains and cacao. José is a farmer and grows corn, plantains and cacao. He carries out his purchases and sales in San José del Tambo parish.

He is applying for the loan to buy seeds, and agricultural supplies such as urea, herbicides, fertilizers, weed killer in order to maintain his crops in good condition. The loan will be a great help, because he will be able to improve the quality of his product. The challenges that frequently arise are: crop pests and dealing with middlemen. His dream is to have a large farm and a house. In his free time he likes to play sports, especially volleyball.
