loans.use: To buy seeds, and agricultural supplies, such as urea, herbicides, fertilizers, and weed killer.

loans.name: Diodora

texts.en:
Diodora is 48 years old. She is married and has two children who are in school. Diodora works very hard to provide for her family.

Diodora runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Diodora has been in this business for four years. She sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

Diodora would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Josie makes and sells viands and snacks like rice cakes and pancakes. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy raw ingredients for making viands and snacks.

Josie has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Josie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making viands and snacks

loans.name: Mujeres Con Futuro Group

texts.es:
El grupo "Mujeres con Futuro" esta conformado por 6 mujeres trabajadoras y muy responsables todas viven en la misma comunidad que se encuentra en lo mas alto de una colina, el nombre del grupo lo elijieron porque llevan tiempo trabajando en la institucion y en sus activiadades todas han prosprerado y se consideran mujeres sobresalientes es por eso que eligieron este nombre.
Marisol quien es la presentante del grupo tiene 28 años esta casada desde hace 9 años con el señor Anastacio quien trabaja de comerciante juntos han procreado 3 hijos David de 8 años se encuentra en tercer año de primaria, Leonardo Daniel de 6 años esta en 1 de primaria y Romina de tres años aun no va a la escuela.
Marisol se dedica a elaborar tejidos de estambre como chalecos, sueteres, tambien hace costuras (servilletas, manteles). Esta vez has solicitado el credito para comprar estambres, hilos, aujas, adornos u accesorios. 
Su desafio que presenta es que hay dias en los que no tiene dinero para cubrir con todos sus pedidos pendientes entonces muchas veces tiene que retrasarlos, tambien se le complica consegir el material a buen precio ella prefiere comprar sus productos por mayoreo yaq ue asi sale mas barato.
Una de sus metas es llegar a tener un local donde pueda exponer sus  bordados y tejidos tambien le gustaria enseñarle a otrs personas como se teje y borda.
Todas las integrantes estan muy contentsa y agradecidas ya que comentan "Gracias al prestamo nosotras comprraremos para invertir en nuestras actividades, yo Margarita comprare Juagolotes pra despues verder, yo talalia comprare productos de belleza para luego vender, yo Maridalia comprare guantes, gorros, bufandas para vender en este temporada de frios, yo karina invertire en una tienda de abarrotes, y yo Alicia invertire en pollos esto nos ayudara a mejorar nuestra calidad de vida"
texts.en:
The group, “Mujeres con Futuro” (Women with a Future) is made up of six hardworking and very responsible women from the same community.  The community is located atop a hill.  They selected this name because they’ve been working with the institution for a long time and they have all prospered in their businesses.  They consider themselves to be survivors, so they selected this name.


Marisol represents the group and is 28 years old.  She’s been married to Anastacio for nine years and they have three children, 8 year old David who’s in third grade, 6 year old Leonardo Daniel who’s in first grade, and 3 year old Romania who does not go to school yet.  Anastacio works as a merchant.


Marisol knits things like vests, sweaters, and also sews napkins and tablecloths.  This time she is asking for this loan to buy knitting needles, thread, sewing needles, adornments, and accessories.


Her challenge is that there are days where she doesn’t have enough money to fill all of her pending orders, so many times she has to backorder them.  It’s also difficult for her to find the raw materials at good prices.  She prefers buying her products in quantity because they’re less expensive.  One of her goals is to have a shop where she can show her embroidery and knitting.  She would also like to teach other people to knit and embroider.


All of the members are very happy and grateful and say, “Thanks to the loans, we are able to invest into our businesses.  I, Margarita, will buy toys to resell; I, Talalia will buy beauty products; I Maridalia will buy gloves, hats, and scarves for the cold season; I, Karina will invest in a grocery store; and I, Alicia will invest in chickens.”

loans.use: to buy supplies for needlework.

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
Wilfreda is from Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old. Wilfreda is married and has six adult-aged children. 

To make a living, Wilfreda owns and operates a business venture, providing repair services to local community members. Wilfreda has been engaged in her business for over 32 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Wilfreda is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional vehicle spare parts. In 2010, Wilfreda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional vehicle spare parts.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Galmamat

texts.ru: Галмамату 48 лет, женат, является отцом шестерых детей.  В поисках средств дохода для своей семьи, 7 лет назад Галмамат начал свой бизнес в откорме и перепродаже скота. Благодаря упорству и настойчивости Галмамата, начатое с суммы в 2,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство насчитывает на сегодня 12 голов баранов и одну корову и приносит около 2,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Также, Галмамат выращивает яблоки, урюк, картошку, что дает прибыль в сезон продаж. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Галмамат обратился в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы от кредита Галмамат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Galmamat is 48 years old, married and the father of six children. In the search of income for his family, Galmamat started his business of fattening and re-selling cattle 7 years ago. Thanks to Galmamat's persistence and perseverance, from starting with the amount of 2,000 som (KGS), the farm today counts 12 sheep and one cow and brings in around 2,000 som (KGS) per month. Galmamat also grows apples, apricots and potatoes, which gives a seasonal income.

In order to further increase the number of livestock, Galmamat turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of additional heads of cattle. Galmamat plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Tomas

texts.en:
Tomas is a married man. He has two children aged 2 years and 5 years. He describes himself as innovative and patient. He operates a retail store where he sells spare parts. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located at a densely populated and busy area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of goods sold. 

Tomas will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more spare parts. His business goal is to venture into running his own garage within five years.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts.

loans.name: Edson Ronald

texts.es: Edson es una persona muy sencilla y trabajadora él tiene 22 años de edad, no es casado ni tiene hijos pero si ayuda mucho a sus padres que por la edad no pueden seguir trabajando en la actividad de la agricultura además Edson  solo estudio hasta el nivel primario y no pudo seguir con sus estudios por problemas personales y económicos, así  de esta manera tuvo que dedicarse a la agricultura, Edson siembra papa, y tiene plantaciones de frutilla en los terrenos de sus padres, desde hace ya más de 7 años que se está dedicando a esta actividad, él nos cuenta que le va bien en el mercado pero quiere incrementar su producción ya que la actual es muy poca y solo le alcanza para el vivir diario, es por tal motivo que él solicita este nuevo crédito ya que él quiere incrementar su plantación de frutilla y así con el futuro poder ahorrar para comprarse sus propias tierras y dedicarse a la cría de ganado vacuno para así mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir apoyando a sus padres. Com el anterior crédito el pudo comprara insumos para la producción de frutilla, por eso, el nuevamente solicita éste con el mismo destino.
texts.en: Edson is a simple and hardworking person.  He’s 22 years old, not married, has no children, but he helps his parents very much with their farming.  Edson only completed elementary school and was not able to go any farther because of personal and financial issues, so he had to become a farmer.  Edson raises potatoes, has a plantation on his parents’ land, and has done this for more than 7 years.  He says that the market is good and that he wants to increase his production because the current one is very low and is just enough for his daily expenses.  He is asking for this loan so he can increase his strawberry production so that he can save up to buy his own land and raise cattle.  This will allow him to improve his quality of life and continue supporting his parents.  He used the money from the previous loan to buy supplies for strawberry production.  He will use this loan for the same thing.

loans.use: to buy strawberry seedlings.

loans.name: 01.09.03 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Cử is 65 years old and married with two children; they are grown up and not dependent on her. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in the Thanh Hoa province. She has a service business repairing phones; she has been doing this for three years. 

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Cử is the group leader of the 01.09.03 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. In 2011, Cử joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid three loans from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

She is requesting a loan to purchase a machine to repair phones.

With her business profit, Cử hopes that her family will be healthy and happy, that her business to do well, and that her children will find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase a machine to repair phones.

loans.name: Ave Maria Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AVE MARIA est composé de trois personnes qui sont issus de la même famille. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Suzanne1 (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 45 ans n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Suzanne1 est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Eloi. Le couple a quatre enfants, certains scolarisés et deux à leur charge. Suzanne1 vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son conjoint. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Suzanne1 vend des pâtes alimentaires et des produits cosmétiques à son domicile et de façon ambulante depuis neuf ans. Suzanne1 s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Suzanne1 ensemble avec les membres du groupe AVE MARIA sollicite pour la quatrième fois un crédit  auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des pâtes alimentaires et des produits cosmétiques.

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en:
Pascal is 22 years old. He is married with one child who has 2 years, not yet go to school. He is a farmer and he has been doing for the past 3 years. With the loan from kiva, he would like to pay the workers who harvested beans. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house and buy food for home consumptions.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay the workers who harvested beans.

loans.name: Francis Remberto

texts.es:
Francis vive con su pareja y dos hijos, para llevar el sustento a su hogar se dedica a vender minutas de sabores y otros productos para combatir el calor, su padre le enseño a desarrollar esta actividad y desde hace 12 años tiene su propio negocio, el cual mantiene funcionando gracias a su experiencia, en la actualidad tiene tres coches que son atendidos por sus empleados.
Con el financiamiento podrá comprar jaleas, hielo, limones, leche, vasos y cucharas desechables, etc., con ello tendrá más mercadería para salir a vender a otras zonas, sus objetivos son  atender mejor a sus clientes y aumentar sus ganancias.
Sus sueños son tener un negocio más grande, ofrecer empleo a otras personas y velar por bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: comprar jaleas, hielo, limones, leche, vasos y cucharas desechables, etc., con ello tendrá más mercadería para salir a vender a otras zonas

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en: Mrs. Magdalene Osabokhan is 51-year-old woman, who lives a semi-rural area of Edo State, Nigeria. She cherishes her business so much that she learnt it for 6 months before started her own. She hopes to expand her business with the stated amount.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Despite his age, Victor H. still works the fields of the farm he has lived on for over 40 years. He has always been dedicated to agriculture and he still maintains his farm with the help of his two sons. He is very happy that he will receive a loan that will help him be more productive.

Communal Banking in Baba

This borrower is part of the newest and largest Communal Bank in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Centro Agricola de Baba Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in the county of Baba in rural Ecuador. Their association works cooperatively to cultivate rice and commercialize the product after it has grown. As an association, Centro Agricola helps the farmers by providing access to machinery and training services. The farmers from Centro Agricola have received special instruction on financial responsibility and accounting from Codemicro, an organization that specializes in training programs geared towards the rural sector.

The members of Centro Agricola de Baba will use the micro-loans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others' guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Centro Agricola de Baba Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many micro-finance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about Santa Lucia compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Baba

The people of Baba have been organized since the days of Gran Colombia when Ecuador was yet to be a country. The area has always been popular because of the extremely productive lands that gave way to cultivation of cacao for decades. Now Baba is a county in the province of Los Rios in the coastal region of Ecuador. For most of the latter part of the 20th Century it was a cacao and banana-producing sector. Most of the surrounding areas of Baba in Los Rios are owned by large multinational companies such as Dole, but Baba is a sector characterized by small and informal farms.

Rice production has now turned into the main economic activity of the sector as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Cacao is still very popular in the area, but because of the long cultivation cycle people prefer to invest in rice. The lands in Baba are very fertile though, and most farmers in the sector often grow other crops, such as plantains and soybeans as secondary sources of income. Many farmers also keep livestock as emergency sources of food and income, commonly resorting to selling a chicken or pig if they are in need of cash.

Rice Farming in Baba

Most of the people in the Baba area are small farmers. They produce about 80 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds, plowing and leveling the lands. This is the most difficult part for the farmers in Baba, who often lack the necessary machinery to properly plow the lands for rice production. After appropriately preparing the lands, the farmers fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water-intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them gather their production.

Access to Credit

One of the biggest struggles in the area has been the lack of credit due to the absence of any type of financial institution. Because people do not count on formal financial finance, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also lack skills and knowledge to commercialize their products and pay fair prices for their crops.

Risks

The largest risk in the sector is due to absence of watering systems. Although Baba is in the province “Los Rios” (the rivers) there is severe problem with access to water. The lack of infrastructure in the sector does not allow the small farmers to benefit from the presence of the many rivers in the area. If the winter season is too dry, it is likely that the lands will not be sufficiently fertile for rice production in the summer. On the other hand, if there is too much rain, there are not any drainage systems to prevent flooding and the crops are often ruined. Generally speaking though, Baba is a very productive sector where the lands yield all types of crops including rice, cacao, corn, watermelons, plantains, and soybeans.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will mostly be used to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. Many clients will use the capital towards renting machinery and equipment necessary to effectively work and prepare the fields. Clients also typically use a part of the loan to buy livestock in order to raise and have as reserves. The loan repayment schedule is different from the typical micro-entrepreneur because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures. Mifex asks our rural clients only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Victor would like to make his farm more productive

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria cooks food at home and sells it to workers at various construction sites. Her daughter helps her with some of the cooking. She lives in the Irpavi II neighborhood in La Paz. This is her fourth loan from IMPRO. She repaid the previous three loans in full earning herself status as a first-class borrower. She will use the loan to buy rice, noodles, potatoes and traditional Bolivian freeze dried potatoes (chuño and tunta) as well as cooking pots. Her work experience and track record as a borrower give her access to this loan. She will have sufficient income to repay it.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Victoria elabora comida en su domicilio y vende a los albañiles en las construcciones, también prepara almuerzos y platos extras con la ayuda su hija. Ella vive en la zona de Irpavi II, y su puesto es ambulante ya que vende la comida en cada construcción. Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito; los tres créditos anteriores han sido pagados en su totalidad. Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento Bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de Insumos (Arroz, fideo, papa, chuño, tunta. Y ollas) Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios con Impro le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio. El cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and cooking pots.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en: Estela has more than 13 years of experience in the production and selling of clothing. She learned the trade from her mother and set up her own business after saving up money from a job as a housekeeper. She has a very modest workshop that is in need of more fabrics and other materials, but she works long hours in order to make ends meet. As a single mother, she relies heavily on this business and a part time job cleaning houses in order to feed and educate her 2 children. She is seeking her second loan with our program in order to continue buying more materials and improving her shop.

loans.use: Elaboracion de prendas de vestir

loans.name: Sumyia

texts.en:
I am the mother of two daughters, both of whom study. I had been living in Multan since I was born. My husband is a plumber and works at a shop for minimal wages while I earn a living by making knitted products.

I am requesting to borrow and invest 250 USD in my existing business. I plan to buy wool bale from Lahore in bulk, which will be cheaper. It was also help me complete more knitted products to increase my profits which will in turn, make a better life for my children.

loans.use: Buy wool bale

loans.name: Paugata

texts.en: Paugata is a young single lady of 18 years of age. Her mother has her own flea market stall, which she has been running for almost two years. She lived with her parents, 2 brothers and 2 sisters; then her father passed away a year ago. Her mother has a hard time in supporting her siblings and her. When Paugata left school she decided to do something so she could help her mother in supporting the family. She heard of SPBD (the lending agency) through her relatives. She is very thankful that she has able to get a loan and contribute financially to her family.

loans.use: To buy handicrafts to sell at her flea market stall

loans.name: Ocosinfuenzas 2 Group

texts.es:
Maria del Carmen is a 34-year-old mother of two. She and her husband own an automotive repair and auto part shop. Their daughter, Tania Aracely, will also invest in the family business, since it is their sole source of income. The other members of the group have the following occupations: Antonia de Jesus (greengrocer), Claudia Guadalupe (manufactures balconies), Susana (greengrocer), Maria Concepcion (sells regional food), and Maria Ofelia (sells regional food).

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

MARIA DEL CARMEN TIENE 34 AÑOS, DOS HIJOS, JUNTO CON SU ESPOSO TIENEN UN TALLER MECANICO Y LAS REFACCIONES QUE NECESITE EL AUTOMOVIL AHI LOS VENDEN. SU HIJA TANIA ARACELY TAMBIEN INVERTIRA EN EL TALLER MECANICO Y EN LA VENTA DE REFACCIONES YA QUE ES LA FUENTE DEL INGRESO FAMILIAR. LAS DEMAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO: ANTONIA DE JESUS (VENTA DE FRUTAS Y VERDURAS), CLAUDIA GUADALUPE (BALCONERIA), SUSANA (VENTA DE FRUTAS Y VERDURAS), MARIA CONCEPCION (VENTA DE COMIDA TIPICA) Y MARIA OFELIA (VENTA DE COMIDA TIPICA).

loans.use: Purchase of auto parts

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es:
Eugenio has a minibus and offers his customers a transportation service between the cities of El Alto and La Paz. His wife makes knitted handicrafts. These businesses provide the main source of income for their family and the care of their 4 young children. They live in the zone called Pedro Domingo Murillo - in the city of El Alto. They need the loan for necessary maintenance on the minibus, so Eugenio can continue to contribute to the economic well being of the family. This is his first loan with Kiva, and the evaluation shows he qualifies to receive and repay the credit.

Eugenio tiene su minibús que trabaja de transporte público Inter ciudad El Alto – La Paz; él trabaja de chofer y la esposa realiza tejidos de chompas para cholitas. Estas actividades son la fuente de sus principales ingresos con los que cubren la manutención de sus cuatro pequeños hijos; vive en la Zona Pedro Domingo Murillo – Rio Seco de la Ciudad de El Alto. El crédito requiere para el mantenimiento de su minibús para seguir contribuyendo económicamente con la familia. Es el primer crédito con kiva, la evaluación realizada le faculta para aprobar la solicitud que realizo Eugenio.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: THE LOAN WILL BE USED FOR MAINTENANCE ON HIS MINIBUS.   HIS TRANSPORTATION BUSINESS BETWEEN THE CITIES OF EL ALTO AND LA PAZ  IS THE MAIN SOURCE OF INCOME TO PROVIDE FOR HIS 4 YOUNG CHILDREN.

loans.name: Busiya East A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Harriet N.. She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to add stock. Harriet is 30 years old and is married. Her husband is a farmer. She has 6 children ranging from age 3 months to 5 years, and four of them go to school. Each week, Harriet makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children. Harriet has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to improve her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Harriet is joined in her small group by Racheal N., Scovia N., Zaituni B., and Emiranda N.. Racheal N. has a business in trading chicken feed and wants to increase working capital. Scovia N. is currently operating a business in used clothing sales and wants a loan to boost business. Zaituni B. operates a restaurant business and wants to purchase more raw food and utensils. Emiranda N. is currently in the business of wholesale coffee trading and is requesting a loan to add to her coffee business.

loans.use: To increase stock in the shop

loans.name: Lon

texts.en:
Mrs. Lon S., age 26, is a mother of a little child and works as a garment worker with a daily income of $4 a day. Her husband, Mr. Veoun Von, age 27, supports the family income as a motor-taxi driver, normally earning around $3 a day of profit.

The couple will use this loan to help finance their house repairs.

loans.use: To renovate their house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of clothing to resell in her community.

loans.name: Klufui

texts.en: Klufui F.  is a fishmonger in Ghana.  She is married and has three children.  Everyday, she buys fresh fish from the fishermen in her village and brings it home for processing.  After refining the fish, she resells the products to her customers.  Due to increased demand, Klufui wants to increase her sales, and is therefore requesting a loan of $525 to buy more fish, which she will process and resell.

loans.use: To buy more fish for processing and sale.

loans.name: Ojos Del Cielo Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Carmen es la presidente del Banco Comunal OJOS DEL CIELO, perteneciente al barrio de Vino Tinto de la ciudad de La Paz del Municipio La Paz, expresa sus expectativas del trabajo con la entidad, lo mismo se puede rescatar de los otros componentes del grupo, las mismas que se dedican a la venta de diferentes artículos de consumo cotidiano como la presidenta que se dedica a la elaboración y venta de humintas en las arterias de la ciudad. Este mismo espíritu de trabajo y superación tienen las demás socias. El conocimiento y la confianza mutua es importante para un buen desempeño del grupo, es la opinión de los componentes, por esta razón esta etapa de crédito dentro de la entidad viene a ser un nuevo reto para OJOS DEL CIELO.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva Volunteer.

Ms. Carmen is the president of Bank Communal Ojos del Cielo which is located in the Vino Tinto neighborhood in La Paz. She expresses her expectations of those within the group who are engaged in the sale of various articles of daily consumption; the president makes and sells humintas in the city. This same hard working spirit and the desire to get ahead in life is seen within the other members of the group. Ojos del Cielo see knowledge and mutual trust to be key for the good performance of the group thus for them this becomes a new challenge for them.

loans.use: Capital for Operational Costs

loans.name: Sara Esther

texts.es:
Sara belongs to the “Las Golondrinas 2” comunal bank. She lives in the Callería district of the department of Ucayali. She is 58 years old, she is a teacher by profession, and has been separated from her husband for more than 20 years. She has 5 children, all of whom are independent. With her first loan of S/. 300.00 from Manuela Ramos, Sara decided to invest in buying and selling of lingerie and perfume. The business is located in her home. She also sews clothing people have ordered from her: trousers, bras, polo shirts for women and men, which she takes to the Educational Institution, where the students are the majority of her clients.

With this loan of S/. 1,000.00, which she will pay back in 4 months, she will buy 12 bra sets, 20 meters of cotton fabric, 10 meters of lace, 10 meters of elastic, and 20 meters of fabric for towels. Sara is happy because she feels fulfilled and she also feels young enough to take care of her grandchildren so that her children can use the time to work and continue studying in the educational centers in their town.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Sara pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Golondrinas 2” actualmente vive en el AA. HH. Paican Mz F Lt 20 del Distrito de Callería en el Departamento de Ucayali tiene 58 años. Es docente (profesora) de profesión y está separada de su esposo desde hace mas de 20 años. Tiene 5 hijos, todos independientes. Sara con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.300 decidió invertir en la compra y venta de lencería y perfumería. En la actualidad cuenta con su negocio de lencería y perfumería en su propio domicilio. al mismo tiempo que confecciona los pedidos: trusas, brasier, toallas polos de damas y caballeros para llevarlo a la Institución Educativa y entregar a sus colegas que son la mayoría de sus clientes. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000 soles, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, iInvertirá en la compra 1 docena de conjuntos de brasiers, 20 metros de tela de algodón, 10 metros de blonda 10 metros de elástico, y 20 metros de tela para toallas. Sara se siente feliz por que además que se siente realizada aun se siente joven para atender a sus nietos y así sus hijos puedan aprovechar el tiempo para trabajar y seguir estudiando en los centros superiores de la localidad.

loans.use: To buy lingerie, fabric, and lace at wholesale price

loans.name: Aisha S.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 45-year-old Aisha K..  She is married and has four children aged between 25 and 7. She has one other dependent, who lives with her because she is an orphan. In 1998, Aisha established her knitting business. Aisha requires a loan in order to renovate her business. She thanks you for your support.  


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment Ð a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To renovate her business

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Mrs. Nguyen Thi L. is 34 years old. She joined TYM Fund in 2006. At that time she borrowed VND 2 million to raise pigs. Today this business brings about a stabL. income for her family. Her husband, a builder, also gives her a hand to raise pigs and look after their two children. Currently their average income is VND 2.5 million per month. For the next loan cycL., she applies for VND 6 million to buy more sows.
texts.en:
Note: the original description is in English.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy sows

loans.name: Reina

texts.es: Reina tiene 26 años, vive con Emilio, su pareja, quien también se dedica al comercio.  Ella trabaja en la compra y venta de fibra de lana de Oveja, en su pequeño puesto ambulatorio en un mercado de la ciudad de Juliaca.  Realiza esta labor desde hace 11 años, ya que ayudaba a su madre en el negocio familiar, ahora que tiene su pareja y está empezando su propia familia, necesitaba independizarse y poner su propio negocio, lo cual hace ahora al lado de su pareja Emilio.  Lo que le gusta de su trabajo, es que con la experiencia ganada durante tanto tiempo puede hacer la compra y venta con mucha más facilidad y no le ve dificultad al realizarla.   Reina quiere trabajar muy duro para tener una buena estabilidad económica para sus futuros hijos.  Con el dinero que se le facilite comprará mucho más fibra de lana y mejorará su negocio.  En el futuro quiere que su negocio crezca para obtener muchos más ingresos económicos y poder así mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Reina is 26 years old and lives with her partner Emilio who also works in sales. She works in the purchase and sale of lambswool, in her small moveable stand in a market in the city of Juliaca. She has carried out this work for the past 11 years as she helped her mother in the family business. Now that she has a spouse and is starting her own family she needed to become independent and start her own business, which she now does alongside Emilio. What she likes about her work is that with the experience earned during so much time she can buy and sell much more easily and she does not see difficulty to carry it out. Reina wants to work very hard to have good economic stability for her future children. With the money that will allow her to buy much more wool and improve her business. In the future she wants her business to grow to obtain more income and be able to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantity of lambswool that she sells.

loans.name: Somaly

texts.en:
Mrs. Somaly N., 24, and her husband, Mr. Veasna Chen, 24, live in a small village off National Road Two, about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh.  They have been married for five years and have one daughter.

Mrs. Somaly has been a garment factory worker in Phnom Penh for five years. Her husband has been a mason for five years as well.  Somaly is requesting a loan of US$300 to build staircase of their house.

loans.use: To build staircase of her house.

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Mrs. Oun C. is 49 years old and lives in the Sromouch Hei village in Takeo Province. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Suong Yuong, is a farmer who owns a piece of land he uses to cultivate rice. On his plantation, he usually pays a good deal of money to hire laborers with two oxen to plow the field. 

In order to reduce this expense, Mrs. Oun C. has decided to ask for a loan to buy two oxen to support the field. She has three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other is attending the local school. Her husband is presented in the picture on the right.

loans.use: To buy two oxen to support the field.

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Mrs. Leng K. lives in Dork Por village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Chhorn Touch, are farmers who own a piece of land to cultivate rice and vegetables to earn a living. On the farm, they face some problems with insufficient rice seeds and infertile soil. In order to solve these problems, Mrs. Leng K. decided to ask for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. In addition, she would use the rest of the loan to buy a pump to water the field to make her crop more productive. She is 43 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others attend the local school. Her husband is pictured with her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, fertilizer and a water pump

loans.name: Abdul Khalil

texts.en:
A. Khalil is the son of A. R. and lives in district 16 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has two children. The whole family, including his father and mother, benefit from the income he generates through his catering business. 

He would like to apply for an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for a term of 12 months to buy more supplies for his shop. By expanding his business, he hopes to support his family in the best way possible.

loans.use: To buy supplies for his catering business

loans.name: Chel

texts.en: Chel S., 30, is married and lives with her two young children in Takeo province. She grows rice and also works as tailor, earning around US$1 each day, while her husband works as a moto-taxi driver making US$2 each day. Mrs. Chel S. would like to take out a loan of $500 to purchase a cow to plow her farmland and buy more cloth for her tailoring business.

loans.use: To purchase cow and cloth.

loans.name: Soima

texts.ru: Соиме исполнилось 39 лет, замужем и воспитывает 4 детей. Муж находится на заработках в России как и многие в ее кишлаке. Он присылает денег на содержание семьи, но дети растут и чтобы покрыть все расходы семьи Соима занимается мелким предпринимательством – продает детскую одежду и обувь. На данный момент постоянной работы в регионе для женщин нету, те работы, которые есть низкооплачиваемые. За товаром Соима ездит за 170 километров от дома на оптовый рынок. Постоянного места для торговли нету и Соима ездит на окрестные рынки. Торговля неважная но получаемая прибыль покрывает все расходы по бизнесу и также остается на расходы семьи. Соима планирует немного расширить свой бизнес и пришла в Микроинвест для получения займа. На полученный займ собирается закупить новый ассортимент товаров.
texts.en:
Soima is 39 years old, married, and is raising 4 children. Her husband is working in Russia, as are many from her town. He sends home money to support the family, but the children are growing and to cover all the expenses Soima has a small business - selling children's clothing and shoes. At this time there is no permanent employment for women in the region, and that which there is is very low paying. Soima travels 170 kilometers from her home to the wholesale market to buy her goods. Having no permanent place to sell at, she travels between the area's markets. Sales are not great, but the profit covers the business's expenses with some leftover for the family. Soima decided to expand her business a little and came to Microinvest for a loan. She plans to use the laon to buy a new assortment of goods.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of new inventory

loans.name: Ushindi Group

texts.en:
Doris owns a small shop in the Tengeru neighborhood of Arusha. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 90. Each day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items to increase her current stock. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Doris is 31 years old, married, and has two children, ages 10 and 8. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Fides who has her own small business in Arusha

loans.use: To buy more items to increase her current stock

loans.name: Banzragch

texts.en:
Banzragch T. is a 69-year-old businessman. Banzaragach was an accountant with a local government agency for many years and retired in 2003. As soon as he retired, he started a small retail business selling women's and men's shoes. He rented a small stall in Bombogor Center, a local retail market. His daughter travels to Ereen, a Chinese border town, and imports the shoes. He lives with his wife in the Chingeltay district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

Banzragch says that his retirement compensation is not enough to support his family and that is why he started his business. He believes that access to education is the most precious gift that parents can give to their children and he helps share his youngest son's education expenses abroad. If the business does well, he would like to expand by renting one more nearby stall. He requests a loan to purchase more shoes from Ereen, China.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes from Ereen, China

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en: Mrs. Chantha S. is a villager in Chey Chrab village in Takeo province. She is a dessert seller. Her husband, Mr. Sorn Sok, is a farmer who owns a piece of land and cultivates rice. Aside from this plantation, he is a construction worker. Mrs. Chantha S. is requesting a loan to buy a cow for breeding and will use the rest of money to purchase a battery for her family. She is 44 years old and the mother of four children who are enrolled in the local school. She and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding and to purchase a battery for her family.

loans.name: Jeremias

texts.en:
Jeremias Q. is from the village of La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 37 years old. Jeremias is married and has an infant. To make a living, Jeremias owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for his business comes primarily from selling used shoes in the local community. Jeremias has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Jeremias joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jeremias has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jeremias is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional used shoes to sell in the local community. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Jeremias from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business and to sustain his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

location.town: La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora C. is from Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 57 years old, married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Flora makes and sells food. Her main source of income comes from selling specialty food products in the local community. Flora has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Flora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services, to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from HSPFI to repair her house. Flora is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be her fourth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to support the needs of the family and for additional house repairs.

--------------- About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase inventory and working capital.

loans.name: Adolat

texts.ru: Адолат – 51 лет. Замужем и мать 4-х детей. Она занимается продажей дорогих национальных тканей.  Она торгует на рынке Бунафша находящийся в районе «Панчшанбе» города Худжанда. В пятницу она выходит на рынок «Джума-базар», а в воскресенье на рынок «Якшанбе-базар». Адолат закупает товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан, и часть товара в городе Бишкек Республики Кыргызстан. Она ездит за товаром  2 раза в город Истаравшан и 1 раз в месяц в город Бишкек. Адолат за свой кредит хочет закупить партию летней дорогой ткани шифон для национальных платьев.
texts.en:
Adolat is a 51-year old mother of four. She is married. Adolat makes a living by selling expensive fabric that is used for making national costumes. She sells at the Bunavsha market, which is located in the Panchshanbe neighborhood of Hojand. She sells at Juma-bazaar on Fridays, and at Yakshanbe bazaar on Sundays. Twice a month Adolat travels to the wholesale market of Istaravshan and once a month to Bishkek. She would like to use the loan for the purchase of chiffon for national dresses for the summer season.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: expensive fabric for traditional dresses

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Sen M., 39, has an occupation weaving cotton cradles to earn a living. She started her investment nine years ago and is currently earning $3 per day. In her business actions, she has three school-aged children who also assist her in making cradles when they are free from studying. Her husband helps be responsible for the family by selling ice cream. The family faces the fact that their house is often cracking during the heavy rains. Thus, Sen M. would like a loan of $300 to purchase a housing tool to paint her old house.

loans.use: To purchase tools to paint her old house

loans.name: Benkadi 3 De (Benkadi Fofodiana) Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKADI 3 sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles polygames dans le village de FOFODIANA commune de Tingolé, sous préfecture de FANA, 2ème région administrative de la république du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but d’avoir un soutien financier pour la réalisation de leurs activités hivernales. Leurs activités sont axées sur la culture du sorgho de l’arachide et du haricot. Elles sont à leur cinquième expérience avec l’institution. Tous les prêts passés ont été correctement remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles  achèteront  de l’engrais, de l’herbicide, des petits matériels agricoles et payeront les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 22 hectares.
Une partie de leur production est auto consommée et l’autre partie est vendue sur les marchés de Tingolé, de Marka-Coungo et de Fana à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50 000FCFA après la campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group BENKADI 3 are married women who average 32 years of age and 3 children.  They live for the most part in polygamous families in the village of FOFODIANA, in the community of Tingolé, sub-prefecture of FANA (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of obtaining financial support to carry out their winter-time work, which revolves around growing sorghum, peanuts, and beans.  They are on their fifth experience with the institution.  All the past loans were correctly repaid. With this new loan, they will buy fertilizer, herbicide, and minor farm supplies and equipment and will cover the cost of weeding and labor for maintaining 22 hectares. A portion of their production is for their own consumption.  The other portion is sold to customers composed of men and women at the marketplaces of Tingolé, Marka-Coungo, and Fana. The group members plan on realizing an average profit of 50,000 francs CFA after the planting season.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding, and minor supplies

loans.name: Chroeb

texts.en: Mrs. Chroeb K. is a farmer in Kgnauk Pong village in Takeo province. She owns a plot of land for cultivating rice. Her husband, Mr. Nak Nit, is a construction worker. He also uses a truck to transport sand to sell. Although this couple has different careers, they still want to increase their household income. Mrs. Chroeb K. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy pig food and three piglets for breeding. She is twenty-three years old and the mother of a child who is just four years old. Her husband is also shown in the photo.

loans.use: To buy pig food and three piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Alima

texts.fr: Cette dame a un grand étalage de vente des produits d’alimentation générale dans le Marché de Hédzranamoé à Lomé. Elle est mariée et est mère de 05 enfants. Elle est mariée à un mécanicien. En 2000, l’atelier de réparation du mari a connu des difficultés financière, ce qui a poussé cette dame à se lancer dans la vente des produits d’alimentation générale. Avec cette activité, elle finance les études universitaires de 02 enfants et 02 filles domestiques qui l’aident au marché de Hédzranamoé. Elle a besoin de renouveler  quelques articles en ce moment ; c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 01 carton de mayonnaise, 12 cartons de tomates, 05 cartons de sardines, 05 paniers de piments, 02 sacs d’haricot ; le reste du montant servira à couvrir les frais de transport.

loans.use: achat de produits d'alimentation générale

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is 59 years old. She is a simple woman who resides in the village of Punit Benito Soliven, Isabela. She is married to Cerilo, a tricycle driver. They have seven children, six of whom are already married and are now living separately from their parents. Dominga has always wanted to have a good standard of living in which they would not suffer from hunger. 

Dominga is requesting a loan of PHP5,000 for the maintenance of their passenger tricycle. The loan will be used to purchase spare parts for their motorcycle that needs to be maintained and repaired. It is the only source of income they have had for five years, and with its aid they are able to provide their basic daily needs. Dominga hopes that her loan will be granted for the continuous operation of their business in order to survive the difficulties of life.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to maintain and repair the motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more shop items in bulk

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn S. is from the village of Upper Bayao, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 45 years old. Merlyn is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Merlyn owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling shrimp in the local community. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Merlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. This will be the first loan taken out by Merlyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for her business

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
Arceli is 45 and is married to Bonifacio, who manages their farm in the village of Ballacong, Ilagan, Isabela where they live. They have two children - the older is a Criminology graduate and  the younger is a graduate in automotive training. Arceli still dreams that their two children will have a successful life someday. 

Arceli raises hogs.  Recently, she sold six hogs but still has others. Arceli wants a loan of PHP8,000 to buy feed for her pigs. According to her, she wants to expand her business for the welfare of her family.

loans.use: To purchase feed for her hogs

loans.name: Dorl

texts.en: Mr. Dorl K. is a villager in Thmei village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this activity, he is a pig breeder. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it, so he decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets and feed. He hopes to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions with this loan. His wife, Mrs. Cheom Mom, helps him in the business. Mr. Dorl K. is a father of seven children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory, while the others attend the local school. His wife is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and feed

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir has worked as a taxi driver since 2007 to raise his three children. He works hard to earn income to help satisfy the needs of the family. Today, Samir is asking to borrow $1,200 to perform maintenance on his car.

loans.use: To perform maintenance on his car

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
Nuestra socia YOVANA tiene 24 años, es soltera y aun no tiene hijos. La socia trabaja en la municipalidad de “Hauro” que se encuentra a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Urcos. La socia es supervisora de obras en las comunidades aledañas al pueblo Hauro. Ya son varios años que trabaja y le ha ido muy bien, gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su labor encomendada. Nuestra socia es una joven trabajadora y emprendedora que requiere el préstamo para abrir una tienda de venta de ropa en su domicilio va comprar pantalones, chompas y ropa interior de color amarillo para estas fiestas de navidad y año nuevo.    

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

La socia es natural de la ciudad de Urcos de la provincia de Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “Qori Orcco” de la Asociación Arariwa. El nombre del banco es de origen de la lengua Quechua que traducido al español significa “Cerro de Oro”. La ciudad de Urcos se encuentra ubicada a 45 km del Cusco siguiendo la carretera asfaltada a Puno, es un pequeño poblado con una hermosa laguna donde, según la leyenda, Huascar lanzó una enorme cadena de oro para evitar que los españoles se la llevaran.
texts.en:
Yovana is 24 years old, single and does not have any children yet. She works in the municipality of Hauro, 15 minutes outside the city of Urcos. She supervises work in communities surrounding Hauro. She has worked for several years and has been very successful thanks to all the effort she puts into her work. She is a hard-working and enterprising young woman who needs a loan to open a clothing store in her home. She will buy yellow pants, sweaters and underwear for the Christmas and New Year’s celebrations. She is grateful for this opportunity to get a loan through Kiva and is committed to making her payments on time. She was born in Urcos, in the Province of Quispicanchis, in the Region of Cusco. She belongs to the “Qori Orcco” Communal Bank of Asociación Arariwa. The name of the bank comes from the Quechua language and translates in Spanish as “Hill of Gold”. Urcos is located 45 km from Cusco on the road to Puno. It is a small town with a beautiful lake where, according to legend, Huascar threw an enormous golden chain to prevent the Spanish from getting it.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To open a clothing store

loans.name: Zully

texts.es: Zully, es una mujer muy puntual, vive en el distrito de Callería, región Ucayali, no tiene hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, esta actividad la realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo. Zully forma parte del Banco Comunal “Damas del Oriente”, desde hace un año, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la venta de prendas de vestir, ahora ella necesita otro crédito de 300 soles, que será invertido en la compra de prendas de vestir al por mayor. La meta de zully es tener una tienda de prendas de vestir bien implementado y así generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Zully is a very punctual woman who lives in the Callería district, Ucayali region. She doesn't have any children. She sells clothing in her house. Her husband supports her work endeavors. Zully has been a member of the "Damas de Oriente" communal bank for a year. Her first, 300 sol, loan was used to buy clothing. She now needs another, 300 sol, loan to buy clothing at wholesale. Zully's goal is to have a well-stocked clothing store to produce higher income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Amina Farzad Group

texts.en:
The Amina Farzad group is made up of five female members. Lida, a hard-working 30-year-old woman, is the group leader.  She is a tailor and her business supports her husband and children. She will use a loan to buy sewing materials to improve her business. 
The second member of this group is Benafsha.  She has an embroidery business that she would like to expand.  
The third member is Saheda, who is seeking a loan to buy additional items for her husband's painting business and the last member is Shaziam who needs a loan for her bead-working business. 

All the group members would like to thank the Kiva lenders from their support.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials for a tailoring business.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is married and has two unemployed children. He has worked as a farmer for the past 15 years. He only cultivates tomatoes and zucchini, and he is known in his town's agricultural market by these two products. Today, Mohamad is requesting to borrow $1,200 USD to buy seeds and fertilizers for the next harvesting.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy palm nuts to make red palm oil

loans.name: Merlinda's Group

texts.en: Merlinda C. is from the village of Upper Bayao, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 44 years old. Merlinda is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by GDMPC, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Merlinda is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Merlinda operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as bread, sugar, salt, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Merlinda has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Merlinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlinda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Merlinda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo R., 57, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for fishing and palm products. She sells corn and Cambodian traditional cakes for an income of about USD 10.00 per day. Her husband is a private security guard, earning an income of USD 1.50 per day.

R. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to repair the house. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to pay for the children’s schooling.  This is her fourth loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To repair the house.

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en:
Tungalag is 39 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Hovd province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. One of her children is a university student and the other is a secondary school student.

Tungalag operates a beauty products trading business. Since 2009, she has been working as a salesperson at a shop called S-3, and earns 200,000 tugrugs (approximately 145 USD) per month. This is in addition to the income she earns from her beauty products trading business, which she runs from the same shop.

Tungalag currently stocks 2,500,000 tugrugs (approximately 1795 USD) worth of products. Her product selection is very good and she has a great business mind.

Tungalag is requesting a 500,000 tugrugs loan to purchase additional beauty products and pajamas to sell to her many customers.

loans.use: To additional beauty products and pajamas

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie was given the opportunity to manage a rice farming business, and she maintains a rice field in Agusan Del Sur.  She is now 42 years old with 6 children to support, the eldest 6 years old.  She strives hard so that she can send her children to school and have them finish their studies.

She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. and asked for financial support for her business. She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seeds for the farm.

loans.use: farm supplies

loans.name: Yawa Domési

texts.fr:
Cette dame de 53 ans est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Pour contribuer aux besoins du ménage, elle achète et revend des boubous et foulards pour femmes.
Depuis l’an 2000 qu’elle exerce cette activité, elle achète ses boubous à Lomé et les revend sur un étal au marché local d’Adidogomé.
Aves le prêt demandé, elle compte acheter 60 boubous et 20 foulards pour satisfaire la demande sans cesse croissante.
texts.en:
This woman is 53 years old, married and the mother of one child. To contribute to the needs of her household, she buys and sells boubous (traditional dresses) and scarves for women. She has been involved in this work since 2000. She buys her boubous in Lomé and resells them at a stand at the local market in Adidogomé. With the loan she is requesting she plans to buy 60 boubous and 20 scarves to satisfy an ever growing demand.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy dresses and scarves

loans.name: Brigida Rosa

texts.es:
Brigida de 64 años de edad es casada con el Sr. Luciano Garcia con quien tiene 3 hijos de 23, 19 y 18 años de edad los cuales les ayudan a trabajar en su pequeña finca ubicada en la Cmca. El Zapote jurisdiccion de el municipio de La Libertad. Tiene una gran experiencia en la actividad agropecuaria, pues desde hace mas de 30 años que trabaja en ella, cuenta con inventario ganadero propio.  

Esta solicitando su 1er credito con el objetivo de comprar insumos (semillas de pasto, urea e insectisida) con los cuales prepara la tierra para posteriormente sembar pasto, los que comercializara y le generara ingresos para el sosten familiar.  

El mayor sueño de doña Brigida es poder aumentar los recursos de su finca para brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Brigida is 64 years old and is married to Luciano Garcia with whom she has three children aged 23, 19, and 18 years. All her children help with the work on the small farm located in the Cmca. El Zapote jurisdiction of the municipality La Libertad. She has a lot of experience with the agricultural and livestock sector and after working in this sector for more than 30 years, she has her own livestock herd. She is applying for her first loan to pay for farming supplies (grass seeds, urea, and insecticide) that she will use to ready the soil for planting grass, which she will sell and use to generate income for her family. Brigida’s dream is to be able to increase the productivity of her farm so that she can better the living conditions of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Halea Meese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of farm supplies

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda D. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 39 years old and married with 5 school-aged children. Rosalinda says that one of her goals is to have all her children finish college and have a bright future.

Rosalinda is a rice farmer. She currently owns two hectares of rice field which she and her husband till together. The farm is the main source of income for her family.

In 2007 Rosalinda joined CEVI to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and now she is requesting her eighth loan from CEVI, for 20000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 40 años, es viuda y  sola logro sacar  adelante a sus 4 hijos, pero ahora sólo vive con dos de ellos en su casa que es propia, pues los mayores ya  trabajan y son  independientes.Ya lleva 2 años trabajando en el cultivo de papa, alverja, y habas. Paralelamente  a esta actividad se dedica en las mañanas y tardes a su negocio de venta de comida (agua de manzana, maca, soya, además de pan con relleno de queso, pollo y carne de chancho), en la plaza de su ciudad, donde instala su kiosco. Y como si fuera poco, también vende diversas golosinas en el cafetín de la escuela de su zona, dice que lo mejor  es atender amablemente a los clientes, pues por el buen trato siempre regresan, además su mejor ayudante es su último  hijo, quien se encarga de entregar los pedidos y lavar los utensilios. Las actividades que desempeña son bastante rentables porque le permiten vivir cómodamente, por eso para más adelante tiene planeado instalar un negocio de venta de verduras, que estará ubicado en un puesto del mercado mayorista de la ciudad.Esla segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP,  y le gusta mucho trabajar con su grupo comunal, porque  esta integrado por personas emprendedoras y responsables.Carmen tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  varios sacos de abono, que esparcirá sobre sus cultivos de alverja, para mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos y generarse mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Carmen, 40, is a widow and has managed to support her 4 children on her own. Now she lives with only two of them in her own house. The oldest children now work and are independent. For 2 years Carmen has been working to cultivate potatoes, peas and beans. While she works in agriculture in the mornings, in the afternoons she also has a business selling food (agua de manzana (an apple drink), maca (an Andean root vegetable), soy, and also bread filled with cheese, chicken and pork) in a plaza in her city where she has a kiosk. And if that weren't enough, she also sells a variety of snacks in a cafe in a school in her area. She says that it is best to attend to her customers graciously, because as a result of the good treatment they always return. In addition, her best assistant is her youngest son, who is in charge of delivering orders and cleaning the utensils. The activities that she performs are sufficiently profitable, because they allow her to live comfortably. For this reason in the future she has plans to set up a business selling vegetables that will be located in a stall in the wholesale market in her city. This is the second time that she has taken a loan with MFP, and she enjoys working with her communal group very much because it is made up of people who are hardworking and responsible. Carmen plans to invest the money requested in the purchase of a number of bags of organic fertilizer, that she will scatter over her cultivations of peas to improve the quality of her crops and generate better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to improve the quality of her crops

loans.name: Marta Lorena

texts.es:
Marta Lorena mujer emprendedora, madre de tres hijos, comerciante desde hace unos años, toma la iniciativa de poner una pequeña pulpería logrando así, ganar dinero para aportar con los gastos del hogar.

Cuando inicio lo hizo con dinero de una venta de vehiculo, y se ha fortalecido con financiamiento que Afodenic ha dado.
Lo que ha invertido en  mercadería de productos. Ya que comenzó con poco capital.
Lo que comprara con este préstamo será granos básicos en la compra de dos quintales de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, maíz, bidón de aceite, cajas de jabón, golosinas, lácteos, pollo. Logrando a si aumentar el inventario lo que tendrá ventas altas, y mejores ganancias para cubrir los gastos básicos como personales.
texts.en:
Marta Lorena is a very enterprising woman and the mother of three children. Having been a businesswoman for several years, she took the initiative to start a small general store so that she could earn enough money to pay for household expenses. She started with the money she got from the sale of a vehicle and solidified herself with the financing that Afodenic has given her, which she invested in products and merchandise. She will use the money from this loan to buy basic grains and two quintals of rice, beans, sugar, corn, a drum of cooking oil, boxes of soap, snacks, milk products, and poultry. This will allow her to increase her store’s inventory, which will give her increased sales and income that she can use to cover her basic and personal expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invertira en la compra de productos basicos, de arroz, frijoles, azucar,aceite, golosinas, lacteos entre otros productos para incrementar las ventas.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina L. is from the village of Eastern, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 49 years old. Carolina is widowed and has 11 adult- children. To make a living, Carolina owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Carolina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Carolina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carolina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 21000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Carolina is requesting a new loan of 21000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & for working capital. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Carolina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & for working capital

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine N. is from the town of Banga. She is 39 years old. Josephine is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 12 years.

Josephine joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Josephine from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business and support her family financially.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Azucenas Group

texts.es: Doña Elda H. de treinta y dos años de edad, curso el cuarto grado primaria, tiene tres hijos, el mayor de diez años y la mas pequeña de 5, el esposo de ella se dedica a la artesanía y ella colabora con algunos gastos familiares, se dedica al comercio (Venta de consumo Diario y Medicina) cuenta con 9 años de experiencia en éste negocio. Contando con entusiasmo, deseos de superación y con la ayuda de unas vecinas  organizan un grupo, para poder solicitar un préstamo. El Banco Comunal se denomina AZUCENAS, el nombré fue elegido por todas las integrantes, ya que en el lugar estas flores son muy conocidas. El grupo cuenta con 11 integrantes mujeres, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar; la crianza de animales, confección de Chumpas y delantales, venta de alimentos y ropas típicas. El préstamo ella lo utilizará para compra de consumo diario, y de esa forma ampliar su negocio para generar más ingresos. Espera que su negocio sea más grande y pueda genere mas ingresos para su desarrollo personal y familiar.
texts.en:
Doña Elda H. is 32 years old. She completed the fourth grade of primary school. She has three children, the oldest is 10 and the youngest is 5. Her husband works in crafts, and she helps with some of the family expenses. She works in commerce (selling basic products and medicines) and has 9 years of experience in this business. With enthusiasm and the desire to get ahead, she and a few neighbor women organized a group so that they could apply for a loan. Their community bank is called "Azucenas" (white lilies); the name was chosen by all the members, since these flowers are very well known in this area. The group has 11 women as members. They work at various activities, among them we can mention raising animals, making jackets and aprons, selling food and traditional clothing. Doña Elda H. will use the loan to buy basic products and in this way expand her business to generate more income. She hopes that her business can be larger and that she can generate more income for her personal and family development.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital to buy products to sell

loans.name: Donatha

texts.en: Donatha is a hardworking mother with ten children that range in age from 3 to 32 years old.The eldest five children are married; hence, not in school, but the other children are in school. Her husband is a farmer. Donatha sells green bananas and banana juice. She has had this business for over 20 years. She is requesting a loan to buy more bananas in order to make more profits. She hopes to work hard and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy green bananas for sale

loans.name: Evert Antonio

texts.es:
Evert Antonio tiene 34 años, es casado y vive junto a su familia 
Se dedica desde hace más de 13 años a la venta de granos básicos lo inicio con granos básicos sus productos  los ofrece a sus diferentes clientes que son amigos, familiares y vecinos. Esta actividad le permite sustentar sus gastos personales y apoyar a su familia. Para lograr que  sus clientes estén con él desea realizar este crédito para la compra de materia prima como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, maíz entre otros. Desea seguir creciendo para mejorar gradualmente su calidad de vida. A él lo consideran una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Evert Anonio, 34, is married and lives with his family.

For over 13 years he has sold basic grains.  He started out with basic grains.  His customers are friends, family members and neighbors.  This activity makes it possible for him to meet personal expenses and support his family.

In order to insure customer satisfaction he wants this loan to buy raw materials like: rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil and corn, among others.  He wants to continue growing to gradually improve his quality of life.  He is considered to be a levelheaded, responsible person.

loans.use: To buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Alima

texts.fr:
Madame ALIMA T. est âgé e de 49 ans, mariée et mère  de 2 enfants.  Elle  vit chez son mari  dans une grande famille traditionnelle au  quartier Pelengana Sud de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
