N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école moderne pour des raisons sociales analphabétisme des parents, elle commença très tôt le commerce, auprès de sa mère qui vendait des condiments alimentaires. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage, elle finit par évoluer seule pour mener  d’abord le commerce de tasses et maintenant celui des habits et chaussures. Elle mène cette activité depuis 20 ans et jouit d’une grande clientèle et notoriété. 
Dans le dessein d’augmenter son fonds de commerce, afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices et de faire face à la demande clientèle qui est de plus en plus grande, elle  a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est  à son 1er  prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, 50 complets d’habits. Elle   s’approvisionne au Burkina Faso et effectue sa vente au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt, elle  envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permet d’aider son mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses familiales et de participer à des événements sociaux.  Son ambition est de pérenniser son activité et de construire une maison
texts.en:
49-year-old Alima T. is married and a mother of two. She lives with her husband in a large traditional family in the Pelengana Sud district of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of Mali).
Not having gone to school for social reasons and her parents’ illiteracy, she got into business early alongside her mother who used to sell condiments. After several years of apprenticeship, she started off on her own selling cups. She now sells clothing and shoes. She has run this business for 20 years and has many customers and a good reputation.
Looking to boost her capital, in order to increase her profits and meet her ever-growing customer demand, she turned to Soro Yiriwaso. She is on her first individual loan, which she will use to buy 50 sets of clothing. She gets her stock in Burkina Faso and sells for cash and on credit to both women and men.
With this loan, she hopes to make a monthly profit of 40,000 XOF. This profit will allow her to help her husband provide for their family and to participate in social events. Her ambition is to make her business sustainable and to build a house.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
La Sra. Blanca esta casada con el Sr. Jose  Oviedo ellos tienen 2 hijos menores .
Blanca empezó trabajando como ayudante de cocina en un restaurante de donde aprendió el oficio, ella ahora se dedica exclusivamente a la repostería con la ayuda de su cónyuge ,tienen  una buena clientela formada en el barrios donde vive y sus alrededores ,gracias al  esfuerzo y dedicación logran mantener a su familia con este trabajo .
El crédito será de gran ayuda para la compra de  mercaderías  en cantidad y así abaratar el costo. 
Blanca    anhela poder construir un salón y ofrecer mejor servicios a sus cliente.
texts.en:
Blanca is married to Mr. José Oviedo; they have two minor children.

Blanca started working as a kitchen helper in a restaurant where she learned the occupation.  Now she is exclusively into pastry making with help from her spouse.  They have a good customer base in their neighborhood and surrounding areas. Thanks to their effort and dedication they manage to support their family with this work.

The loan will be of great help to buy merchandise in quantity thus reducing their costs.

Blanca dreams with building a banquet hall to offer better customer service.

loans.use: For pastry sales.

loans.name: Gulmaya

texts.ru:
Gulmaya T. 41 qod. Ona zamujem i imeyet 3 detey, doch kotoroy 18 let uchitsya v shkole, doch kotoroy 15 let toje uchitsya v shkole i zanimayetsya tancami i sin kotoromu 10 let zanimayetsysa sportom i uchitsya v shkole. Gulmaya i yeyo semya jivut v Absheron regione.

Gulmaya uje 12 let rabotayet v etom biznesse prodaji tovarov dlya nevest. V yeyo magazine ona prodayot Zerkala, svechi, Saxar( ukrashenniy)i t.d eto vse prinyato neveste prinosit s soboy v dom jenixa po nashemu obichayu . Tak kak u nas seychas sezon svadeb Gulmaya  nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit  noviy tavar s novimi ukrasheniyami dlya razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa.
texts.en:
Gulmaya T. is 41 years old. She is married and has three children. Her daughter who is eighteen is going to school and another daughter who is fifteen is also in school and is taking dancing lessons. Her son is ten and he is in sports and goes to school. Gulmaya and her family live in the Absheron region.

Gulmaya has been in this business of selling bridal products for twelve years now. In her store she sells mirrors, candles, decorative sugar and etc, such things which a bride must bring with herself to the groom's home according to the tradition. As it is the marriage season now, Gulmaya needs 2000 AZN to buy new decorations and items for expansion of her business.

loans.use: To buy candles, mirrors, and decorative sugar for resale

loans.name: Flamingo Group

texts.en:
Mwajuma M. is in her late forties. She is married and has a 7-year-old daughter. Mwajuma has been running a food vending business since 2007. Between 6:00 am and 5:00 pm daily, Mwajuma provides ready-cooked meals to her customers. The business earns Mwajuma a low monthly profit. 

This will be Mwajuma's second loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. Mwajuma used her first loan to increase her capital, allowing her to stock up on goods faster when they ran out. This loan has since been successfully repaid. With her second loan, Mwajuma aims to increase her stock and to continue to build herself a new house. 

Mwajuma will share this loan with her loan group Flamingo, which totals 17 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans. 

In the picture, Mwajuma can be seen on the far right wearing red.

loans.use: To increase her stock and continue to build herself a new house.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en: Cheryl E.'s main source of income comes from buying and selling items like blankets, pillows and ready-to-wear clothes in her community. She is 24 years old, married and has two school-aged children. They are from the village of Pag-asa, Salawagan, Quezon, Bukidnon. Cheryl has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Cheryl joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Cheryl has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase inventory and for working capital. Cheryl is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like T-shirts and blouses. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like T-shirts and blouses

loans.name: Residenciales Del Campo Nº 3 Group

texts.es:
Santos Blacina tiene 51 años de edad, es casada, tiene cuatro hijos, y es integrante del Grupo Solidario Residenciales El Campo Nº 2. 

Santos se dedica a la venta de productos cosmeticos, ella decidio inscribirse al programa de venta por catalogo de Avon y como trabaja en una farmacia en sus tiempos libres hace visitas domiciliarias y va enseñando los productos en los catalogos y cuando no cuenta con mucho tiempo los deja y luego regresa. Una de sus dificultades es que da credito y algunas veces sus clientes le quedan mal con la fecha de pago. El prestamo lo necesita para comprar mas y variados productos. Los prestamos obtenidos le han ayudado a obtener su casa porque antes no tenia y ahora la esta mejorando. Unas de sus dificultades es que vende de forma ambulante y cuando le pagan ella tiene que movilizarse con dinero en efectivo y la han asaltado varias veces. Su meta es trabajar muy duro cada dia para tener un negocio en un local y terminar su vivienda. Ha sido clienta de FAMA por 21 ciclos y ha demostrado alta responsabilidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Santos Blacina is 51 years old, married, and has four children.  She is a member of the Residenciales El Campo No. 3 solidarity group.

Santos' business is selling cosmetics.  She decided to sign up to sell Avon products through a ctalog and, as she works in a pharmacy and makes home visits in her spare time, she also shows customers the products in her catalogs.  When she doesn't have much time she leaves them and then returns for them later.

One of the problems Santos has in her business is that she provides her goods on credit and sometimes her customers don't pay on time.  She needs this loan to buy more products and a better variety of products.  The loans she has had so far have helped her to obtain a house which she didn't have before and she is now making improvements to it.  Another difficulty that Santos has is that she makes her sales from door to door and when her customers pay her she has to move about with cash on her.  She has been assaulted on a couple of occasions.  Santos' goal is to work very hard every day so that she can have premises for her business and finish her home.  She has been a client of FAMA for 21 loan cycles and she has always shown herself to be very responsible in her payments.

loans.use: To buy a variety of cosmetics

loans.name: Vannessa Paola

texts.es:
Vannessa D. 33 años, cría y venD. pollos desD. las 06h00 am que se levanta hasta las 21h00 pm, una D. sus actividades económicas es venderlos para conseguir el dinero y volverlos a reinvertir en mas pollos. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio ya que lleva muchos años con este negocio. 

Quiere continuar con su negocio por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo pollos y balanceado para poderle dar una mejor vida a su hijo ya que es madre soltera. En el futuro quiere terminar sus estudios y seguir invirtiendo en su negocio para que pueda ser reconocida  por sus ventas.
texts.en:
Vannessa, 33 years of age, raises and sells chickens from 6:00 am when she rises until 9:00 pm. One of her economic activities is to sell chickens to acquire money and then to invest in more chickens. She has great hopes for her enterprise since she has many years in the business.

Vannessa wants to continue with her business. For this reason, she wishes to use the loan to buy chickens and chicken feed in order to proviD. a better life for her son, since she is a single mother. In the future, she wants to finish her studies and continue investing in her business so that she can be recognized for her sales.

loans.use: BUYING CHICKENS AND CHICKEN FEED FOR HER BUSINESS

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 36 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Nemesio de 38 años y sus 4 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. La bodega de Julia es la primera en abrirse en su Pueblo, desde las 6 de la mañana sus puertas ya están listas para recibir a sus madrugadores compradores, quienes sabiendo de la variedad de la mercadería que tiene en su bodega, no dudan en comprarle, ya que tienen la seguridad de que van a encontrar las cosas que necesitan. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en su pueblo, lleva 3 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, sin poder salir. Con el tiempo, anhela hacer crecer su negocio y brindarles a sus clientes un mejor servicio. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP y espera poder pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarles problemas a las compañeras de su banco comunal, en donde es muy respetada debido al orden que le pone al grupo. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Julia, 36, is an unassuming, hard working woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband, Nemesio, 38, and their four beloved children for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life.

Julia’s store is the first one to open in her town.  Her doors open at 6am and she’s ready to receive early rising buyers who, aware of the variety of merchandise she has in her store, don’t hesitate to buy from her because they are sure to find the things they need.

What she enjoys the most about her work is chatting with her customers learning what’s going on in town.  She has been in business for three years and considers the most difficult part of it having to stay inside her store all day without being able to go out. In time she hopes her business will grow so that she can provide better customer service.

This is her 4th loan with MFP and she hopes to be able to repay it on time because she does not want to cause problems for her fellow communal bank members where she is much respected because of the order she imposes on the group. She will use the requested 800 new soles to buy more products to better stock her store with groceries.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Naddy

texts.en:
Nothing could be wrong with small beginnings, as Naddy D., 31, would substantiate.  Naddy is a Community Partner of CCT* in Dasmarinas, Cavite, where she and her husband, Eleomar, raise their family. Eleomar is a tricycle driver. They have two children, one of whom is in elementary school while the younger one is not yet attending school. Naddy reached only high school, but it does not mean she cannot perform well as a micro-entrepreneur.

At present, Naddy runs her own ready-to-wear (RTW) business. She started small, with her house as her working space. She would buy clothes which she thought would fit the taste of her potential customers, and sell them to friends, neighbors, and business connections. She also does direct selling, offering her customers products from beauty brands, such as Avon and MSE.  With these entrepreneurial efforts and the daily tricycle operation of Eleomar, their family earns around Php12,000 per month.

To help her grow her business, Naddy decided to borrow Php16,000. She plans to use this money to buy additional quantities of the affordable, yet quality, products that her customers look for. She knows that having enough capital on hand will enable her to purchase the orders for her valued customers even without initial down payments.

Naddy is surely not exempted from the challenges of direct selling, such as delayed payments. But rather than focusing on her problems, Naddy instead focuses on making her business grow from a small beginning to big time growth. She hopes to have her own commercial space where more potential customers are within an arm’s reach. She also desires to have her own tricycle. For her family, she desires good health and a sustained education for her children.

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase additional quantities of quality clothes

loans.name: Umbonomuhle Group

texts.en:
Nikeziwe is 40 years old and single, with 4 children between the ages of 7 and 18 years old. She cares for 4 children. She runs a retail business in Nkandla in Kwa Zulu Natal, South Africa. In the photo she is standing on the far left in grey.

She has been in this business for a year.  She sells livestock chickens, clothes, shoes, skirts and shirts at her home and pension spots.  She says that the main challenges to her business are customers who are not paying on time and the death of chickens when it is hot.

She requested this loan through Women’s Development Businesses to buy more chickens and clothes to grow her stock. She says that this loan will take her to another level, because she will be able to support her children through higher education and give them a better life. In the future, she would like to see her business grow and sell electricity vouchers and airtime.  

She thanks WBD and Kiva for giving her this chance of improving her life.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and clothes to grow her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Aramayis

texts.en:
Aramayis D. lives with his wife and son in Stepanavan. By profession, Aramayis is a construction worker. He is also engaged in agriculture.  He has a small cattle farm and grows potatoes and fruit trees.

To organize the spring work and insure an income, Aramayis has applied for this loan to purchase potato seed, fuel and cattle food.

loans.use: to buy potato seed, fuel and cattle food

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: For the last three years, Margaret M. M. has earned a living by making dresses in the town of Matuu. She is married, earns a monthly income of KES. 10,000, and is applying for her first loan to buy more materials to make new dresses to sell to her customers. Her goal is to have a future that is financially stable by continuing to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy materials to make dresses to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Kelvin Isael

texts.es:
Kelvin, vive con sus padres, es agricultor, Residen en San Carlos departamento de Morazán, él se dedica a la siembra de maíz, sandia y venta de leche.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar cerdos y sembrar maíz, con este préstamo podrá adquirir tanto los cerdos como los insumos necesarios para el cultivo como abono y fertilizante.
Su objetivo es trabajar fuertemente para ayudar a sus padres, ya que son su compañía y dependen de él.
texts.en:
Kelvin lives with his parents in San Carlos, in Morazán department.  He is a farmer.  He grows corn and watermelons, and also sells milk.

Kelvin is currently requesting a loan to buy pigs and to sow corn.  With this loan he will be able to buy pigs and also the supplies he needs to grow his crops such as manure and fertilizer.

Kelvin's goal is to work hard to help his parents since they are his company and they depend on him.

loans.use: to buy pigs, manure and fertilizer

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lilibeth is 33 years old and has three children who are in school.

Lilibeth has a food vending (halo-halo) business in the Philippines. Lilibeth requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Lilibeth has been in this business for three years.  In the future, Lilibeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, plastic cups, ice for her food production (halo-halo) business

loans.name: Solopeta

texts.en:
Solopeta is 49 years of age and married with ten children. Solopeta owns & operates a business venture which is selling chickens to local communities.  She has three years of experience in this business. Solopeta needs a loan of WST $1350 to purchase timber and iron roofing to shelter the chickens from the sun and the rain.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Solopeta joined SPBD in 2006 to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Solopeta's 5th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase iron roofing and timber to shelter the chickens.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 41 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with three children.

Editha owns a refreshment stall in the market thats sells soft drinks, juice, yogurt, tea, and other refreshments. She has had this business for two years earning a monthly income of PHP 10,000. Editha wanted to add more stocks to sell. She went to GDMPC to request a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase stocks of refreshments.

Editha is a new member of GDMPC. She hopes that someday she will become a refreshment stockholder.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of refreshments

loans.name: Anacleta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMASUMAC II”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito D. Huanchac en la Provincia D. Cusco y Departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Anacleta, la socia tiene 54 años D. edad, la socia es casada y tiene 4 hijos D. los cuales la socia está a cargo aun del menor D. 9 años D. edad, viviendo con ella, la socia tiene un taxi que brinda servicios particulares a turistas, ella cobra el dinero D. este servicio y lo invierte en diferentes cosas por ejemplo en el mantenimiento del automóvil, en el combustible y otros gastos, ella desea comprar para la unidad el seguro D. pasajeros que es obligatorio, este seguro se denomina SOAT; la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra del seguro D. vida D. los diferentes pasajeros.   
         
La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir D. manera disciplinada con los pagos D. las cuotas.
texts.en:
Anacleta is a member of the "Imasumac II" community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province and department.

Anacleta is 54 years old, married, and has four children.  Her youngest, who is 9, is still in her care and lives with her.  Anacleta has a taxi with which she provides a private service to tourists.  She invests the money that she makes from this service in different things such as maintaining the vehicle, paying for gas and other expenses.  She would like to buy passenger insurance for her vehicle (this is compulsory).  The insurance is called SOAT - Seguro Obligatorio D. Accidentes D. Tránsito (Compulsory Traffic Accident Insurance).  She is requesting a loan to invest in buying this insurance for her passengers.

Anacleta is grateful for the support that she is being given and pledges to make her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in buying accident insurance for her passengers

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: Lourdes tiene 42 años, en las cuales siempre ha radicado en su lugar de origen Sicaya, en donde  vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en casa de un familiar. Tras arduos años de trabajo en el campo, decidió hace 20 años vender alfalfa, para ello arrienda terrenos cultivados de alfalfa y extrae el producto para venderlos a los comerciantes al por menor. Su trabajo diario consiste en extraer y repartir la alfalfa a los comerciantes y en esta labor sus hijos la ayudan. De manera paralela vende por las tardes, suplementos vitamínicos de una marca conocida en el mercado; mientras que en la mañana se dedica a la agrícultura. Ambas actividades le ha permitido  tener un ingreso más en beneficio para su familia, porque tiene mucha demanda por su comunidad, ya que vive en una zona rural que le permite conocer a sus clientes y darle un trato más personalizado en ambos negocios. En adelante quiere incrementar su capital de trabajo para arrendar más terrenos cultivados. Este será su décimo crédito con MFP, en todo este tiempo siempre ha demostrado puntualidad en sus pagos y  el cumplimiento en todos los acuerdos que se han dado en su banco comunal. Con el dinero que solicita,  lo invertirá para incrementar su capital de trabajo en ambos negocios, comprar semillas de alfalfa así como productos vitamínicos.
texts.en: Lourdes, 42, has always lived in Sicava, the place where she was born.  She lives there with her husband and their 2 children in the house of a relative.  After years of arduous work in the fields, she decided 20 years ago to sell alfalfa.  To do this she rents land to cultivate alfalfa, and harvests the product to sell to the retail vendors.  Her daily work consists of harvesting and distributing alfalfa to the traders, and her children help her with this work. In the mornings she works in agriculture, and in the afternoons she works on another business selling vitamin supplements of a brand that is well known in the market.  Both of these activities have allowed her to have a better income for her family, because there is a lot of demand for these products in her community.  Since she lives in a rural area, she knows her customers and is able to give them personalized service in both businesses.  In the future, she wants to  increase her working capital so that she can rent more croplands.  This will be her 10th loan with MFP, and in all of this time she has demonstrated punctuality in her payments and has complied with all of the agreements that have been decided upon in her communal bank.  With the money that she requests, she will increase her working capital for both businesses, buying alfalfa seeds and also vitamin products.

loans.use: to buy alfalfa seeds and vitamin products

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a married woman with three children; two attend school while one is still too young. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past year, Aisha has sold food from her home to her neighbors and passersby. Competition from other food vendors in the area is her major challenge.

Aisha decided to join Yehu to access its loans. With a 20,000 KES loan she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and utensils. She dreams of establishing a restaurant in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and utensils.

loans.name: Edmar

texts.en:
Edmar, age 30, is the owner of a shop that sells beverages, snacks, and canned goods. He has had this business for five years. He and his wife have one child.

Edmar has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 11,000 in order to buy canned goods, beverages, and snacks to offer for sale.

Edmar has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, and snacks to offer for sale

loans.name: Nuraddin

texts.en:
Nuraddin is a 55-year-old man, is married, and has one daughter. All of the family members are involved in a family agricultural business that is their only source of the income. 

Nuraddin earns a living by breeding cattle and now has four cows. He sells his products at the local open market. He requests a loan in amount of 1,000 Azerbaijan New Manats (AZN) to buy three more cows to increase his income. Support from this loan will help Nuraddin to economically provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy three more cows.

loans.name: Senen

texts.en:
Senen is 42 years old and runs an eatery in Panglao, Bohol. She sells food that she cooks herself. She also makes barbecue. Senen also sells soft drinks at her eatery. She said she is happy that she has regular customers now, compared to when she first started.

Senen has requested this loan to buy ingredients such as pork and chicken meat, vegetables, spices and soft drinks. Senen hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as pork and chicken meat, vegetables, spices and soft drinks

loans.name: Vianney

texts.en:
Vianney is the father of six children. He has been growing rice for the past 30 years. He has been taught rice farming by his parents. He will use his Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and later for harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to support labour costs during rice production

loans.name: María Monserrate

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal José Cesario Reyes se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

La señora  María es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que les brindan estos créditos para salir adelante. Tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 19, 16, 13 y 11 años de edad, todos sus hijos aun viven con ella y dos de ellos  estudian en  escuela y colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.

Nuestra amiga realiza el crédito para ayudar a su esposo el mismo que se dedica a la venta de pescado, nos cuenta nuestra amiga que su esposo se desplaza por toda la ciudad vendiendo sus productos en un triciclo de su propiedad, los mismos que en la madrugada compra en la ciudad de Manta a pescadores que llegan hasta las playas de esa ciudad, tiene cerca de 10años dedicado a esta actividad y es como ha podido sacar adelante a su familia.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado para la venta diaria.
 
Sus sueños son comprar un carro para vender sus productos a otras partes más alejadas.
texts.en:
The José Cesario Reyes Communal Bank meets every two weeks in Montecristi Canton, known for its rich precolonial culture and its nationally and internationally renowned handicrafts and its famous straw hats.

María is a founding member of the bank and she likes it because of the help the loans offer for getting ahead.  She is 39 years old and married, and from this relationship she has four children, ages 19, 16, 13, and 11.  All her children still live with her and two of them are studying.  Her husband is a businessman.

María is getting the loan to help her husband who himself sells fish.  She tells us that her husband goes all over the city on his own tricycle selling his products, which he buys in the morning in the city of Manta from fishermen who arrive from the beaches of that city.  He has been doing this work for about ten years, and this is how he has been able to get the family ahead.

This loan is to buy fish for daily sales.

Their dream is to buy a car to sell the fish in more distant areas.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Adandédjan

texts.fr: Adandédjan est âgé de 40 ans et vit au Bénin. Adandédjan est marié à une marchande du nom de Marie. Le couple a cinq enfants à charge dont quatre sont les leurs. Certains des enfants ne sont pas scolarisés. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Adandédjan  mène comme activité la transformation des noix de palme en l’huile de palme.A côté de cette activité Adandédjan a appris le métier de maçonnerie. Adandédjan exerce  cette activité passionnément depuis quatre ans. Grâce aux revenus que lui génère cette activité Adandédjan contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Adandédjan sollicite pour une troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Adandédjan s’approvisionne en noix de palme au Bénin. Les crédits reçus antérieurement par Adandédjan ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Adandédjan is 40 years old and lives in Benin. He is married to a merchant named Marie. The couple has five dependent children, four of whom are their own. Not all children attend school. The whole family lives together. The couple handle together the various household responsibilities. 

To support himself and his family, Adandédjan runs a business turning palm nuts into palm oil. As a sideline he also learned the trade of masonry, and has been practicing this profession with a great passion for four years. With the income that he earns, Adandédjan is able to provide for his family’s needs. 

In order to meet the needs of a growing customer base, Adandédjan is seeking a third loan from ALIDé. He buys his stock of palm nuts in Benin. All previous credits granted to Adandédjan were repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy palm nuts for processing into palm oil

loans.name: Cornelio Elias

texts.es:
Cornelio, desea continuar trabajando con financiamientos, por tal razón esta solicitando un préstamo para  la compra de insumos agrícolas, como lo son abono, herbicidas para aplicarlos al cultivo, esta compra le ayudara a mejorar su siembra y con la esperanza que los cultivos sean abundantes.
Cornelio es un agricultor quien a traves de los prestamos logra realizar los cultivos, por esta situacion cada vez que inicia esta labor, solicita su financiamiento, seindo una persona responsable para el pago al vencimiento.
texts.en:
Cornelio would like to continue working with loans. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy farming supplies such as fertilizer and herbicides to apply to his crops.  This purchase will help him to improve his sowing and hopefully his crops will grow abundantly.

Cornelio is a farmer who, through loans, manages to grow his crops.  Each time he starts his sowing, he requests a loan.  He is a responsible person who makes his repayments on the due date.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more fruits.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 48 years old, married, and has three children. She works hard to provide for her family. Yoland runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 11 years.  She also earns additional income from selling buko (coconut water) juice.

Yolanda is requesting a loan for  50,000 PHP loan through NWTF, which she will use to buy items such as soft drinks, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.  This is Yolanda's tenth loan from NWTF.  She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items such as soft drinks, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
Myra, age 21, married immediately after graduating from high school. She and her husband have a child who is old enough now that Myra can join her husband in providing an income for their small family. They are farmers. Their primary challenges are providing food for the family and paying essential utility costs.

She is requesting a loan of P10,000 to utilize as capital in buying rice seedlings, fertilizers, and insecticides used in farming. 

In the future, she wants to achieve abundant harvests to provide enough sustenance for her family and to set aside enough money to allow for the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy rice seedlings, fertilizers, and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Damaris Elena

texts.es:
Damaris tiene 40 años y vive con su familia en la maravillosa provincia de Limón la cual marca una gran diversidad cultural: con una población predominantemente negra y con importantes rasgos de la cultura indígena costarricense, la afro caribeña, blancos y chinos, cada grupo le aporta a la zona su estilo propio. Esta provincia tiene hermosas lugares con arenas blancas, playas y palmeras y exuberantes parques nacionales que protegen bosques húmedos tropicales y arrecifes de coral, así como centenares de especies de flora y de fauna en vías de extinción. El parque nacional Tortuguero, contiene la muestra más grande de bosque húmedo tropical protegido y aquí usted podrá recorrer sus canales y ríos, observar la flora y la fauna, apreciar el desove de las tortugas marinas y tener la oportunidad de observar a más de 300 especies de aves dentro de las que se encuentra la lapa verde, el pavón y los tucanes. En esta zona se llevan a cabo importantes investigaciones científicas y se ha convertido en un punto especial para el turismo científico y ecológico.

Hace unos meses atrás Damaris desea tener suficiente mercadería para asi poder salir adelante con su negocio, dedicarle más tiempo, para asi brindarles a los vecinos de la comunidad  prendas de calidad. Con el ingreso que obtenga de este negocio le dará también una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Es por esto que Damaris está solicitando un crédito por el monto de 596,000.00 (quinientos noventa y seis mil colones), para comprar mercadería, específicamente mas ropa, para asi continuar haciendo sus ventas ambulantes y llegar a alcanzar sus metas.

Damaris es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Batán, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Y están felices porque los resultados han sido muy buenos y la Empresa ha ayudado a muchas mujeres a trabajar en sus diferentes negocios.
texts.en:
Damaris, 40, lives with her family in the wonderful province of Limón which is noted for its cultural diversity.  Its population is predominantly Black with important traits from Costa Rican indigenous culture: Afro-Caribbean, White and Chinese.  Each of these groups contributes its own particular style.  

This province has beautiful places with white sand, beaches, palm trees and exuberant national parks that protect tropical rain forests and coral reefs as well as hundreds of species of flora and fauna in danger of extinction.  

The Tortuguero national park contains the largest protected rain forest and one can travel its canals and rivers, observe flora and fauna, witness sea turtles laying their eggs and have the opportunity of observing over 300 species of birds among which are the Green Macaw, the Great Curassow and Toucans.  Important scientific investigations take place here and it has become a special point for scientific and ecological tourism.

For a few months now Damaris has wanted to have sufficient merchandise available to get ahead with her business and dedicate more time to it thus providing local residents with high quality items of clothing.  With income earned in this business she will also provide her family with a better quality of life.

Because of this, Damaris is asking for a 596,000.00 (five-hundred ninety-six thousand colones) loan to buy merchandise, specifically more clothing to continue her street sales and to reach her goals.

Damaris is a member of the “Batán” communal bank one of EDESA’s 150 social organizations in Costa Rica.  They are happy because results have been very good and the firm has helped many women to work in their various businesses.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Oyuntungalag

texts.en:
Mrs. Oyuntungalag, 36 is a hairdresser. She has been working as a hairdresser for many years. She lives with her son in a rental apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 
Lately her apartment has become very uncomfortable and cold to live. Because all the window insulation have removed and there is too much heat-loss during the winter time.  Therefore she needs to make adjustment and insulation to the windows of her home immediately.  The loan she is taking will be dedicated to purchase the building materials to make the windows insulation.

loans.use: To purchase the building materials to make the windows insulation.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth's family lives within the village of Villa Marzo Cordon. She has been managing her own variety store for three years. She is married to a farmer and is blessed with three children.

In order to continue improving her store, Elizabeth is asking for a loan PHP 15,000 to be used to buy groceries such as cooking oil, ingredients, bread, soft drinks, and canned goods. Elizabeth believes that the greater the variety of products available in her store, the more sales and income she will bring in. Her requested loan would really be of great help to her, because she can use it to make her business grow. From this, she can sustain her family's needs.

Elizabeth believes firmly in the power of God. Through faith, prayer, and dedication to business everything is possible.

loans.use: to purchase groceries such as cooking oil, ingredients, bread, soft drinks, and canned goods for her variety store.

loans.name: Rosalin

texts.en:
Rosalin is a 41-year-old lady who is married to Robinson, a 41-year-old man. They are blessed with four children: Johan, 17, is studying in the third grade of Senior High School; Afliana, 14, is studying in the first grade of Senior High School; Michael, 9, is studying in the third grade of Elementary School; and Presley, 2.
 
Rosalin is a seamstress. She has been running the business for two years. Rosalin sews school uniforms, blouses, skirts, curtains and party dresses.  Prior to running the business, Rosalin worked in Malaysia for years. She returned to Indonesia in 2007.
 
Even though her current business is running well, Rosalin wants to initiate another business: a food stall business. She is expecting that from the new  business she will be able to generate more income for her family. Therefore, she needs a loan of IDR 4,000,000. She would like to spend the loan on food stall equipment and ingredients. Rosalin is hoping that TLM will approve her loan application soon.

loans.use: To purchase food stall equipment and ingredients

loans.name: Olga Ines

texts.es:
Olga es una persona que se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora y tener un gran carisma. Olga se encuentra casada y es madre de 2 hijas las cuales ya les ha brindado todo lo necesario, y ya son adultas y se encuentran también casadas. Olga siempre se ha caracterizado por querer ofrecer a las demás personas un mayor bienestar, es por esto que siempre se ha preocupado por sus hijas y su esposo, y es por esto que se esfuerza en su trabajo diariamente. Hace aproximadamente 5 años, debido a la necesidad de generar ingresos para colaborar con su esposo a sostener los gastos de su hogar, Olga montó su negocio de venta de productos a través de catálogos. Olga ofrece a sus clientes productos tanto de uso personal, como productos alimenticios, y de esta manera aporta a su hogar con el sostenimiento de sus gastos. La principal dificultad que presenta Olga es el poco capital con el que cuenta, pues muchas veces sus clientes le hacen pedidos que no puede satisfacer por el poco inventario que mantiene. Con el ánimo de aumentar su inventario para poder satisfacer los grandes pedidos de sus clientes, Olga espera que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de productos de uso personal, y alimentos para aumentar su inventario. 

Olga espera que de esta manera pueda satisfacer los pedidos de sus clientes que son de grandes cantidades. Además, espera que este inventario lo pueda aumentar sin tener que sufrir que sus ingresos mensuales se vean afectados. Olga espera ofrecerle a su esposo una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: Compra de productos de uso personal, y alimentos para aumentar su inventario.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillerma tiene 54 años. Desde hace 16 años vive en casa de su suegra, ubicada en la localidad de Huancayo. Ahí conformó su familia, junto a su esposo Emilio y sus tres hijos, de los cuales, ahora sólo vive con una de ellas, Elizabeth.

Durante las mañanas dedica su tiempo en el cuidado de un baño público que se encuentra ubicado en una zona céntrica de la ciudad. Hace 3 años comenzó con la administración de ese negocio. Ya por las tardes, comienza su principal ingreso económico; desde hace 15 años empezó con la venta de queso, yogurt, mantequilla, manjar blanco, miel de abeja, turrones, tortas de leche, dulces y bebidas de todo tipo. En todo este tiempo logró obtener muchos clientes, por ese motivo ya no camina mucho, sabe a qué clientes tiene que visitar y algunas ocasiones entrega a crédito, pues tiene la confianza de que le pagarán. 

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Las líderes del centro” y este es su octavo crédito con MFP, por lo que agradece el apoyo que recibe de parte de su asociación, pues ahora podrá mejorar su negocio. Promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que quiere continuar trabajando con su asociación.
Guillerma invertirá este dinero en la compra de dulces, bebidas y productos lácteos como mantequilla y yogurt, para los clientes que constantemente le hacen pedidos.
texts.en:
Guillerma is 54 years old.  For 16 years she has lived in the house of her mother-in-law, located in the town of Huancayo.  There she formed her family with her husband Emilio and their three children.  Now she lives with only one of her children, Elizabeth.

During the mornings she spends her time as a public bathroom attendant in the city center.  She started doing this three years ago.  During the afternoons, she starts workng at her main job.  Fifteen years ago she started selling cheese, yogurt, butter, manjar blanco (a type of caramel sauce or pudding), honey, nougats, cakes, sweets and a variety of beverages.

During this time she succeeded in building a strong clientele, and for this reason she no longer needs to sell door-to-door.  She knows that customers will visit and on some occasions she extends credit, as she has the confidence that they will pay her.  She belongs to the group "Las líderes del centro” and this is her eighth loan with MFP.  She is grateful for the support that she gets from the organization, since now she will be able to grow her business.  

She promises to be punctual with her payments since she wants to continue working with the organization.  Guillerma will invest the money in the purchase of sweets, beverages and dairy products such as butter and yogurt for those customers who are constantly placing orders.

loans.use: to buy sweets, beverages and dairy products to sell.

loans.name: Barnaba  Kiptanui

texts.en:
Barnaba was born in Sirwa Village in Nandi, he is married with children. Barnaba has been involved in Motorcycle Taxi Business for three years, he wants to own a motorcycle to support the community health work in his community.

Barnaba  is to be linked with CHW working in Kisumu and will support the community health worker by providing transport on set days, this will give the needed capacity to the CHW to be able to reach many more families during  counseling appointments and health visitation. Barnaba hopes to recruit other members of his youth organization to join in supporting community health outreach programme in his community.

Barnaba will also use the income generated from his motorcycle taxi business to support his family. He hopes to become a CHW volunteer in his community once he has finished paying for his motorcycle

loans.use: To buy Motorcycle for Community Health  Work and Livelihoods

loans.name: Blancanieve

texts.es:
Blancanieve esta muy agradecida por el crédito anterior que ha recibido de Kiva, ya que con ello ha podido surtir su negocio y seguir dando a sus clientes todo lo que necesitan. Ella hoy está casada con el Sr. Ricardo de 29 años con quien trabaja por salir adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de azúcar, arroz, harina, yerba, fideos, etc. y con esto poder seguir surtiendo su despensa y seguir ofreciendo buena variedad a sus clientes. Agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que esta recibiendo ya que le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Blancanieve is very grateful for the previous loan she has received from Kiva. It is because of the loan that she has been able to stock her business and continue giving her customers everything they need. Currently, she is married to Mr. Ricardo, 29, who she works with to get ahead.

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of sugar, rice, flour, herbs, noodles, and other thigs, so that she can continue stocking her store and offering a nice variety for her customers.

She is grateful for this new opportunity she is receiving because it will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, flour, herbs, noodles, and other things for her pantry store.

loans.name: Obidahon

texts.ru: Обидахон, 53 года, замужем. У нее среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается торговлей обувью на рынке. Благодаря упорному труду Обидахон, в обороте есть товар на сумму 400,000 сом (KGS), также ведет сельскохозяйственный бизнес, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 10 коров. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 35,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего торгового бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку обуви для реализации. Доходы от кредита Обидахон планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Obidahon is 24 and married with one daughter. 

Обидахон, 24 года, замужем, есть дочь. У нее среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Барнохон, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы. На 0,50 Га земли, где выращивает лук и картофель, есть 20 кур и индюков. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 14,500 сом (KGS). Барнохон входит в группу "Толкун", в ней состоят еще 2 человека. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы для продажи экологически чистого молока, также удобрений и семян хлопка. Доходы от кредита Барнохон планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение ее бизнеса.

loans.use: to buy shoes for retail sale in her shop

loans.name: Hipolito Antonio

texts.es:
Hipólito vive con su esposa y un hijo menor de edad, su actividad económica es comercializar semilla de marañón y además practica la crianza de cerdos, él está en esté negocio desde hace tres años, los ingresos que le genera son aceptables y puede ir subsistiendo con su familia, ya es reconocido en su localidad por ser una persona responsable y honesta.
Comprará semilla de marañón en mayor cantidad para tener un negocio más competitivo y para que sus clientes se sientan satisfechos con su producto, espera que las ventas e ingresos sean mayores para lograr tener estabilidad económica.
Aspira tener más recursos económicos para disminuir las necesidades de su hogar y transmitir a sus hijos los valores de honestidad y responsabilidad para que se puedan desenvolverse como personas de bien en la sociedad.

loans.use: Comprará semilla de marañón en mayor cantidad para tener un negocio más competitivo y para que sus clientes se sientan satisfechos con su producto

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.en:
Miguel is married, is father of 2 children and lives in the city of Monterry in the State of Neuvo Leon. He started his business selling kids' clothes following a large financial investment. Unfortunately the business did not yield the results he hoped for, and this is how he started to sell groceries in local markets. This busines shas given him the results he hoped for. Thanks to his dedication and his hard work, he has been able to provide his children with the needed education, that without this business would not have been possible.

Today Miguel requires a loan in the amount of $250, that he will invest in the purchase of more merchandise to increase his sales. Help him, he needs your generosity. Do not wait, he and his family will thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Miguel es casado y padre de 2 hijos, el vive en la localidad de Monterrey, en el estado de Nuevo León, él inició con un negocio de venta de ropa para niños invistiendo una fuerte cantidad de dinero, sin embargo el negocio no dio los resultados esperados, es por ello que empezó a vender mercancía de abarrotes en los mercados rodantes, actividad que le ha dado los resultados esperados. Gracias a su dedicación y trabajo ha podido brindarles a sus hijos la educación necesaria, que sin esta actividad hubiera sido imposible.

En estos momentos Miguel requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 250 DLLS, mismos que invertirá en la compra de más mercancía para poder de esta forma incrementar sus ventas. Ayúdalo, el necesita de tu generosidad, no lo dudes más, él y su familia te lo van a agradecer.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Vaimutia

texts.en: Vaimutia lives in a small village by the sea.  While Vaimutia’s husband has a full-time job, his small wages do not fully meet the family’s financial needs.  Vaimutia’s husband has a special talent for fishing, and leveraging his talent, Vaimutia and her family have set up a fishing business to generate additional income to support their family.  As manager of the family business, Vaimutia has decided to seek a loan to purchase new fishing nets.  The new nets should increase their fishing yield and thereby provide a direct, necessary boost to her family’s income.

loans.use: Purchase new fishing nets

loans.name: Rubenia

texts.en:
My name is Rubenia M. and I produce and sells tortillas. I have had my business for about three years. My clients are very good because I sell my product at different stores around my town and they also make orders for their meetings and parties. Mi goal is to increment mi inventory to increase production and be able to provide sustenance for my family with the earnings I make.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Rubenia M. me dedico a la produccion y venta de tortillas tengo mi negocio hace unos 3 años, mis clientes son muy buenos porque vendo mi producto en diferentes pulperias de mi localidad y me hacen encargos para reuniones y fiestas. mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener una mayor produccion y con las ganancias que obtenga poder sustentar mi familia.

loans.use: purchase corn flour, cal, salt, fire wood, water, matches

loans.name: Suemi Carely

texts.es:
Suemi is a very hard-working and responsible woman. Six years ago she started selling jewellery because her husband was very ill and therefore could not work and they could not pay off their debts. Unfortunately her husband died a short while ago, and in order to give her kids what they need Suemi continued with her business, and this is how her family has kept going.

With her experience in this business, Suemi knows that now is a good time to sell, and in order to meet her clients’ demands she needs a loan of $375 which she will repay over a period of 4 months. Suemi thanks you for the opportunity that you can give her to improve and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Suemi es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, desde hace seis años se dedica a la venta de alhajas, inició su negocio porque su esposo enfermaba constantemente, le dificultaba trabajar y no se podían solventar las deudas familiares, lamentablemente su esposo falleció al poco tiempo y para poder brindarle a sus tres hijos todo lo necesario Suemi continuó con su negocio, esta es la manera como ella ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia.

Con la experiencia que tiene en este negocio Suemi sabe que está por iniciar una buena temporada de ventas y para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes está solicitando un crédito por $375 dólares que se compromete a regresar en 4 meses. Suemi agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas de mejorar y hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Sharif

texts.en:
Sharif was born in the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict territory Gubadli region, which is situated in the west part of Azerbaijan Republic. He is 44 years old and is the father of three children. Right now he lives with his family in Sumgayit city, situated in the east part of Azerbaijan.

In 2004 Sharif borrowed $400 from Normicro, and expanded his business by buying an assortment of goods and gifts. At first, he was selling only creams, lotions, perfumes, shampoo, etc.  which earned little money. It provided only some of his family's basic needs.

With the loan he has expanded to a variety of different things such as: creams, lotions, perfumes, shampoo, bags, briefcases, gifts and more. Sharif would like to increase his work area by dividing the area into two parts. On one side he would like  to sell creams, lotions, perfumes, shampoo, soaps etc.,and on the other side bags, pictures, gifts and etc. 

He would like to borrow an $800 loan. With this loan he wants to expand his trading area, increase his business and improve his family conditions. He believes with the  change he can pay off monthly payments very easily. Sharif will repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To expand his trading , increase his business and improve his family conditions

loans.name: Avelino Cadeira

texts.pt:
Location: Picoco Client: Avelino Cadeira M. Business Sector: Construction Loan Amount: 12.500,00 (500,00US$) Loan Use: Construction Material Purchase Start Date: 10/15/07 End Date: 02/06/09

Avelino Cadeira M. was born in Meluco, a province of Cabo Delgado. He lived with his parents until he as 13 years old. At the age of 14, in 1975, he was drafted by the Frelimo and sent to the Chingueia military base in Nampula. In 1976 he went to Boane, a year later he was sent to Chicualacuala where he stayed until 1982. He was released in 1986 from his batallion and returned to Cabo Delgado. In 1990 he decided to move to Maputo. In 1991 he started workin for Sosep Oil, a private security company, as a supervisor for customs affairs. In that same year he got his first loan from a new bank. He became aware of HLUVUKU-ADSEMA in 2006 through Mr. Matola Regulo from Boane, and he decided to make contact and ask for his first loan, which was used to purchase construction material. He had no difficulties making the payments. This time he is requesting another loan in the amount of 12.500,00MT that will be used to purchase additional construction material to finish up his job. In the future he wishes to build a small retail store for basic need goods and a place where he can raise chicks.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Avelino Cadeira M., nasceu em Meluco, pronvícia de Cabo Delgado, cresceu e viveu com os pais até os 13 anos. Em 1975, com 14 anos foi capturado pela Frelimo para a base de Chingueia, na provincial de Nampula como militar, em 1976 esteve em Boane, em 1977 em Chicualacuala até 1982. Em 1986 sai de tropa e regressa a Cabo Delgado, onde decidiu regressar a Maputo em 1990 . Em 1991 começa a trabalhar numa empresa de segurança sosep coil como supervisor do projecto das alfândegas. Teve o seu primeiro empréstimo com o Banco novo que oferecia créditos individuais. Conheceu a HLUVUKU-ADSEMA em 2006, através do senhor Matola regulo de Boane, e daí aproximou-se solicitou o seu 1º empréstimo nesta instituição referente a compra de material de construção e pagou-o sem problemas. Veio novamente solicitar um outro empréstimo no valor de 12.500,00MT referente a compra de material de construção para concluir a sua obra. Futuramente pretende construir um pequeno estabelecimento para a venda de produtos de 1ª necessidade e um pavilhão de capoeiras para a criação de pintos.

loans.use: To buy material to build his house for the family

loans.name: Maria Ascencia

texts.es:
Maria Ascencia belongs to the "Las Margaritas Mientras Tanto" interim loan group, she lives in San Martín region, in San Martín province, La Banda de Shilcayo district, her home is at Jr. San Martín Nº 218 - Asociación de Vivienda San Juan, where she also has her business. She sells groceries and drinks and also has a pay phone.

Her husband and children help her with the chores around the house and business, so she has the time to effectively run her business, and she is thankful for the support of the microloans from Manuela Ramos, which enable her to buy groceries in large quantity and better stock her business in order to satisfy her customers' needs.

With the loan of 1300.00 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy 3 sacks of rice, three of sugar, three cases of noodles, 2 cases of milk, and she will also do improvements to her locale to be able to expand it. In addition, she knows how to sew and part of the loan will be to acquire a sewing machine which will allow her to make clothing to sell in the business.

Maria Ascencia is 41 years old, lives with her husband and two children. She is a woman with many qualities which will enable her business and her family to be successful. She is an example of a woman leader and she has the wish to see the women of her group be successful as she is in every aspect of their lives and she encourages them to take advantage of the opportunities available Manuela Ramos is providing.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria Ascencia pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto “Las Margaritas”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de San Martín, distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo, domiciliada en el Jr. San Martín Nº 218 - Asociación de Vivienda San Juan, donde también funciona su negocio. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y bebidas al por menor y también presta servicios con un teléfono monedero.

Su esposo e hijos la ayudan en las labores de la casa y el negocio, por lo que ella tiene espacio para administrar mejor su negocio, es por eso que agradece el apoyo con los microcréditos que brinda Manuela Ramos, los cuales le sirven para comprar abarrotes en mayor cantidad y surtir más su negocio para así lograr satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,300.00, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará tres sacos de arroz, tres de azúcar, tres cajas de fideo, dos cajas de leche y también hará mejoramientos en su local para poder ampliarlo, además, ella sabe coser y destinará parte del préstamo para adquirir una máquina de coser que le permitirá confeccionar prendas para exhibirlo en su negocio.

La señora María Ascencia tiene 41 años, vive con su esposo y dos hijos. Es una mujer con muchas cualidades para sacar adelante su negocio y a su familia, es un ejemplo de mujer líder y tiene el deseo de ver a las mujeres de su grupo realizadas como ella en todo aspecto en sus vidas y les anima a seguir aprovechando la oportunidad que Manuela Ramos está brindando.

loans.use: Purchase groceries (rice, sugar, noodles, milk, etc.)

location.town: La Banda de Shilcayo - San Martín

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Ms. Julia is 49 years old, she only did the first three years of elementary school. She lives with her two children in the district of Mache, province of Otuzco, department La Libertad. She buys small animals such as guinea pigs, hens, pigs and rams, which she fattens and then she sells them in a fair that opens its doors on Sundays in the city of Julcán. She also sows wheat, barley, corn and swallows and the little that she harvests she sells it or sometimes she uses it for her own consumption. Ms. Julia belongs to the communal bank "Women of Mache", where she obtained the first loan of $100, with this money bought animals, sacks of balanced food and alfalfa. With the loan of $425, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy 8 hens, 10 guinea pigs and 3 rams and balanced food for these animals. Ms. Julia Z.’s wish is to have a grocery store at home.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Julia tiene 49 años de edad, estudió hasta el tercer año de primaria. Vive en el distrito de Mache, provincia de Otuzco, departamento La Libertad, con sus dos hijos que aún dependen de ella. Ella compra animales menores (cuyes, gallinas, cerdos y carneros), los cuales los engorda por un tiempo y los vende en una feria que abre sus puertas los días domingos en Julcán, asimismo se dedica a sembrar trigo, cebada, maíz y papa y lo poco que cosecha aprovecha en venderlo o en ocasiones le sirve para su consumo. La señora Julia pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres de Mache”, aquí obtuvo un primer préstamo S/. 300.00, con este dinero compró animales, sacos de alimento balanceado y alfalfa. Con el préstamo de S/.1,200.00, el cual pagará en 4, comprará 8 gallinas, 10 cuyes y 3 carneros y algo de alimento balanceado para estos animales. El sueño que tiene la señora Julia Z. es poner una tienda surtida en su domicilio.

loans.use: Buy chickens, guinea pigs and rams.

loans.name: Nhom Chi Thuy - Vong Nguyet - Tam Giang Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Thuy, 31 years old, has 2 children who are going to school. Her main activity is breeding pigs. Her husband does rice-husking and works on rice field. Her average income is 6.25 USD/day. She wants to borrow 150 USD to buy more pig mash. Mrs. P. Thi Hoa, wants to do vendoring activity. Mrs. N. Thi Ha wants to buy more duck-feed. Mrs. C. Thi Lam borrows money to sell dried food. Mrs. N. Thi Tan wants to buy wasted-metal material.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Thuý, 31 tuổi, có hai con đang đi học. Chị làm nghề chăn nuôi lợn. Chồng chị làm nghề xát gạo và làm ruộng. Thu nhập trung bình của chị khoảng 100000 đồng/ ngày. Chị vay 2006000 đồng để thêm vốn chăn nuôi lợn (mua thức ăn cho lợn). Cô Phạm Thị Hoà vay vốn để bán hàng xén. Chị Ngô Thị Hà vay vốn để mua cám và thức ăn cho vịt. Chị C. Thị Lâm vay vốn để bán hàng khô. Chị Ngô Thị Tân vay vốn để đi chợ sắt.

loans.use: breeding animals , vendoring, food shop, buy wasted material

loans.name: Pon

texts.en:
Mrs. Pon N., 41, owns a plot of farmland where she grows a variety of vegetables. She makes an average of about $4 a day in profit. Her husband, Mr. Thon Krat, age 42, works as a construction worker building houses. He earns around $5 a day. They have four children, two of whom are married and live away from home. Two others work in a garment factory with a salary $100 each a month.

She needs this loan to purchase wood, cement and construction tools to repair her house.

loans.use: She hopes to use this loan to renovate her house.

loans.name: Parween

texts.en: Parween lives in district 10 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is educated, married, and the mother of three children. Her husband is a shopkeeper and she is a tailor. She wants to help her husband and her family so she has requested an individual loan to buy new machines for her small tailoring business so as to help her family and help her husband. She is happy with this  process of small loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy new machines

loans.name: Emilienne

texts.fr:
Born June 6th, 1977 in the town of Savi, in Ouidah Commune, Mrs. Emilienne A. is married and the mother of three children. She is also responsible for two family helpers who assist with her daily activities. A hair stylist by trade, at the same time she manages sales of cosmetic products that complement her business such as hair extensions, beauty products, etc. She is currently having trouble meeting her customer’s needs and is therefore seeking a loan to satisfy them.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 06 juin 1977 à SAVI dans la commune de OUIDAH, dame A. Emilienne est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle a à sa charge deux domestiques qui l’aident dans ses activités quotidiennes. Coiffeuse de profession, elle mène parallèlement à celle-ci la vente des produits cosmétiques rentrant en ligne de compte pour son activité tels que les mèches, les produits de beauté et autres. Actuellement elle éprouve des difficultés pour satisfaire de sa clientèle. Pour cela elle sollicite ce prêt afin de satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase of bulk hair extensions, various hair styling accessories, and 50,000 francs CFA to complete the purchase of a refrigerator

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. is a forty one year old divorced mother with seven children. According to Ama, her husband divorced her six years ago, leaving her with the total responsibility of the children. By dint of hard work, she has supported one of the children in finishing vocational school. Another one has successfully completed a learning apprenticeship, while the rest are in school. She sells frozen beef, chicken, fish and palm oil at the local market.

She wants to use the loan to buy an additional refrigerator to increase her stock of beef, chicken, fish and palm oil, as well as to expand her business. She believes that with increased income, she would be more capable of financing her children’s education and be able to provide them with life opportunities that are better than what she had. She belongs to the community group called “Megyefo Tease” (My Redeemer lives) Trust Group, and her photograph was captured at her group meeting. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral to access loans, and peer pressure to repay the loan

loans.use: To buy an additional refrigerator to increase stock of beef, chicken, fish and palm oil.

loans.name: Thi Hien's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi Hien (ID Number 03110006), born in 1979, would like to borrow 3,180,000VND to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell. Her husband, like many other men in the village, is a factory worker in the steel and iron factory in Da Hoi, Dong Anh, Ha Noi city, thus earning stable income. Besides, Mrs. Hien sells fruits and vegetables in the market, so her family's average monthly income is about 3,500,000VND (about 225USD). She has 2 small children. With her current income, she can easily repay the loan on an installment basis. Her group also consists of:

Mrs. Nguyen Thi Su (ID Number 03110036), born in 1973, would like to borrow 3,180,000VND to invest in breeding pigs.

Mrs. Nguyen Thi Boc (ID Number 03110040), born in 1954, would like to borrow 1,972,000VND to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.

Mrs. Nguyen Thi Huong (ID Number 03110041), born in 1984, would like to borrow 1,972,000VND to invest in her cafe.

Mrs. Do Thi Mai (ID Number 03110037), born in 1977, would like to borrow 2,436,000VND to invest in her souvenir shop.

The total amount requested is 775USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

N. Thị Hiền (Ms 03110006), sinh năm 1979, mức vay:3.180.000 vnđ để đầu tư đi chợ. Đàn ông trong làng chị thường đi làm ở xưởng sắt tại Đa Hội, Đông Anh, Hà Nội, và chồng chị cũng vậy, hàng ngày anh vẫn đi làm sắt có thu nhập ổn định, bản thân chị vẫn đi chợ buôn bán hoa quả.Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 3.500.000 vnđ/tháng.Vợ chồng chị có hai con nhỏ, với mức thu nhập hiện tại thì việc hoàn trả vốn dần là rát dễ dàng và phù hợp với gia đình chị.Trong nhóm chị còn có: N. Thị Sử (Ms 03110036), sinh năm 1973, mức vay: 3.180.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn. N. Thị Bốc (Ms 03110040), sinh năm 1954, mức vay: 1.972.000 vnđ để đi chợ hoa quả. N. Thị Thu Hường (Ms 03110041), sinh năm 1984, mức vay: 1.1972.000 vnđ để đầu tư cửa hàng giải khát. Đỗ Thị Mai (Ms 03110037), sinh năm 1977, mức vay: 2.436.000 vnđ để đầu tư bán đồ lưu niệm.

loans.use: Selling fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Hanifa Nansubuga’S Group

texts.en:
Hanifa is a leader of a 5-member group. She is a 34-year-old woman who is divorced with 4 children. They are aged between 16 and 4 years. They are all in school. She rents a two-room house in which she lives with six people. There is piped water and electricity. She resides and works in a semi-urban and slum area in the outskirts of Kampala.

Hanifa works seven days a week in Owino market in the center of Kampala. It's one of the biggest markets downtown where she rents a space to sell second-hand men’s trousers, a trade she has handled for over 2 years. She started with second-hand shoes. She buys them from wholesale shops and uses porters to carry the bales on their heads to Owino market. There is a market for her merchandise, and she serves both men and women wholesale and retail.

Her main challenge is the rainy season, which makes storage of her trousers difficult because the stores fill with water. This also complicates movement to and from her stall as the ground is always covered with mud, thus reducing profits in this season. There is a risk of buying a bale full of substandard clothes, which are rejected, thus lowering profits. She sometimes fails to get proceeds for the goods that she sells on credit, due to lack of integrity on the part of her clients.

After being with MCDT for 4 years and repaying 8 loans, Hanifa boasts of improved standards of living like providing her family with 3 meals a day and expanded business and income. Her major aspiration is seeing her business grow bigger so that she earns more profits.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savoeun M. (shown in the picture on the left with her niece), 51, is a widow with three children: one son and two daughters. Besides her children, she has two nieces living with her. Her son is a construction worker and one daughter works in a plywood factory. The younger daughter studies in a local school. Her two nieces are assisting in her business. The family lives along National Road Number Six about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Savoeun has been selling Unsorm (a kind of Khmer cake made from banana, coconut, and sticky rice) for two years. She makes the cakes at her home and sells them around her village and a nearby village. Now she wants to create another business for her nieces to sell fruit. Therefore Savoeun is requesting a loan of $350 to purchase fruit for her nieces to sell, and to buy more material to make cakes to sell.

loans.use: To purchase fruit for resale and to purchase material to make cakes to sell.

loans.name: Kimsean

texts.en: Mrs. Kimsean U., 52, has raised pigs from her house for the past two years and earns approximately US$5.00. She has six children, two of whom are married and the others are at home. Kimsean is married to Mr. Shiyang Yab, 55, a commune adviser. Both are living in Somrong Commune, Kandal Province. Kimsean needs to expand her business to increase her income to reduce her daily expenses. Hence, she seeks a loan of US$200 in order to purchase piglets and she'll use the remainder of the loan to buy more pig food to fatten her pigs.

loans.use: Kimsean would like to purchase piglets and pig food to raise & sell pigs.

loans.name: Vusala

texts.en:
Vusala (her brother is pictured) was born in 1978. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan's Fuzuli town and lives in the Fuzuli region's Kayidish village, which is built for IDPs.
Vusala is married and has one child. She and her brother sell electrical goods. Now they need a loan of 800 AZN to buy  stoves, electric irons, etc. for improving their business.

loans.use: to buy  stoves, electric irons

loans.name: Soliman

texts.en: Soliman lives in district 16 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 29 years old and is married with two children who are enrolled in school. He has got a catering shop through which he earns money and supports his family. He wants to expand his work to have good income,so he has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afs to buy more materials. He is happy with this process which helps all Afghan entrepreneurs.

loans.use: buying more materials for his business

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Im A. is 49 years old and lives in Kompong Tom province. He owns and runs a horse-cart taxi, providing his service for passengers or merchandise transportation. He cA. earn A. income of $3 a day to help meet his family's expenses. He is married with eight children; seven of them are single and another one is married who lives away from home. Three of his children are employed as construction workers at the Thailand Country. His wife is a rice farmer and also is a good housewife.

Recently, A. cannot attract his clients as before because his old cart is often broken. Thus he decided to ask for a loA. to buy a new cart to replace the old one, and also to order rice to store and then sell for a profit. He is shown in the photo with his family.

loans.use: To buy a cart to replace an old one.

loans.name: Geraida Nakiganda  ‘S Group

texts.en:
Geraida is the leader of a 5-member group. She is a 38-year-old married woman with 5 children aged between 4 and 18. All her children go to school. She takes care of 2 additional family members. She resides in and owns a three-roomed house where she is living with eight people. They have electricity but no piped water at home The family gets three meals a day.

Geraida works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. She deals in rice which she buys from farmers and sells both retail and wholesale at her home in Mengo Mackay, which is one of the city suburbs. Geraida works seven days a week and incurs high transport costs She sells to an average of 15 customers a day and sells to all categories of people. She is faced with a challenge in the rainy season, has to deal with transportation which reduces her profits, and the defaulting of her would-be customers.

Geraida has been in this business for the last eight years and has been a member of MCDT for three years, servicing her tenth loan, working all this long time with the same group mates. Geraida’s monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family. She wants to use this loan to have a permanent place for her business so that she could sell wholesale only.

loans.use: To have a permanent place for her business

loans.name: Mr. Chhorn Prum Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank, which consists of fourteen members, is located in Saeprambei village in Kampong Cham province and they plan to use the loan which they obtained for different purposes. Mr. Chhorn P. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. He is a laborer in the local village. His wife, Mrs. Mouk Sameith, is a housewife. Although they try to work hard, they still live in poor conditions. In order to provide a better life for their family, Mr. Chhorn P. wants to start a business purchasing general goods to re-sell to earn more income. Mr. Chhorn P. is 60 years old and the father of a child who is a laborer.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy general goods to re-sell.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: La Sra. María Isabel vive en la zona de Villa Victoria, un barrio popular de la ciudad de La Paz. Trabaja con Emprender desde el 14 de Julio de 2007, en sus inicios trabajó solicitando créditos en bancos comunales donde su desempeño con respecto a su historial crediticio fue excelente. La cliente se dedica a la repostería haciendo pan y tortas, galletas y repostería en general en su propio domicilio, en el cual vive junto a su hermana y madre y su pequeño hijo ya que es madre soltera. Con esaactividad  sustenta su hogar ya que juntamente a su hermana, son quienes se hacen cargo de todos los gastos familiares. Tiene la aspiración de poder ahorrar y solicitar un nuevo crédito para instalar su panadería en un local más comercial en el cual pueda incrementar su venta.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel lives in Villa Victoria, a highly-populated neighborhood in La Paz. She has been working with Emprender since July 14th, 2007.
