She began seeking loans at community banks where she distinguished herself due to her excellent credit history. Maria Isabel runs a confectionary within her house, dedicating herself to making bread, cakes, cookies, as well as general bakery items. She's a single mom who lives with her child, as well as her mom and sister. Maria and her sister provide for the financial needs of the entire house and family. She hopes to use the money she has saved -- plus funds from an additional loan -- to open a bakery in a more commercial area, which will allow her to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To open a bakery

loans.name: Numa

texts.en:
Numa J.  is currently in the business of selling at the hotel and is requesting a loan to buy food items for the hotel. Numa is 25 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Buy food items

loans.name: Dora Sabina

texts.es:
La señora Dora Sabina B. D. V. tiene 50 años, vive en Asentamiento Humano Aurora Díaz, distrito D. Salaverry, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió la carrera D. auxiliar D. enfermería pero no ejerció debido a que salió embarazada y se dedico a su hogar. Tiene 03 hijos D. cuales solo 01 depenD. económicamente D. ella.
Dora se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza y cerveza, inicio vendiendo ropa hace 3 años luego inicio la venta D. cerveza y hace 1 año también se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza, con las ganancias que obtuvo a comprado una vitrina para exhibir sus productos D. belleza. Su negocio lo desarrolla en su propio domicilio. 
Con el primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su banco comunal “Las Auroras en Acción II”, lo invirtió en la compra D. ropa interior para la venta. 
Con el crédito D. 1500 soles, que será cancelado en  6 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra D. cervezas y gaseosas, así como D. productos D. belleza.
Dora sueña con tener una bodega en su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dora Sabina Beltran D. V. is 50 years old and lives in the settlement of Aurora Diaz, district of Salaverry, province of Trujillo, in the region of La Libertad, Peru. She studied to be a nurse’s aiD., but did not complete it owing to the fact that she became pregnant and dedicated herself to her home. She has three children of which one is financially dependent on her. Dora is in the sale of beauty products and beers. She started selling clothes three years ago and later started selling beer, and for one year she has also been selling beauty products. With the earnings she obtained she bought a display cabinet for displaying her beauty products. She runs her business in her home.

Her first loan of 300 PEN, which she received from her communal bank “Las Auroras in Action II” (The Dawns in Action II), she invested in the purchase of underclothes to sell. This loan of 1500 PEN, which she will pay in six months, she will invest in the purchase of beer and sodas, as well as beauty products. Dora dreams of having a grocery store in her house.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of beer and sodas, as well as beauty products

loans.name: Uzmee

texts.en: Uzmee T. is a widow and lives with her 9-year-old son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her son goes to a local high school. In 1997, she decided to move to Ulaanbaatar from Gobi-Altai, one of the least populated provinces in Mongolia. As soon as she came to the capital city, she started a small retail business selling handbags and suitcases. She rented a small stall in the Narantuul market, the largest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar, and started selling handbags and suitcases. She frequently travels to Ereen, a Chinese border town where many products are imported from, and purchases products to sell at her stall. Her dream is to afford to send her only son to a good university. She would like to make sure that her son receives a better education than she was able to have. She requests a loan to purchase more summer season handbags for women as the season approaches.

loans.use: To purchase summer season handbags for women.

loans.name: Bashiran Muhammad Ali Group

texts.en:
Rasheedan baji and Hanifan baji each want a loan to buy wood to sell.

Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy decorative material (beads, colored thread and clothes).

Sugran baji wants a loan to buy cotton to sell.

Mumtaz baji wants a loan to buy beams for her shuttering business.

Rehana kosar baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit-selling business.

Bashiran baji is the wife of M. A. who has lived in a city named Kasur, Pakistan for the past ten years. Kasur city is famous for its sweetmeats and for its shrines. Her husband runs a construction supplies business and has three years of experience in this business.

Bashiran baji is the group leader of the above mentioned ladies. She operates a decorative embroidery business. She prepares embroidered dresses on orders which she collects from her community. She is applying for a loan to buy construction supplies to increase her husband’s profit.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies to increase her husband's profit

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
Sheryl O. is from the town of Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 18 years old. Sheryl is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Sheryl owns & operates an "ala carte business" selling grilled chicken and pork meat. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling grilled meat to the local community. Sheryl is just starting this business.

In 2009, Sheryl joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sheryl is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Sheryl from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima D. is from the village of Poblacion 4, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Fatima is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Fatima owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Fatima has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Fatima joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fatima has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4500 PHP from GDMPC. Fatima is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Fatima from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Дилафруз 7 лет является клиентом нашей организации. Ее аптека находится около рынка Костакоз. Она продает лицензионные лекарства, на которые стабильно большой спрос. В период кредитования она расширила ассортимент товаров и теперь у нее стало больше покупателей. Дилафруз рада, что полученный кредит улучшил благосостояние семьи. Дилафруз решила брать следующий займ и распределить его следующим образом: 1500 сомони на средства от диареи и по 750 сомони на лекарства для будущих мам и для малышей.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Dilafruz has been a client of our organization for seven years. Her pharmacy is located near the Kostakoz market. She sells licensed medicine which are in high demand. During her credit history she has increased the assortment of her products and now she has more customers. Dilafruz is happy that her new loan will improve the wellbeing of her family. Dilafruz decided to get her next loan and disburse it in this way: 1500 somoni will go towards anti-diarrhea medicine and parts for 750 somoni on the prenatal medicines for new moms and their babies.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy medicine

loans.name: Dinah Jepkemboi

texts.en:
Dinah Jepkemboi is a 40-year-old mother of three, married to Mr Barmau. She operates a dairy business at Kapsoio farm, on the outskirts of Eldoret, a major agricultural town in Western Kenya. Dinah was introduced to KADET by a member of her current borrowers' group.

Dinah has been in agribusiness for the past nine years now. With the loan from KADET, she intends to pay casual labourers to prepare the planting holes for more passion fruits. In addition, she will procure more animal feed for her dairy cows.

In future she hopes to expand her dairy farming and passion fruits production, hoping this will result in improved revenues and thus enable her pay to educate her children at higher learning institutions.

About KADET

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To pay for farm labour and animal feed

loans.name: Dupe

texts.en: Dupe is 35 years old and married with 2 children who are in school. She sells palm oil and has been in the business for long. She is requesting for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more palm oil to sell.  She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil to sell

loans.name: United Family Group

texts.en:
Varnie is a 41-year-old man living in remote Kolahu city in rural Lofa county, Liberia. Varnie’s business is selling food items retail, including palm oil, meat, etc., which he buys wholesale locally and in neighboring Guinea.  He sells to the farming community from his temporary market stall alongside approximately 100 other vendors of various trades.  He has been running his business for four years. 

Varnie is married with two children, ages 2 and 7. He is also taking care of two children orphaned in the war. His eldest is in first grade. Varnie is a high school graduate. 

Varnie is taking out a loan to increase his inventory sufficiently so that he can serve more customers.  With the profits, he dreams of first having a larger market stall and ultimately building a more permanent shop. He is investing in the future of his children, especially their schooling, which he was fortunate to complete. 

United Family is a group of 5 borrowers, led by Varnie N., living in Kolahu, Lofa County – the breadbasket of Liberia.

loans.use: To buy palm oil and meat

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is already 43 years old and she is married to Nestor, a farmer.  They have four children and two of them are still studying. The two eldest children just finished their secondary education and now helping their father in the farm. Their family lives peacefully in the village of Punit, Benito Soliven, Isabela.

Yolanda has been into retailing their produced vegetable products in San Mariano Public Market for already five years. Sometimes, Yolanda also buys her neighbors produce vegetables in their farm and gardens and will later sell at a higher price to earn income. She is hoping to acquire additional revolving capital for the growth of her vending business. She could buy more vegetables with more capital thus will increase her income. If given the chance to avail a loan, she will also use it in purchasing vegetable seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her vegetable garden. Yolanda therefore is asking for financial amount of PHP4, 000 for further development of her vending business.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate her business place

loans.name: Edmar

texts.en:
Edmar O. is from the village of San Carlos, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 37 years old. Edmar is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Edmar owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling sugar, rice, salt shampoo, soap and etc. in the local community. Edmar has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Edmar joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edmar has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to improve and expand her business. Edmar is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell in the local community. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Edmar from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell in the local community

loans.name: Mariama Malang

texts.fr: Mariama Malang M. a 45 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KANDE BANETO depuis 7 ans et demi, elle a une bonne expérience avec le crédit. Son activité consiste à acheter des régimes de bananes et les revendre au détail en faisant du porte à porte. Elle participe aux charges familiales à partir des bénéfices qui résultent de cette activité.
texts.en:
Mariama Malang M., age 45, is married and the mother of 8 children. She's been a member of the village bank of Kande Baneto for seven and a half years, and her past loan experiences went well. Her business consists in buying bunches of bananas and in retailing them door to door. With her profits, she contributes to the household expenses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her business (selling bananas)

loans.name: Véronique

texts.fr: O. Véronique est née le 10 Juin 1963 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Mariée à HOUNGAVOU Ernest un chauffeur, Véronique est mère de trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Véronique vit avec ses enfants et son mari à Djeffa dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin, depuis 5 ans. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Véronique n'a pas été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Véronique vend des fagots de bois et aussi du charbon de bois à son domicile. C'est depuis cinq ans que Véronique mène cette activité. Véronique s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est la première fois que Véronique sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d'augmenter son fonds de roulement et de renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
O. Véronique was born on June 10th, 1963 in Porto-Novo, the governmental capital of Benin. Véronique is married to Houngavou Ernest, who is a driver. Véronique is the mother of three children, all of whom are attending school. For the past 5 years, Véronique has lived with her children and husband in Djeffa, in the district of Sèmè-Podji, in Benin. Together the couple pays for their family's expenses. Véronique did not attend school. To provide for her family's needs, Véronique sells bundles of sticks of wood and coal from her home. Véronique has run this business for the past 5 years. Véronique supplies herself in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. This is the first time that Véronique has requested a loan from ALIDé, she is requesting the loan in order to grow the funds for her business and strengthen her business.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase firewood in bulk

loans.name: Sherifatu

texts.en:
Sherifatu is 48 years old and married with 6 children.

Sherifatu sells charcoal and firewood to make a living in her community in Lagos State, Nigeria. The demands for her charcoal and firewood are high because there are people in her community that cannot afford to use a stove or cooking cylinders. She hopes to be a distributor of firewood in the future.

She is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. She hopes for a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more charcoal and firewood to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal and firewood to sell

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: Catalina tiene 38 años, vive sola en su casa propia, ya que sus hijos estudian y son independientes.Desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza. Durante  las mañanas realiza las  labores de su  hogar, deja todo listo  y en las tardes dispone de tiempo para salir a ofrecer sus productos, los cuales son muy solicitados por sus amigas del vecindario ya que ella se esmera casi  siempre por traer novedades y además tiene  un gran poder de convencimiento y  aconseja a sus clientes sobre los colores y diseños que les favorecen, es por estas razones  que todas las compradoras  sienten un gran afecto hacia ella , y esto la impulsa a seguir mejorando para  hacer crecer su negocio.Es su primer crédito con MFP y promete  ser muy puntual en todos sus pagos.Con el dinero del crédito comprará mayor cantidad de productos de belleza para obtener mayores ganancias, ahora que es campaña navideña.
texts.en:
Catalina is 38 years old and since her children are students and live independently, she lives alone in her own house. As of 8 years ago she has been in the business of selling beauty products. During the mornings she does her house work and gets everything ready. In the afternoon she makes time to go out and sell her products, which are in high demand among her friends in the neighborhood since she strives to almost always bring new products. Also, she has great powers of persuasion and advises her clients on the colors and designs that suit them best. For these reasons all her customers feel great affection for her, and this drives her to continue improving her business to make it grow. This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to be very punctual in all her payments. With the money from the loan she will purchase larger quantities of beauty products in order to obtain greater profits now that it is the Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Tobin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy larger quantities of merchandise

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en:
Ruta  T. is 47 and married with 5 children (ages 11 - 21 years).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Ruta  has many years of experience in this business.  Ruta  needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 285 tala or US $119 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Ruta  joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Ruta 's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Ruta  T. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.89 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.5 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated. For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.en: Encarnacion E. is from the village of Anakan, Gingoog City. She is 59 years old. Encarnacion is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Encarnacion runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Encarnacion has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 4,640 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Encarnacion joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Encarnacion has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. Encarnacion is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the second loan taken out by Encarnacion from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: María Ángel

texts.es: María ángel H. D. G. D. 39 años D. edad, resiD. en el Municipio D. Sensuntepeque, ubicado en el departamento D. Cuscatlán. Vive junto a su familia la cual esta conformada por su esposo quien se dedica a trabajar como motoristas D. buses del trasporte público, y junto a sus dos hijos, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. María posee una venta D. tortillas y una pupusería, las tortillas las elabora en la mediodía, y las pupusas por las tarD., D. esta manera, ella ha podido obtener ganancias, las cuales le han permitido sostener su hogar junto a su esposo. Es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar maíz por mayor, D. esta manera ella podrá elaborar mayor cantidad D. productos, los cuales tienen mucha demanda en el lugar por la calidad con la que María los elabora. Lo que más anhela María es mejorar las condiciones D. su negocio D. manera que le genere mayores ganancias y D. esta forma brindarle una mejor estabilidad económica a su familia.
texts.en:
María Ángel H. D. G. is 39 years old and a resident of the town of Sensuntepeque, located in the Department of Cuscatlán. She lives with her family that consists of her husband, who works as a public bus driver, and their two school-age children. María has a business selling tortillas and pupusas. She makes the tortillas around noon and then sells pupusas in the afternoons. This is how she is able to earn income to help her husband with maintaining their household.

For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can buy corn in large quantities and continue to make more of her products. Her food is in high demand because of the quality of its preparation. What María wants most is to improve the condition of her business so that she can generate more income and proviD. better financial stability for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn in large quantities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional commodities for her business

loans.name: Cely's Group

texts.en: Cely R. is from the village of Holy Friday, Mallig, Isabela. She is 32 years old and is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Cely R.'s Group. Cely is married and has two school-aged children. She owns and operates a business raising ducks to produce and sell eggs. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Cely joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase poultry feed and other supplies. This loan will be her first from ASKI. Cely plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase poultry feed and other supplies

loans.name: Tang

texts.en: Tang S., 39, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnam Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantation. She and her husband have a business of selling various kinds of groceries for an income of about USD 13.50 per day. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to expand her current business. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. (S.'s husband is pictured.)

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store.

loans.name: Thieb

texts.fr: Thieb D. est âgée de 48 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants en charge. Elle est depuis 3 ans et demi membre du Banc Villageois de KEUR NGALGOU, elle y a été 7 fois de suite bénéficiaire de crédit. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine, avec son nouveau prêt elle va acheter un bœuf pour l'engraisser et le revendre au bout de 4 à 5 mois au niveau des marchés hebdomadaire de sa localité. Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
Thieb D. is 48 years old, married and mother to seven children, who are in her care. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois in KEUR NGALGOU for the past three and a half years and she has had seven consecutive loans. She has a beef fattening activity, and with her new loan she is going to buy an ox to fatten up and resell after four to five months at the weekly markets in her town. Her aim is to contribute to supporting her family.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop and promote her beef fattening activity

loans.name: Sumitra

texts.en:
Mrs. Sumitra S. is a grocery store keeper in the village of Chappagaun, lalitpur. She opened her grocery store to uplift the economic condition of her family. She sells different types of grocery goods, such as rice, maize, noodles, and biscuits, in her shop. Now due to increasing demand for grocery goods in her area she is requesting a 30,000 NPR loan to invest in her shop.

Mrs. Sumitra lives in a single family home with her husband and one daughter. Her husband is a laborer in house construction work, and her daughter is studying in pre-primary school.

loans.use: To buys grocery goods

loans.name: Afiwavi Anastasie

texts.fr:
Cette dame a 37 ans, elle est marié et a un enfant. Pour participer aux charges de sa famille elle fait le commerce de détail de  bijoux, sacs, pagnes, ustensiles de cuisine et basins.
Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé auprès des grossistes. elle revend ensuite ces articles sur un étal en face de l’Institut  Goethe de Lomé.
Le crédit demandé servira à l’achat de 16 pièces de pagnes de haute qualité pour attirer plus de clients.
texts.en:
This lady is 37 years old, and is married with one child. In order to contribute to her family's expenses, she sells jewelery, bags, pagnes [traditional, sarong-like wraparounds], kitchenware and bowls. She gets her supplies from the wholesalers at the large market in Lomé. She then sells her goods from a stall across from the Goethe-Institut in Lomé. The loan requested will help purchase 16 pieces of high-quality pagne in order to attract more clients.

Translated from French by Jessalyn Pinneo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying pagne cloth

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es: Fernando F. V. es padre de un pequeño al que desea dejarle un buen patrimonio para cuando sea grande.  En este momento Fernando tiene su vivienda en construcción, esta poniendo el techo y también enjarrar las paredes, para terminar su proyecto el necesita mas capital pues los ahorros que el tenia ya se agotaron. Por el momento el vive en la casa de su mama que le apoya para que tenga donde habitar mientras el poco a poco va juntando para su patrimonio.
texts.en:
Fernando F. V. has a young son to whom he desires to give a good estate when he is grown. At the moment Fernando is building his house. He is roofing it and plastering the walls. He needs more capital to complete this project because his savings have already been spent. He is currently living in his mother's house which allows him to have somewhere to live while he slowly builds his estate.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Scinta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish the construction of his house.

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Benkadi 3 sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 47ans et en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Nangola, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités hivernales. 
Les spéculations sont le riz, l’arachide et le petit mil. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne et tous les prêts passés se sont bien dénoués.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, Mah Cissé compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir sa superficie culturale.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du village de Nangola et environnants et Dioïla après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 45 000FCFA par campagne.
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi 3 portent toute leur confiance pour le bon déroulement de la campagne hivernale avec l’aide de Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 3 group are married women, on average 47 years old with four children. Most live in polygamous families in Nangola, one of the villages in the Dioïla Prefecture of the Koulikouro region, which belongs to the 2nd administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso MFI to undertake successfully their winter campaign activities. They speculate on rice, ground nuts, and millet. This is their fifth campaign loan, and all previous loans were well reimbursed. With this new loan, Mah Cissé intends to buy seedlings and fertiliser, small farming equipment and pay labor costs to cultivate her arable land. The crops are sold after harvest in Nangola and the adjoining area, and in the town of Dioïla, to both men and women customers. They hope to attain an average profit of 45,000 FCFA per campaign. The women from the Benkadi 3 group put all their trust in a successful progress of this winter campaign, with help from Soro Yiriwaso.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seedlings, fertiliser, small farming equipment and labor costs

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es: Amelia tiene 44 años, es madre soltera y vive con su pequeño hijo de 4 años en su casa que le heredaron sus padres. Hace más de 10 años se dedica a cultivar alfalfa en terrenos que posee, en donde cada mañana corta la alfalfa y venderla en grandes cantidades, a comerciantes y público en el mercado de su localidad. Por tanto procura siempre de cuidarlos de la plaga y otros insectos que afectan a la producción de esta planta. Una de las mayores ventajas de este producto es que produce 3 veces la misma semilla, es así que le resulta rentable este trabajo. Su mayor anhelo es comprar más extensiones de terreno para aumentar su producción de alfalfa. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para sembrar un área más  de terreno con alfalfa.
texts.en:
Amelia is 44 years old. She is a single mother and lives with her 4 year old son in a house that she inherited from her parents. For more than 10 years Amelia has worked cultivating alfalfa on the plots of land she owns. Every morning she cuts the alfalfa and sells it in large quantities to store-keepers and the public in her regional market. For all that she earns she has to protect the plants from the plague and other insects that affect the production of this plant. One of the biggest advantages of alfalfa is that it produces 3 times the seeds, so that the work results in good profits. Amelia's biggest dream is to purchase more plots of land to increase her alfalfa production. This is her sixth loan with MFP, and she is very happy knowing that she has financial support. She has always demonstrated punctuality with her repayments, and she is thankful to be part of her communal group as all the members are very responsible and supportive people. Amelia will invest this loan in the purchase of sacks of fertiliser to plant another area of her land with alfalfa.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertiliser

loans.name: Elsa Normina

texts.es:
Elsa es una madre de familia de 33 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el sector Pacanguilla del distrito de Pacanga, un distrito eminentemente agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Chepén,ubicada en la región La Libertad, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica al alquiler de habitaciones, ella cuenta con cinco habitaciones en su domicilio, las cuales alquila a los trabajadores de la zona, este negocio le permite ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia. El trabaja como capataz en una empresa agrícola de la zona. Juntos tratan de salir adelante y progresar.

Elsa desea arreglar algunas habitaciones para asi poder brindarle a sus inquilinos mayor comodidad, para lograr este objetivo está solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Elsa es una mujer trabajadora y entregada a su familia, su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para apoyar a su esposo y darle a su familia la oportunidad de gozar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elsa is 33 years old. She lives with her husband and their two children in the Pacanguilla sector in the Pacanga district. This is mostly a farming district, which belongs to the Chepén province. It is located in the La Libertad region. It is one hour from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. She rents rooms, and she has five rooms for rent in her home. She rents them to workers in the area. This business allows her to help her husband support her family. Her husband works as a foreman in an agricultural company in the area. Together they try to get ahead and make progress. She wishes to fix up some of the rooms in order to be able to provide her renters with greater comfort. To achieve this objective she is requesting a loan, for the first time, for 1,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Elsa is a hard-working woman, and she is devoted to her family. Her greatest desire is to keep working to help her husband and to give her family the opportunity to enjoy a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fix up rooms in order to rent them

loans.name: Amilyn

texts.en:
Amilyn B. is from the village of Cabisera 5, Baribad. She is 25 years old and married with a baby.  To make a living, Amilyn owns and operates a business raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Amilyn has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Amilyn joined Kiva partner ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amilyn is requesting a first loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  She plans to use the additional revenue to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
Having attained a high school education, Yvonne E., 47, wants to achieve more in life not just for herself, but for her family as well. Yvonne lives in Carmona, Cavite with her husband, Eduardo, who is a machine operator. They have four children, one of whom is working, and the other three are still studying.

Yvonne has been in the business of direct selling, which caters mainly to people near their residence in Carmona. Direct selling of beauty products and other items depends largely on Yvonne's perseverance and social connections. Yvonne and Eduardo gather a net income of Php3,300 monthly, which they use to meet the needs of the entire family.

Yvonne admits that she needs a Php15,000 loan to enhance her business and increase her profits. She applied through CCT* for this loan, which she plans to use to purchase advance orders for her clients and additional stock for her variety store. Basically, the loan will serve as additional capital that will enable Yvonne to make her business more profitable and lead to more savings.

At present, Yvonne also experiences problems and challenges in her business, especially in collecting receivables. Still, Yvonne is determined not to be swayed by these struggles and aims to make her business grow. More importantly, she dreams of seeing her children finish their studies and be used as one family for the glory of the Lord whom they serve.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase advance orders for her customers, and grocery items for her variety store.

loans.name: Florentino

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”;  Este banco está situado en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco; situado a 45 minutos de la ciudad.

El socio Florentino; el socio tiene 43 años el es casado y tiene 3 hijos, El socio trabaja como gasfitero en diferentes obras, el también presta sus servicios particulares a casas, el socio también tiene su terreno y siembra papas, maíz, habas. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de herramientas de gasfitería.

El socio  agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This client belongs to the communal bank, Nueva Victoria – Chinchero. The bank is located in the district of Chinchero, which belongs to the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco, located 45 minutes from the city.

Florentino is 43 years old, married, and has 3 children. He works as a plumber on different projects and he also offers his private services to homes. He also has his own land and plants potatoes, corn, and beans. He is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of plumbing tools.

He is grateful for the loan and promises to make his payments in the stipulated timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase plumbing tools

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 35 years old. She is married and she has one child, age 14, who is in school. Rose works as a cleaner and her husband drives a motorcycle taxi for a living. This loan will be used to buy motorcycle spare parts.  

She says that the business is successful because her husband is clean and he has good customer care. With the profits from the business, she and her husband hope to buy a piece of land and to complete their house.

loans.use: Motorcycle spare parts
